unused, other than those of heading\u00a04907\n\n\n\n\nFree\n\n\n\n\n0\n\n\n\n\n\n\n97050000\n\n\n\n\nCollections and collector\u2019s pieces of zoological, botanical, mineralogical, anatomical, historical, archaeological, palaeontological, ethnographic or numismatic interest\n\n\n\n\nFree\n\n\n\n\n0\n\n\n\n\n\n\n97060000\n\n\n\n\nAntiques of > 100 years old\n\n\n\n\nFree\n\n\n\n\n0\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nTop  \n\n\n\n\n\n\nEUROPEAN COMMISSION\nBrussels, 4.4.2016\nCOM(2016) 173 final\nANNEX\nto the\nProposal for a Council Decision\non the signing, on behalf of the European Union, and provisional application of the Protocol of Accession to the Trade Agreement  between the European Union and its Member States, of the one part, and Colombia and Peru, of the other part, to take account of the Accession of Ecuador\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nANNEX IV\n\n\nThe following shall be inserted as 'Section D' after Section C in Annex I, Appendix 1:\n\n\n'SECTION D\n\n\nSCHEDULE FOR THE ELIMINATION OF ECUADORIAN TARIFFS FOR GOODS ORIGINATING FROM THE EUROPEAN UNION\n\n\nUnless otherwise distinctly stated in the Tariff Elimination Schedule of Ecuador, the following staging categories shall apply in accordance with article 22 (Elimination of Customs Duties) of Title III (Trade in Goods) of this Agreement.\n\n\n1.Customs duties on goods originating in the European Union (hereinafter referred to as \"originating goods\") corresponding to the tariff lines in staging category \u201c0\u201d shall be completely eliminated as of the date this Agreement enters into force.\n\n\n2.Customs duties on originating goods provided for in the tariff lines in staging category \u201c3\u201d shall be eliminated in four equal stages, beginning on the date this Agreement enters into force; the remaining stages, shall be made on 1 January of the successive years, and such goods shall thereafter be free of any customs duty.\n\n\n3.Customs duties on originating goods provided for in the tariff lines in staging category \u201c5\u201d shall be eliminated in six equal stages, beginning on the date this Agreement enters into force; the remaining stages, shall be made on 1 January of the successive years, and such goods shall thereafter be free of any customs duty.\n\n\n4.Customs duties on originating goods provided for in the tariff lines in staging category \u201c7\u201d shall be eliminated in eight equal stages, beginning on the date this Agreement enters into force; the remaining stages, shall be made on 1 January of the successive years, and such goods shall thereafter be free of any customs duty.\n\n\n5.Customs duties on originating goods provided for in the tariff lines in staging category \u201c10\u201d shall be eliminated in eleven equal stages, beginning on the date this Agreement enters into force; the remaining stages, shall be made on 1 January of the successive years, and such goods shall thereafter be free of any customs duty.\n\n\n6.Customs duties on originating goods provided for in the tariff lines in staging category \u201c15\u201d shall be eliminated in sixteen equal stages beginning on the date this Agreement enters into force; the remaining stages, shall be made on 1 January of the successive years, and such goods shall thereafter be free of any customs duty.\n\n\n7.Originating goods provided for in the staging category \u201cE\u201d are exempt from any commitments related to customs duties.\n\n\n8.Customs duties on originating goods subject to the Price Stabilization Mechanism (hereinafter referred to as \"MEP\") provided for in the tariff lines in staging category \u201cIB\u201d, shall be progressively eliminated. For the purposes of tariff elimination, the base rate shall be the least of the base rate in the tariff elimination schedule or the MFN duty applied. This elimination shall be carried out in four equal stages, beginning on the date this Agreement enters into force; the remaining stages, shall be made on 1 January of the successive years, and such goods shall thereafter be free of any customs duty.\n\n\n9.Customs duties on originating goods subject to MEP provided for in the tariff lines in staging category \u201cIC\u201d, shall be progressively eliminated. For the purposes of tariff elimination, the base rate shall be the least of the base rate in the tariff elimination schedule or the MFN duty applied. This elimination shall be carried out in six equal stages, beginning on the date this Agreement enters into force; the remaining stages, shall be made on 1 January of the successive years, and such goods shall thereafter be free of any customs duty.\n\n\n10.Customs duties on originating goods subject to MEP provided for in the tariff lines in staging category \u201cID\u201d, shall be progressively eliminated. For the purposes of tariff elimination, the base rate shall be the least of the base rate in the tariff elimination schedule or the MFN duty applied. This elimination shall be carried out in eight equal stages, beginning on the date this Agreement enters into force; the remaining stages, shall be made on 1 January of the successive years, and such goods shall thereafter be free of any customs duty.\n\n\n11.Customs duties on originating goods subject to MEP provided for in the tariff lines in staging category \u201cIE\u201d, shall be progressively eliminated. For the purposes of tariff elimination, the base rate shall be the least of the base rate in the tariff elimination schedule or the MFN duty applied. This elimination shall be carried out in eleven equal stages, beginning on the date this Agreement enters into force; the remaining stages, shall be made on 1 January of the successive years, and such goods shall thereafter be free of any customs duty.\n\n\n12.The fixed component of the MEP (15%) of originating goods provided for in staging category \u201cIF\u201d shall be eliminated on the date this Agreement enters into force.\n\n\n13.The fixed component of the MEP (20%) of originating goods provided for in staging category \u201cIG\u201d shall be eliminated on the date this Agreement enters into force.\n\n\n14.The fixed component of the MEP (15%) of originating provided for in staging category \u201cIH\u201d shall be eliminated in six equal stages, beginning on the date this Agreement enters into force; the remaining stages, shall be made on 1 January of the successive years.\n\n\n\n\n15.The fixed component of the MEP (20%) of originating goods provided for in staging category \u201cII\u201d shall be eliminated in eight equal stages, beginning on the date this Agreement enters into force; the remaining stages, shall be made on 1 January of the successive years.\n\n\n16.The fixed component of the MEP (15%) of originating provided for in staging category \u201cIJ\u201d shall be eliminated in eleven equal stages, beginning on the date this Agreement enters into force; the remaining stages, shall be made on 1 January of the successive years.\n\n\n17.The fixed component of the MEP (20%) of originating goods provided for in staging category \u201cIK\u201d shall be eliminated in eleven equal stages, beginning on the date this Agreement enters into force; the remaining stages, shall be made on 1 January of the successive years.\n\n\n18.Customs duties on originating goods provided for in the staging category \u201cB\u201d are exempt from tariff elimination; notwithstanding the above, as of the date this Agreement enters into force Ecuador shall eliminate the fixed component of the MEP (15%) for an annual quota of 800 tons, with a yearly increase of 24 tons from year one, \n\n\n19.Customs duties on originating goods provided for in the staging category \u201cB1\u201d are exempt from tariff elimination; notwithstanding the above, as of the date this Agreement enters into force Ecuador shall not apply import duties for an annual aggregate quota\n1\n of 800 tons, with a yearly increase of 24 tons from year one. \n\n\n20.Customs duties on originating goods provided for in the staging category \u201cD\u201d are exempt from tariff elimination; notwithstanding the above, Ecuador shall not apply import duties for an annual aggregate quota of 500 tons, with a yearly increase of 15 tons from year one. \n\n\n21.Customs duties on originating goods provided for in the staging category \u201cL1\u201d are exempt from tariff elimination; notwithstanding the above, as of the date this Agreement enters into force Ecuador shall not apply import duties for an annual aggregate quota of 400 tons, with a yearly increase of 20 tons from year one. \n\n\n22.Customs duties on originating goods provided for in the staging category \u201cL2\u201d are exempt from tariff elimination; notwithstanding the above, as of the date this Agreement enters into force Ecuador shall not apply import duties for an annual aggregate quota of 600 tons, with a yearly increase of 30 tons from year one.\n\n\n23.Customs duties on originating goods provided for in the staging category \u201cL3\u201d are exempt from tariff elimination; notwithstanding the above, as of the date this Agreement enters into force Ecuador shall not apply import duties for an annual aggregate quota of 500 tons, with a yearly increase of 25 tons from year one.\n\n\n24.Customs duties on originating goods provided for in the staging category \u201cL4\u201d shall be eliminated in eighteen equal stages, beginning on the date this Agreement enters into force; the remaining stages, shall be made on 1 January of the successive years, and such goods shall thereafter be free of any customs duty; notwithstanding the above, as of the date this Agreement enters into force Ecuador shall not apply import duties for an annual aggregate quota of 1000 tons, with a yearly increase of 50 tons from year one.\n\n\n25.Customs duties on originating goods provided for in the staging category \u201cM\u201d are exempt from tariff elimination; notwithstanding the above, as of the date this Agreement enters into force Ecuador shall not apply import duties for an annual aggregate quota of 300 tons.\n\n\n26.Customs duties on originating goods provided for in the staging category \u201cMC\u201d are exempt from tariff elimination; notwithstanding the above, as of the date this Agreement enters into force Ecuador shall not apply import duties for an annual aggregate quota of 400 tons.\n\n\n27.Customs duties on originating goods provided for in the staging category \u201cPA\u201d are exempt from tariff elimination; notwithstanding the above, as of the date this Agreement enters into force Ecuador shall not apply import duties for an aggregate tariff quota of 250 tons, with a yearly increase of 7.5 tons from year one.\n\n\n28Regarding originating goods provided for in the staging category \u201cP\u201d Ecuador shall not apply import duties for an aggregate quota of 800 tons as of the date this Agreement enters into force, with a yearly increase of 24 tons from year one. Goods imported in quantities exceeding the cumulated amount for each year shall receive the following treatment:\n\n\n(a)Customs duties for originating goods under tariff line 16010000 are exempt from tariff elimination.\n\n\n(b)The fixed component of the MEP (20%) for tariff line 02101200 shall be eliminated in eight equal stages, beginning from the date this Agreement enters into force; the remaining stages, shall be made each on 1 January of the successive years \n\n\n(c)Customs duties corresponding for tariff lines 02101900; 16024100; 16024200 shall be eliminated in accordance with the provisions established under category \u201c15\u201d.\n\n\n29.Customs duties on originating goods provided for in the staging category \u201cSP\u201d are exempt from tariff elimination; notwithstanding the above, as of the date this Agreement enters into force Ecuador shall not apply import duties for an annual aggregate quota of 750 tons.\n\n\n30.The rates of the customs duties in each cut shall be rounded down at least to the nearest tenth of a percentage point, or, if the rate of customs duty is expressed in monetary units, at least to the nearest 0,001 of the official monetary unit of Ecuador. \n\n\n31.For the purposes of this section, \"year one\" means the calendar year beginning 1 January following the year in which this Agreement enters into force as provided in Article 330 (Entry into Force)of this Agreement. The years referred to as \u00abyear two\u00bb, \u00abyear three\u00bb and so on, mean the calendar years following year one as provided in this paragraph.\n\n\n\n\n32.The provisions of this Section are expressed in terms of the Nomenclature of the Member States of the Andean Community (NANDINA) based on the Harmonised Commodity Description and Coding System (HS) 2007 version.\n\n\n33.The interpretation of the provisions of this Section, including the updating of tariff lines, shall be governed by the General Notes, Section Notes and Chapter Notes of the NANDINA. To the extent that the provisions of this Section are identical to the corresponding provisions of the NANDINA, the provisions of this Section shall have the same meaning as the corresponding provisions of the NANDINA.\n\n\n34.If the entry into force of the present Agreement corresponds to a date later than January 1st and before December 31st of the same calendar year, the tariff quota amount will be prorated in a manner proportional to the rest of the calendar year.\u00a0\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(1)\nThe \u201caggregate quota\u201d is one that integrates the tariff lines included in the corresponding liberalization schedule; as such, the use of this quota could include one or various tariff lines.\n\n\n\n\n\nTop  \n\n\n\n\n\n\nEUROPEAN COMMISSION\nBrussels, 4.4.2016\nCOM(2016) 173 final\nANNEX\nto the\nProposal for a Council Decision\non the signing, on behalf of the European Union, and provisional application of the Protocol of Accession to the Trade Agreement  between the European Union and its Member States, of the one part, and Colombia and Peru, of the other part, to take account of the Accession of Ecuador\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nANNEX V (Part 1)\n\n\nThe following shall be inserted after the 'Tariff elimination schedule of Peru for goods originating in European Union' at the end of Annex I to the Agreement:\n\n\nTARIFF ELIMINATION SCHEDULE OF ECUADOR FOR GOODS 4.4.2016\nCOM(2016) 173 final\nANNEX\nto the\nProposal for a Council Decision\n on the signing, on behalf of the European Union, and provisional application of the Protocol of Accession to the Trade Agreement  between the European Union and its Member States, of the one part, and Colombia and Peru, of the other part, to take account of the Accession of Ecuador\n\n\n\n\n\n\nANNEX V (Part 4)\n\n\nTARIFF ELIMINATION SCHEDULE OF ECUADOR FOR GOODS ORIGINATING IN THE EUROPEAN UNION\n\n\n\n\n\nNANDINA 2007\n\n\n\n\nProduct description\n\n\n\n\nBase Rate\n\n\n\n\nCategory\n\n\n\n\nObservations\n\n\n\n\n\n\n6904100000\n\n\n\n\n- Building bricks\n\n\n\n\n15\n\n\n\n\n5\n\n\n\n\n\u00a0\n\n\n\n\n\n\n6904900000\n\n\n\n\n- Decision\non the signing, on behalf of the European Union, and provisional application of the Protocol of Accession to the Trade Agreement  between the European Union and its Member States, of the one part, and Colombia and Peru, of the other part, to take account of the Accession of Ecuador\n\n\n\n\n\n\nANNEX VI to VIII\n\n\nANNEX VI\n\n\n1.The title of Appendix 5 in the 'List of Appendixes' in the 'Table of contents' of Annex II to the Agreement shall be replaced by the following:\n\n\n'Appendix 5:\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Products to which subparagraph (b) of the Declaration of the European Union concerning Article 5 in relation to originating products from Peru, Ecuador and Colombia\u00a0applies'\n\n\n2.The 'Declarations regarding Annex II concerning the definition of the concept of \"originating products\" and methods of administrative cooperation' in the 'Table of contents' of Annex II to the Agreement shall be replaced by the following:\n\n\n'Declaration of the European Union concerning Article 5 of Annex II in relation to originating products from Peru, Ecuador and Colombia\n\n\nJoint declaration of Peru, Ecuador and Colombia concerning Article 5 of Annex II in relation to originating products from the European Union\n\n\nJoint declaration concerning the Principality of Andorra\n\n\nJoint declaration concerning the Republic of San Marino\n\n\nJoint declaration on the revision of the rules of origin contained in Annex II concerning the Definition of \"Originating Products\" and Methods of Administrative Cooperation'\n\n\n3.Article 1 indent 4 of Section 1, Annex II to the Agreement shall be replaced by the following:\n\n\n'\u2212\"competent authorities or customs authorities\" refers to the following governmental bodies:\n\n\n(a)with respect to Colombia, the Ministerio de Comercio, Industria y Turismo or the Direcci\u00f3n de Impuestos de Aduanas Nacionales, or their successors; \n\n\n(b)with respect to Ecuador, the Ministerio de Comercio Exterior or the Servicio Nacional de Aduana del Ecuador (SENAE), or their successors;\n\n\n(c)with respect to Peru, the Ministerio de Comercio Exterior y Turismo, or its successors; and\n\n\n(d)with respect to the European Union, the customs authorities of the European Union Member States.'\n\n\n4.Article 36(3) of Section 6, Annex II to the Agreement shall be replaced by the following:\n\n\n'3. The exporter or his/her authorised representative shall enter \"Colombia\", \u201cEcuador\u201d or \"Peru\" and \"Ceuta and Melilla\" in Box 2 of movement certificate EUR.1 or on invoice declarations. In addition, in the case of products originating in Ceuta and Melilla, this shall be indicated in Box\u00a04 of movement certificate EUR.1 or on invoice declarations.'\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5.Notes 1, 3, 5, 7, in Appendix 2A to Annex II to the Agreement shall be replaced by the following:\n\n\n(a) 'Note 1\n\n\nThe following rule shall confer origin for products exported from the European Union to Colombia, Ecuador or Peru within the annual quotas per country indicated below:\n\n\n\n\n\nHS heading\n\n\n\n\nDescription of product\n\n\n\n\nWorking or processing carried out on non-originating materials that confers originating status\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(1)\n\n\n\n\n(2)\n\n\n\n\n(3) or (4)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nex 0901\n\n\n\n\nRoasted coffee of the variety Arabica\n\n\n\n\nManufacture from materials of any heading\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nColombia\n\n\n\n\nPeru\n\n\n\n\nEcuador\n\n\n\n\n\n\n120 tons\n\n\n\n\n30 tons\n\n\n\n\n110 tons\n\n\n\n\n\n'\n\n\n(b) 'Note 3\n\n\nThe following rule shall confer origin for products exported from the European Union to Colombia, Ecuador or Peru within the annual quotas per country indicated below:\n\n\n\n\n\nHS heading\n\n\n\n\nDescription of product\n\n\n\n\nWorking or processing carried out on non-originating materials that confers originating status\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(1)\n\n\n\n\n(2)\n\n\n\n\n(3) or (4)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1805\n\n\n\n\nCocoa increase by 50 per cent for the following year. VIII\n\n\n'Appendix 1\n\n\nCOMPETENT AUTHORITIES\n\n\n1.Competent Authorities of the EU Party\n\n\nControl competences are shared between the national services of the European Union Member States and the European Commission. In this respect the following applies:\n\n\n(a)as regards exports to Colombia and/or Peru and/or Ecuador, the European Union Member States are responsible for control of the production conditions and procedures, including statutory inspections and issuing health (or animal welfare) certifications attesting compliance with the standards and requirements established by the importing Party.\n\n\n(b)as regards imports from Colombia and/or Peru and/or Ecuador, the European Union Member States are responsible for the control of the compliance of such imports with the import conditions established by the European Union;\n\n\n(c)the European Commission is responsible for overall co-ordination, inspections and audits of inspection systems and the necessary legislative action to ensure uniform application of standards and requirements within the European Union.\n\n\n2Competent Authorities of Colombia\n\n\nControl and surveillance are carried out jointly by the Instituto Colombiano Agropecuario (hereinafter referred to as \"ICA\") and the Instituto Nacional de Vigilancia de Medicamentos y Alimentos \u2013 (hereinafter referred to as \"INVIMA\"), in accordance with the competences assigned to each institution by law. In this respect the following applies:\n\n\n(a)as regards exports to European Union Member States, ICA and INVIMA are responsible for the surveillance and control of the sanitary and phytosanitary conditions and procedures, including statutory inspections and issuing sanitary and phytosanitary certificates attesting compliance with the standards and requirements established by the importing Party;\n\n\n(b)as regards imports from the European Union Member States into Colombia, ICA and INVIMA are responsible for the verification and control of the compliance with the established import conditions, including the inspections and the sanitary and phytosanitary certificates issued by the European Union Member States attesting the compliance of such imports with the standards and import requirements in force in Colombia;\n\n\n(c)ICA and INVIMA are responsible, in accordance with their respective competences, for the overall co-ordination, inspection and audits of inspection systems.\n\n\n3.Competent Authorities of Peru\n\n\nThe competent authorities of Peru in sanitary and phytosanitary matters are the following institutions:\n\n\n(a)Servicio Nacional de Sanidad Agraria (hereinafter referred to as \"SENASA\")\n\n\n\n\n(b)Direcci\u00f3n General de Salud Ambiental (hereinafter referred to as \"DIGESA\")\n\n\n(c)Ministerio de Salud\n\n\n(d)Instituto Tecnol\u00f3gico Pesquero (hereinafter referred to as \"ITP\")\n\n\n(e)Ministerio de Comercio Exterior y Turismo (hereinafter referred to as \"MINCETUR\"). \n\n\n4.Competent Authorities of Ecuador\n\n\nThe competent authorities of Ecuador in sanitary and phytosanitary matters are the following institutions:\n\n\n(a)Agencia Ecuatoriana de Aseguramiento de la Calidad del Agro (AGROCALIDAD) \n\n\n(b)Instituto Nacional de Pesca (INP)\n\n\n(c)Agencia de Regulaci\u00f3n, Control y Vigilancia Sanitaria (ARCSA), and\n\n\n(d)Ministerio de Comercio Exterior (MCE).'\n\n\n\n\n\nTop  \n\n\n\n\n\n\nEUROPEAN COMMISSION\nBrussels, 4.4.2016\nCOM(2016) 173 final\nANNEX\nto the\nProposal for a Council Decision\non the signing, on behalf of the European Union, and provisional application of the Protocol of Accession to the Trade Agreement  between the European Union and its Member States, of the one part, and Colombia and Peru, of the other part, to take account of the Accession of Ecuador\n\n\n\n\n\n\nANNEX IX\n\n\n(Section B of Annex VII to the Agreement referred to in Article 114 of the Agreement)\n\n\nLIST OF COMMITMENTS ON ESTABLISHMENT\n\n\n'SECTION\u00a0B\n\n\nEU PARTY\n\n\nThe following abbreviations are used:\n\n\nAT\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Austria\n\n\nBE\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Belgium\n\n\nBG\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Bulgaria\n\n\nCY\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Cyprus\n\n\nCZ\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Czech Republic\n\n\nDE\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Germany\n\n\nDK\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Denmark\n\n\nES\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Spain\n\n\nEE\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Estonia\n\n\nEU\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0European Union, including all its Member States\n\n\nFI\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Finland\n\n\nFR\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0France\n\n\nEL\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Greece\n\n\n\n\nHR\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Croatia\n\n\nHU\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Hungary\n\n\nIE\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Ireland\n\n\nIT\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Italy\n\n\nLV\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Latvia\n\n\nLT\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Lithuania\n\n\nLU\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Luxembourg\n\n\nMT\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Malta\n\n\nNL\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The Netherlands\n\n\nPL\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Poland\n\n\n\nPT\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Portugal\n\n\nRO\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Romania\n\n\nSK\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Slovak Republic\n\n\nSI\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Slovenia\n\n\nSE\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Sweden\n\n\nUK\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0United Kingdom\n\n\n1.The list of commitments below indicates the economic activities liberalised pursuant to Article\u00a0114 of this Agreement and, by means of reservations, the market access and national treatment limitations that apply to establishments and investors of the signatory Andean Countries in those activities. The lists are composed of the following elements:\n\n\n(a)first column indicating the sector or sub-sector in which the commitment is assumed by the Party, and the scope of liberalisation to which the reservations apply; and\n\n\n(b)a second column describing the applicable reservations.\n\n\nWhen the column referred to under subparagraph (b) only includes European Union Member State-specific reservations, European Union Member States not mentioned therein undertake commitments in the sector concerned without reservations\n1\n.\n\n\n\n\nSectors or sub-sectors not mentioned in the list below are not committed.\n\n\n2.In identifying individual sectors and sub-sectors:\n\n\n(a)\"ISIC rev 3.1\" means the International Standard Industrial Classification of all Economic Activities as set out in Statistical Office of the United Nations, Statistical Papers, Series M, N\u00b0 4, ISIC REV 3.1, 2002;\n\n\n(b)\"CPC\" means the Central Products Classification as set out in Statistical Office of the United Nations, Statistical Papers, Series M, N\u00b0 77, CPC prov, 1991; and\n\n\n(c)\"CPC ver. 1.0\" means the Central Products Classification as set out in Statistical Office of the United Nations, Statistical Papers, Series M, N\u00b0 77, CPC ver\u00a01.0,\u00a01998.\n\n\n3.The list below does not include measures relating to qualification requirements and procedures, technical standards and licensing requirements and procedures when they do not constitute a market access or a national treatment limitation within the meaning of Articles\u00a0112 and 113 of this Agreement. Those measures (e.g. need to obtain a license, universal service obligations, need to obtain recognition of qualifications in regulated sectors, need to pass specific examinations, including language examinations, non-discriminatory requirement that certain activities may not be carried out in environmental protected zones or areas of particular historic and artistic interest), even if not listed, apply in any case to investors of the signatory Andean Countries.\n\n\n4.In accordance with Article 107 paragraph 3 of this Agreement, the list below does not include measures concerning subsidies granted by the Parties.\n\n\n5.In accordance with Article 112 of this Agreement non-discriminatory requirements as regards the types of legal form of an establishment are not included in the list below.\n\n\n6.The rights and obligations arising from this list of commitments shall have no selfexecuting effect and thus confer no rights directly to individual natural persons or juridical persons.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector or Sub-Sector\n\n\n\n\nDescription of Reservations\n\n\n\n\n\n\nALL SECTORS\n\n\n\n\nReal estate\n\n\nAT, BG, CY, CZ, DK, EE, ES, EL, FI, HR, HU, IE, IT, LT, LV, MT, PL, RO, SI, SK: Limitations on acquisition of land and real estate by foreign investors\n2\n.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nALL SECTORS\n\n\n\n\nPublic utilities\n\n\nEU: Economic activities considered as public utilities at a national or local level may be subject to public monopolies or to exclusive rights granted to private operators\n3\n. \n\n\n\n\n\n\nALL SECTORS\n\n\n\n\nTypes of establishment\n\n\nEU: Treatment accorded to subsidiaries (of third country companies) formed in accordance with the law of a European Union Member State and having their registered office, central administration or principal place of business within the territory of the European Union is not extended to branches or agencies established in a European Union Member State by a third country company.\n\n\nBG: Establishment of branches is subject to authorisation\n\n\nEE: At least one half of the members of the Board of directors shall have their residence in the European Union.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nFI: A foreigner carrying on trade as a partner in a Finnish limited or general partnership needs a trade permit and has to be permanently resident in the European Union. For all sectors except telecommunications services, there is a nationality condition and residency requirement for at least half of the ordinary and deputy members of the Board of Directors. Company exemptions may, however, be granted. If a foreign organization intends to carry on a business or trade by establishing a branch in Finland, a trade permit is required. A permission to act as a founder of a limited company is required of a foreign organization or a private person, who is not an European Union citizen. For telecommunications services, permanent residency for half of the founders and half of the members of the Board of directors is required. If the founder is a juridical person, there is also a residence requirement for that juridical person.\n\n\nIT: Access to industrial, commercial and artisanal activities is subject to a residence permit and specific authorization to pursue the activity\n\n\nBG, PL: The scope of operations of a representative office may only encompass advertising and promotion of the foreign parent company represented by the\u00a0office.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nPL: With the exception of financial services, unbound for branches. Non-European Union investors can undertake and conduct economic activity only in the form of a limited partnership, limited joint-stock partnership, limited liability company, and joint-stock company (in the case of legal services only in the form of registered partnership and limited partnership).\n\n\nRO: The sole administrator or the chairman of the Board of directors as well as half of the total number of administrators of the commercial companies shall be Romanian citizens unless otherwise stipulated in the company contract or its statutes. The majority of the commercial companies' auditors and their deputies shall be Romanian citizens.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSE: A foreign company (which has not established a legal entity in Sweden) shall conduct its commercial operations through a branch, established in Sweden with independent management and separate accounts. Building projects with duration of less than a year are exempted from the requirements of establishing a branch or appointing a resident representative. A limited liability company (joint stock company) may be established by one or several founders. A founding party shall either reside in Sweden or be a Swedish legal entity. A partnership can only be a founding party if each partner resides in Sweden. Corresponding conditions prevail for establishment of all other types of legal entities. At least 50 per cent of the members of the Board of directors shall reside in Sweden. Foreign or Swedish citizens not residing in Sweden, who wishes to conduct commercial operations in Sweden, shall appoint and register with the local authority a resident representative responsible for such activities. Residency conditions might be waived if it can be proved that they are not necessary in a given case.\n\n\nSE (for Ecuador only): The managing director, and the vice-managing director if appointed, of the branch must reside in the EEA. A natural person not resident in the EEA, who conducts commercial operations in Sweden, shall appoint and register a resident representative responsible for the operations in Sweden. Separate accounts shall be kept for the operations in Sweden. The competent authority may in individual cases grant exemptions from the branch and residency requirements.\n\n\nSI: The establishment of branches by foreign companies is conditioned with the registration of the parent company in a court register in the country of origin for at least one year.\n\n\nSK: A foreign natural person whose name is to be registered in the Commercial Register as a person authorized to act on behalf of an entrepreneur is required to submit residence permit for the Slovak Republic.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nALL SECTORS\n\n\n\n\nInvestment\n\n\nES: Investment in Spain by foreign government and foreign public entities (which tends to imply, besides economic, also noneconomic interests to entity's part), directly or through companies or other entities controlled directly or indirectly by foreign governments, needs prior authorization by the government.\n\n\nBG: In enterprises where the public (State or municipal) share in the equity capital exceeds 30 per cent, the transfer of these shares to third parties needs authorisation. Certain economic activities related to the exploitation or use of State or public property are subject to concessions granted under the provisions of the Concessions Act. Foreign investors cannot participate in privatisation. Foreign investors and Bulgarian juridical persons with controlling foreign participation require permission for a) prospecting, development or extraction of natural resources from the territorial sea, the continental shelf or the exclusive economic zone and b) acquisition of a controlling participation in companies engaged in any of the activities specified under a). \n\n\nFR: Foreign purchases exceeding 33,33 per cent of the shares of capital or voting rights in existing French enterprise, or 20 per cent in publicly quoted French companies, are subject to the following regulations:\n\n\n- investments of less than 7.6 million euro in French enterprises with a turnover not exceeding 76 million euro are free, after a delay of 15 days following prior notification and verification that these amounts are met;\n\n\n- after a period of one month following prior notification, authorization is tacitly granted for other investments unless the Minister of Economic Affairs has, in exceptional circumstances, exercised its right to postpone the investment.\n\n\nForeign participation in newly privatized companies may be limited to a variable amount, determined by the government of France on a case by case basis, of the equity offered to the public. For establishing in certain commercial, industrial or artisanal activities, a specific authorization is needed if the managing director is not holder of a permanent residence\u00a0permit.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nFI: Acquisition of shares by foreign owners giving more than one third of the voting rights of a major Finnish company or a major business undertaking (with more than 1000 employees or with a turnover exceeding 168 million euro or with a balance sheet total exceeding 168 million euro) is subject to confirmation by the Finnish authorities; the confirmation may be denied only if an important national interest would be jeopardized. These limitations do not apply to telecommunications services.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nHU: Unbound for foreign participation in newly privatized companies.\n\n\nIT: Exclusive rights may be granted or maintained to newlyprivatized companies. Voting rights in newly privatized companies may be restricted in some cases. For a period of five years, the acquisition of large equity stakes of companies operating in the fields of defence, transport services, telecommunications and energy may be subject to the approval of the competent\u00a0authorities.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nALL SECTORS\n\n\n\n\nGeographical zones\n\n\nFI: In the \u00c5land Islands, limitations on the right of establishment by natural persons who do not enjoy regional citizenship in \u00c5land or by any juridical person without permission by the competent authorities of the \u00c5land Islands.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Agriculture, HUNTING, FORESTRY\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Agriculture, hunting\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 011, 012, 013, 014, 015) excluding advisory and consultancy services\n4\n\u00a0\n\n\n\n\nAT, HR, HU, MT, RO: Unbound for agricultural activities.\n\n\nCY: Non-European Union participation is allowed only up to 49 per cent.\n\n\nFR: The establishment of agricultural enterprises by non-European Union nationals and the acquisition of vineyards by non-European Union investors are subject to authorisation.\n\n\nIE: Establishment by non-European Union residents in flour milling activities is subject to authorisation.\n\n\nSE (for Ecuador only): Only Sami people may own and exercise reindeer husbandry.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB Forestry and logging\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 020) excluding advisory and consultancy services\n\n\n\n\nBG: Unbound for logging activities.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2. Fishing and aquaculture\n\n\n(ISIC rev.3.1: 0501, 0502) excluding advisory and consultancy services\n\n\n\n\nAT: At least 25 per cent of vessels have to be registered in Austria.\n\n\nBE, FI, IE, LV, NL, PT, SK: Foreign investors not incorporated and not having their principal office in Belgium, Finland, Ireland, Latvia, the Netherlands, Portugal and the Slovak Republic respectively cannot own Belgian, Finnish, Irish, Latvian, Dutch, Portuguese and Slovak flag vessels respectively\n\n\nCY, EL: Non-European Union participation is allowed only up to 49 per cent.\n\n\nDK: Non-European Union residents cannot own one-third or more of a business engaged in commercial fishing. Non-European Union residents cannot own Denmark flag vessels except through an enterprise incorporated in Denmark.\n\n\nFR: Non-European Union nationals cannot participate in the maritime State property for fish/shellfish/algae farming. Foreign investors not incorporated and not having their principal office in France cannot own more than 50 per cent of a French flag vessel.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nDE: Sea fishing licence granted only to vessels entitled to fly the flag of Germany. These are fishing vessels of which the majority of shares is owned by European Union citizens or companies established in accordance with European\u00a0Union rules and that have their principal place of business in a European Union Member State. The use of the vessels must be headed and supervised by persons residing in Germany. In order to obtain a fishing licence, all fishing vessels must register with the relevant coastal states in which the ships have their homeports.\n\n\nEE: Ships are entitled to fly Estonian flag if located in Estonia and majority ownership is held by Estonian nationals in general partnership and in limited partnership companies or other legal entities that are located in Estonia with voting majority held by Estonian nationals in the Board of directors.\n\n\nBG, HR, HU, LT, MT, RO: Unbound.\n\n\nIT: Foreigners other than European Union residents cannot own a majority interest in Italian flag vessels or a controlling interest in ship owning companies having their headquarters in Italy. Fishing in Italian territorial waters is reserved to Italian flag vessels.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSE: Foreign investors not incorporated and not having their principal office in Sweden cannot own more than 50 per cent of a Swedish flag vessel. Acquisition by foreign investors of 50 per cent or more of shares in firms engaged in commercial fishing activities in Swedish waters requires authorisation.\n\n\nSI: Ships are entitled to fly the Slovenian flag if more than half of the ship is owned by European Union citizens or by juridical persons having their headquarters in a European Union Member State.\n\n\nUK: Reservation on the acquisition of UK flagged vessels, unless the investment is at least 75 per cent owned by British citizens and/or by companies which are at least 75 per cent owned by British citizens, in all cases resident and domiciled in the UK. Vessels must be managed, directed and controlled from within the UK.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3. Mining and quarrying\n5\n\n\n\nA. Mining of coal and lignite; extraction of peat\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 10)\n\n\nB. Extraction of crude petroleum and natural gas\n6\n\u00a0\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 1110)\n\n\nC. Mining of metal ores\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 13)\n\n\nD. Other mining and quarrying\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 14)\n\n\n\n\nEU: Investors from countries which are energy suppliers may be prohibited to obtain control of the activity. Unbound for direct branching (incorporation is required). Unbound for extraction of crude petroleum and natural gas.\n\n\nES: Unbound for foreign investment in strategic minerals.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4. Manufacturing\n7\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Manufacture of food products and beverages\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 15)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB. Manufacture of tobacco products\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 16)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC. Manufacture of textiles\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 17)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nD. Manufacture of wearing apparel; dressing and dyeing of fur\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 18)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nE. Tanning and dressing of leather; manufacture of luggage, handbags, saddlery, harness and footwear\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 19)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nF. Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 20)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nG. Manufacture of paper and paper products\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 21)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nH Publishing, printing and reproduction of recorded media\n8\n\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 22, excluding publishing and printing on a fee or contract basis\n9\n)\n\n\n\n\nIT: Nationality condition for owner of publishing and printing companies.\n\n\nSE (for Ecuador only): Residency requirement for publisher and owner of publishing or printing company\n\n\n\n\n\n\nI. Manufacture of coke oven products\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 231)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nJ. Manufacture of refined petroleum products\n10\n\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 232)\n\n\n\n\nEU: Investors from countries which are energy suppliers may be prohibited to obtain the control of the activity. Unbound for direct branching (incorporation is required).\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nK. Manufacture of chemicals and chemical products other than explosives\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 24 excluding manufacturing of explosives)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nL. Manufacture of rubber and plastics products\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 25)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nM. Manufacture of other non-metallic mineral products\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 26)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nN. Manufacture of basic metals\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 27)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nO. Manufacture of fabricated metal products, except machinery and equipment\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 28)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nP. Manufacture of machinery\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Manufacture of general purpose machinery\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 291)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) Manufacture of special purpose machinery other than weapons and munitions\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 2921, 2922, 2923, 2924, 2925, 2926, 2929) \n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nc) Manufacture of domestic appliances n.e.c.\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 293)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nd) Manufacture of office, accounting and computing machinery\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 30)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\ne) Manufacture of electrical machinery and apparatus n.e.c.\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 31)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nf) Manufacture of radio, television and communication equipment and apparatus\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 32)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nQ. Manufacture of medical, precision and optical instruments, watches and clocks\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 33)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nR. Manufacture of motor vehicles, trailers and semi-trailers\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 34)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nS. Manufacture of other (non-military) transport equipment\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 35 excluding manufacturing of warships, warplanes and other transport equipment for military use)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nT. Manufacture of furniture; manufacturing n.e.c.\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 361, 369)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nU. Recycling \n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 37)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5. production; TRANSMISSION aND DISTRIBUTION ON OWN ACCOUNT of Electricity, gas, steam and hot water\n11\n\n\n\n(excluding nuclear based elEctricity generation)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Production of electricity; transmission and distribution of electricity on own account\n\n\n(part of ISIC rev 3.1: 4010)\n12\n\u00a0\n\n\n\n\nEU: Investors from countries which are energy suppliers may be prohibited to obtain control of the activity. Unbound for direct branching (incorporation is required).\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB. Manufacture of gas; distribution of gaseous fuels through mains on own account\n\n\n(part of ISIC rev 3.1: 4020)\n13\n\n\n\n\n\nEU: Investors from countries which are energy suppliers may be prohibited to obtain control of the activity. Unbound for direct branching (incorporation is required).\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC. Production of steam and hot water; distribution of steam and hot water on own account\n\n\n(part of ISIC rev 3.1: 4030)\n14\n\n\n\n\n\nEU: Investors from countries which are energy suppliers may be prohibited to obtain control of the activity. Unbound for direct branching (incorporation is required).\n\n\n\n\n\n\n6. BUSINESS SERVICES\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Professional Services\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Legal Services \n\n\n(CPC 861)\n15\n\n\n\nexcluding legal advisory and legal documentations and certification services provided by legal professionals entrusted with public functions, such as notaries, huissiers de justice or other officiers publics et minist\u00e9riels\n\n\n\n\nAT:\u00a0Foreign lawyers' (who must be fully qualified in their home country) equity participation and shares in the operating result of any law firm may not exceed 25 per cent. They may not have decisive influence in decision making.\n\n\nBE: Quotas apply for appearing before the \"Cour de cassation\" in non-criminal cases.\n\n\nCY (for Ecuador only): Full admission to the Bar is subject to a nationality condition, coupled with a residency requirement.\n\n\nFR: Lawyers' access to the profession of \"avocat aupr\u00e8s de la Cour de Cassation\" and \"avocat aupr\u00e8s du Conseil d'Etat\" is subject to quotas.\n\n\nDK: Only lawyers with a Danish license to practice and law firms registered in Denmark may own shares in a Danish law firm. Only lawyers with a Danish license to practise may sit on the Board of directors or be part of the management of a Danish law firm. Requirement of a Danish legal examination in order to obtain a Danish licence.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nFR: Some types of legal form (\"association d'avocats\" and \"soci\u00e9t\u00e9 en participation d'avocat\") are reserved to lawyers fully admitted to the Bar in FR. In a law firm providing services in respect of French or European Union law, at least 75 per cent of the partners holding 75 per cent of the shares shall be lawyers fully admitted to the Bar in FR.\n\n\nHR: Representation of parties before courts can be practised only by the members of the Bar Council of Croatia (Croatian title \"odvjetnici\"). Citizenship requirement for membership in the Bar Council. \n\n\nHU: Commercial presence should take the form of partnership with a Hungarian barrister (\u00fcgyv\u00e9d) or a barrister's office (\u00fcgyv\u00e9di iroda), or representative office.\n\n\nPL: While other types of legal forms are available for European Union lawyers, foreign lawyers only have access to the legal forms of registered partnership and limited partnership.\n\n\nSE (for Ecuador only): Admission to the Bar, necessary only for the use of the Swedish title \"advokat\", is subject to a residency requirement.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) 1. Accounting and Bookkeeping Services\n\n\n(CPC 86212 other than \"auditing services\", CPC 86213, CPC 86219 and CPC 86220)\n\n\n\n\nAT: Foreign accountants' (who must be authorised according to the law of their home country) equity participation and shares in the operating results of any Austrian legal entity may not exceed 25 per cent, if they are not members of the Austrian Professional Body.\n\n\nCY: Access is subject to economic needs test. Main criteria: the employment situation in the sub-sector. \n\n\nDK: In order to enter into partnerships with Danish authorised accountants, foreign accountants have to obtain permission from the Danish Commerce and Companies Agency.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) 2. Auditing services\n\n\n(CPC 86211 and 86212 other than accounting services)\n\n\n\n\nAT: Foreign auditors' (who must be authorised according to the law of their home country) equity participation and shares in the operating results of any Austrian legal entity may not exceed 25 per cent, if they are not members of the Austrian Professional Body.\n\n\nCY: Access is subject to economic needs test. Main criteria: the employment situation in the sub-sector.\n\n\nCZ, SK: At least 60 per cent of capital share or voting rights are reserved to nationals.\n\n\nDK: In order to enter into partnerships with Danish authorised accountants, foreign accountants have to obtain permission from the Danish Commerce and Companies Agency.\n\n\nFI: Residency requirement for at least one of the auditors of a Finnish Liability company.\n\n\nHR: None, except that auditing can be performed only by legal persons. \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLV: In a commercial company of sworn auditors more than 50 per cent of the voting capital shares shall be owned by sworn auditors or commercial companies of sworn auditors of the European Union.\n\n\nLT: Non less that 75 per cent of shares should belong to European Union auditors or auditing companies.\n\n\nSE: Only auditors approved in Sweden may perform legal auditing services in certain legal entities, a.o. in all limited companies. Only such persons may be shareowners or form partnerships in companies which practice qualified auditing (for official purposes). Residency required for approval.\n\n\nSI: The share of foreign persons in auditing companies may not exceed 49 per cent of the equity.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nc) Taxation Advisory Services\n\n\n(CPC 863)\n16\n\n\n\n\n\nAT: Foreign tax advisors' (who must be authorised according to the law of their home country) equity participation and shares in the operating results of any Austrian legal entity may not exceed 25 per cent; this applies only to non-members of the Austrian Professional Body.\n\n\nCY: Access is subject to economic needs test. Main criteria: the employment situation in the sub-sector. \n\n\n\n\n\n\nd) Architectural services\n\n\nand\n\n\ne) Urban planning and landscape architectural services\n\n\n(CPC 8671 and CPC 8674)\n\n\n\n\nBG: For projects of national or regional significance, foreign investors have to act in partnership or as subcontractors of local investors.\n\n\nLV: For architectural services, in order to receive a licence enabling to engage in business activity with full range of legal responsibility and rights to sign a project, practice of 3 years in Latvia in the field of projecting and university degree is\u00a0required.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nf) Engineering services\n\n\nand\n\n\ng) Integrated engineering services\n\n\n(CPC 8672 and CPC 8673)\n\n\n\n\nBG: For projects of national or regional significance, foreign investors have to act in partnership or as subcontractors of local investors.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nh) Medical (including psychologists) and Dental services\n\n\n(CPC 9312 and part of CPC 85201) \n\n\n\n\nAT: Unbound except for dental services and for psychologists and psychotherapists, where: none\n\n\nDE: Economic needs test when medical doctors and dentists are authorized to treat members of public insurance schemes. Main criteria: shortage of doctors and dentists in the given region. \n\n\nCY (for Ecuador only), FI: Unbound\n\n\nFR: While other types of legal form are available for European Union investors, foreign investors only have access to the legal forms of \"soci\u00e9t\u00e9 d'exercice liberal\" and \"soci\u00e9t\u00e9 civile professionnelle\".\n\n\nLV: Economic needs test. Main criteria: shortage of doctors and dentists in the given region. \n\n\nBG, LT: The supply of service is subject to authorization which is based on a health services plan established in function of needs, taking into account the population and already existing medical and dental services.\n\n\nSI: Unbound for social medicine, sanitary, epidemiological, medical/ecological services; the supply of blood, blood preparations and transplants; autopsy \n\n\nUK: Establishment for doctors under the National Health Service is subject to medical manpower planning.\n\n\n\n\n\n\ni) Veterinary services\n\n\n(CPC 932)\n\n\n\n\nAT, CY (for Ecuador only): Unbound\n\n\nBG: Economic needs test. Main criteria: population and density of existing business.\n\n\nHU: Economic needs test. Main criteria: labour market conditions in the sector.\n\n\nFR: While other types of legal form are available for European Union investors, foreign investors only have access to the legal forms of \"soci\u00e9t\u00e9 d'exercice liberal\" and \"soci\u00e9t\u00e9 civile professionnelle\".\n\n\n\n\n\n\nj) 1. Midwives services\n\n\n(part of CPC 93191)\n\n\n\n\nBG, CY (for Ecuador only), FI, MT, SI: Unbound.\n\n\nFR: While other types of legal form are available for European Union investors, foreign investors only have access to the legal forms of \"soci\u00e9t\u00e9 d'exercice liberal\" and \"soci\u00e9t\u00e9 civile professionnelle\".\n\n\nLT: Economic needs test may be applied. Main criteria: employment situation in the sub-sector.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nj) 2. Services provided by Nurses, Physiotherapists and Paramedical Personnel\n\n\n(part of CPC 93191)\n\n\n\n\nAT: Foreign investors are only allowed in the following activities: nurses, physiotherapists, occupational therapists, logotherapists, dieticians and nutricians.\n\n\nBG, CY (for Ecuador only), MT: Unbound.\n\n\nFI, SI: Unbound for Physiotherapists and Paramedical Personnel.\n\n\nFR: While other types of legal form are available for European Union investors, foreign investors only have access to the legal forms of \"soci\u00e9t\u00e9 d'exercice liberal\" and \"soci\u00e9t\u00e9 civile professionnelle\".\n\n\nLT: Economic needs test may be applied. Main criteria: employment situation in the sub-sector.\n\n\nLV: Economic needs test for foreign physiotherapists and paramedical personnel. Main criteria: employment situation in the given region. \n\n\n\n\n\n\nk) Retail sales of pharmaceuticals and retail sales of medical and orthopaedical goods \n\n\n(CPC 63211)\n\n\nand other services supplied by pharmacists\n17\n\n\n\n\n\nAT, BG, CY, FI, MT, PL, RO, SE, SI: Unbound\n\n\nBE, DE, DK, EE, ES, FR, IT, HR, HU, IE, LV, PT, SK: Authorisation is subject to an economic needs test. Main criteria: population and geographical density of existing pharmacies.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB. Computer and Related Services\n\n\n(CPC 84)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC. Research and Development Services\n18\n\n\n\na) Research and Development services on natural sciences\n\n\n(CPC 851)\n\n\nb) Research and Development services on Social Sciences and Humanities\n\n\n(CPC 852 excluding psychologists services)\n19\n\n\n\nc) Interdisciplinary Research and Development services\n\n\n(CPC 853)\n\n\n\n\nFor a) and c):\n\n\nEU: For publicly funded Research and Development services, exclusive rights and/or authorisations can only be granted to European Union nationals and to European Union juridical persons having their headquarters in the European\u00a0Union.\n\n\nFor b):\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nD. Real Estate Services\n20\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Involving Own or Leased Property \n\n\n(CPC 821)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) On a Fee or Contract Basis\n\n\n(CPC 822)\n\n\n\n\nNone, except:\n\n\nCY (for Ecuador only): Unbound\n\n\n\n\n\n\nE. Rental/Leasing Services without Operators\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Relating to Ships\n\n\n(CPC 83103)\n\n\n\n\nLT: Ships must be owned by Lithuanian natural persons or companies established in Lithuania.\n\n\nSE: To fly the Swedish flag proof of dominating Swedish operating influence must be shown in case of foreign ownership interests in ships\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) Relating to Aircraft\n\n\n(CPC 83104)\n\n\n\n\nEU: Aircraft used by European Union carriers have to be registered in the European Union Member State licensing the carrier or elsewhere in the European Union. The aircraft must be owned either by natural persons meeting specific nationality criteria or by juridical persons meeting specific criteria regarding ownership of capital and control (including nationality of directors). Waivers can be granted for short term lease contracts or under exceptional circumstances.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nc) Relating to Other Transport Equipment \n\n\n(CPC 83101, CPC 83102 and CPC 83105) \n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nd) Relating to Other Machinery and Equipment\n\n\n(CPC 83106, CPC 83107, CPC 83108 and CPC 83109)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\ne) Relating to personal and household goods\n\n\n(CPC 832)\n\n\n\n\nAT, BE, BG, CY, CZ, DE, DK, ES, FI, FR, EL, IE, IT, LU, MT, NL, PL, PT, RO, SI, SE, SK, UK: Unbound for\u00a0CPC 83202\n\n\n\n\n\n\nf) Telecommunications equipment rental\n\n\n(CPC 7541)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nF. Duplicating services\n\n\n(CPC 87904)\n24\n\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nr) 6. Telecommunications consulting services\n\n\n(CPC 7544)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nr) 7.
