Postal and Courier Services\n\n\n(Services relating to the handling\n25\n of postal items\n26\n according to the following list of sub-sectors, whether for domestic or foreign destinations: (i) Handling of addressed written communications on any kind of physical medium\n27\n, including Hybrid mail service and Direct mail, (ii) Handling of addressed parcels and packages\n28\n, iii) Handling of addressed press products\n29\n, (iv) Handling of items referred to in (i) to (iii) above as registered or insured mail, (v) Express delivery services\n30\n for items referred to in (i) to (iii) above, vi) Handling of non-addressed items, (vii) Document exchange\n31\n\n\n\n\n\nNone\n32\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-sectors (i), (iv) and (v) are however excluded when they fall into the scope of the services which may be reserved, which is: for items of correspondence the price of which is less than 2.5 times the public basic tariff, provided that they weigh less than 50 grams\n33\n, plus the registered mail service used in the course of judicial or administrative procedures.)\n\n\n(part of CPC 751, part of CPC 71235\n34\n and part of CPC 73210\n35\n)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB. Telecommunications Services\n\n\nThese services do not cover the economic activity consisting of the provision of content which requires telecommunications services for its transport.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) All services consisting of the transmission and reception of signals by any electromagnetic means\n36\n, excluding broadcasting\n37\n\u00a0\n\n\n\n\nNone\n38\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) Satellite broadcast transmission services\n39\n\n\n\n\n\nEU: service suppliers in this sector may be subject to obligations\u00a0to safeguard general interest objectives related to the conveyance of content through their network in line with the European Union regulatory framework for electronic communications.\n\n\nBE: Unbound\n\n\n\n\n\n\n8. CONSTRUCTION AND RELATED ENGINEERING SERVICES (CPC 511, CPC 512, CPC 513, CPC 514, CPC 515, CPC 516, CPC 517 and CPC 518) \n\n\n\n\nBG: For projects of national or regional significance, foreign investors have to act in partnership or as subcontractors of local investors.\n\n\nCY, CZ, HU, MT, SK: Unbound\n\n\n\n\n\n\n9.DISTRIBUTION SERVICES\n\n\n(excluding distribution of arms, munitions, explosives and other war material)\n\n\nAll sub-sectors mentioned below\n40\n\n\n\n\n\nAT: Unbound for distribution of pyrotechnical goods, of ignitable articles and blasting devices and of toxic substances. For the distribution of pharmaceutical products and of tobacco products,\u00a0exclusive rights and/or authorisations can only be granted to European Union nationals and to European Union juridical persons having their headquarters in the European Union.\n\n\nFI: Unbound for distribution of alcoholic beverages and pharmaceutical products.\n\n\nHR: Unbound for distribution of tobacco products.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Commission Agents' Services \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Commission Agents' Services of motor vehicles, motorcycles and snowmobiles and parts and accessories thereof\n\n\n(part of CPC 61111, part of CPC 6113 and part of CPC 6121 )\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) Other Commission Agents' Services\n\n\n(CPC 621)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB. Wholesale Trade Services\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Wholesale Trade Services of motor vehicles, motorcycles and snowmobiles and parts and accessories thereof\n\n\n(part of CPC 61111, part of CPC 6113 and part of CPC 6121 )\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) Wholesale Trade Services of telecommunication terminal equipment\n\n\n(part of CPC 7542)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nc) Other wholesale trade services\n\n\n(CPC 622 excluding wholesale trade services of energy products\n41\n)\n\n\n\n\nFR, IT: State monopoly on tobacco.\n\n\nFR: Authorisation of wholesale pharmacies is subject to an economic needs test. Main criteria: population and geographical density of existing pharmacies.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC. Retailing Services\n42\n\n\n\nRetailing Services of motor vehicles, motorcycles and snowmobiles and parts and accessories thereof \n\n\n(CPC 61112, part of CPC 6113 and part of CPC 6121)\n\n\nRetailing Services of telecommunication terminal equipment\n\n\n(part of CPC 7542)\n\n\nFood retailing services \n\n\n(CPC 631)\n\n\n(Retailing services of other (non-energy) goods, except retail sales of pharmaceutical, medical and orthopaedic goods\n43\n\n\n\n(CPC 632 excluding CPC 63211 and 63297)\n\n\n\n\nES, FR, IT: State monopoly on tobacco.\n\n\nBE, BG, DK, FR, IT, MT, PT: Authorisation for department stores (in the case of FR only for large stores) is subject to an economic needs test. Main criteria: number of and impact on existing stores, population density, geographic spread, impact on traffic conditions and creation of new employment.\n\n\nIE, SE: Unbound for the retail sale of alcoholic beverages.\n\n\nSE: Authorisation for temporary trade in clothing, shoes and foodstuffs that are not consumed at the point of sale may be subject to an economic needs test. Main criteria: impact on existing stores in the geographic area in question.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nD. Franchising \n\n\n(CPC 8929)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\n10. EDUCATIONAL SERVICES (only privately funded services) \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Primary Education Services \n\n\n(CPC 921)\n\n\nB. Secondary Education Services\n\n\n(CPC 922)\n\n\nC. Higher Education Services\n\n\n(CPC 923)\n\n\nD. Adult Education Services\n\n\n(CPC 924)\n\n\n\n\nEU: Participation of private operators in the education network is subject to concession.\n\n\nAT: Unbound for higher education services. Unbound for education services for adults by means of radio or television broadcasting.\n\n\nBG: Unbound for the supply of primary and/or secondary education services by foreign natural persons and associations and for the supply of higher education services.\n\n\nCZ, SK: Nationality condition for majority of members of the Board of directors. Unbound for the supply of higher education services except for post-secondary technical and vocational education services (CPC 92310). \n\n\nCY, FI, MT, RO, SE: Unbound\n\n\nEL: Nationality condition for majority of members of the Board of directors in primary and secondary schools. Unbound for higher education institutions granting recognised States diplomas.\n\n\nES, IT: Needs test for opening private universities authorised to issue recognised diplomas or degrees; procedure involves an advice of the Parliament. Main criteria: population and density of existing establishments.\n\n\nHR: Unbound for Primary Education Services (CPC 921). For Secondary Education Services: None for legal persons.\n\n\nHU, SK: The number of schools being established may be limited by local authorities (or in the case of high schools and other higher education institutions by central authorities) in charge of granting licenses.\n\n\nLV: Unbound for the supply of education services relating to technical and vocational secondary school-type education services for handicapped students (CPC 9224).\n\n\nSI: Unbound for primary schools. Nationality condition for majority of members of the Board of directors in secondary and high schools.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nE. Other education services\n\n\n(CPC 929)\n\n\n\n\nAT, BE, BG, CY, DE, DK, ES, EE, FI, FR, EL, HU, IE, IT, LV, LT, LU, MT, NL, PL, PT, RO, SI, SE, UK: Unbound\n\n\nCZ, SK: Participation of private operators in the education network is subject to concession. Nationality condition for majority of members of the Board of directors.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n11. ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES\n44\n\n\n\nA.) Waste Water Services\n\n\n(CPC 9401)\n45\n\n\n\nB. Solid/hazardous waste management, excluding cross-border transport of hazardous waste\n\n\na) Refuse Disposal Services\n\n\n(CPC 9402)\n\n\nb) Sanitation and Similar Services\n\n\n(CPC 9403)\n\n\nC. Protection of ambient air and climate\n\n\n(CPC 9404)\n46\n\n\n\nD. Remediation and clean up of soil and waters\n\n\na) Treatment, remediation of contaminated/polluted soil and water\n\n\n(part of CPC 9406)\n47\n\n\n\nE. Noise and vibration abatement\n\n\n(CPC 9405)\n\n\nF. Protection of biodiversity and landscape \n\n\na) Nature and landscape protection services\n\n\n(part of CPC 9406)\n\n\nG. Other environmental and ancillary services\n\n\n(CPC 9409)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\n12. FINANCIAL SERVICES\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Insurance and insurance-related services\n\n\n\n\nAT: The licence for branch offices of foreign insurers has to be denied if the insurer, in the home country, does not have a legal form corresponding or comparable to a joint stock company or a mutual insurance association.\n\n\nBG, ES: Before establishing a branch or agency in Bulgaria or Spain to provide certain classes of insurance, a foreign insurer must have been authorised to operate in the same classes of insurance in its country of origin for at least five\u00a0years.\n\n\nEL: The right of establishment does not cover the creation of representative offices or other permanent presence of insurance companies, except where such offices are established as agencies, branches or head offices.\n\n\nFI: At least one half of the promoters and members of the board of directors and the supervisory board of an insurance company shall have their place of residence in the European Union, unless the competent authorities have granted an exemption. Foreign insurers cannot get a licence in Finland as a branch to carry on statutory pension insurance.\n\n\nIT: The authorisation of the establishment of branches is ultimately subject to the evaluation of supervisory authorities.\n\n\nBG, PL: Local incorporation (no branches) required for insurance intermediaries.\n\n\nPT: In order to establish a branch in Portugal, foreign insurance companies need to demonstrate prior operational experience of at least five years. Direct branching is not permitted for insurance intermediation, which is reserved to companies formed in accordance with the law of a European Union Member\u00a0State. \n\n\nSK: A foreign national may establish an insurance company in the form of a joint stock company or may conduct insurance business through their subsidiaries with registered office in the Slovak Republic (no branches). \n\n\nSE: Insurance broking undertakings not incorporated in Sweden may establish only through a branch.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB. Banking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\n\n\nEU: Only firms having their registered office in the European Union can act as depositories of the assets of investment funds. The establishment of a specialised management company, having its head office and registered office in the same European Union Member State, is required to perform the activities of management of unit trusts and investment companies. \n\n\nBG: Pension insurance shall be implemented through participation in incorporated pension insurance companies (no branches). Permanent residence in Bulgaria is required for the chairperson of the management board and the chairperson of the board of directors.\n\n\nCY: Only members (brokers) of the Cyprus Stock Exchange can undertake business pertaining to securities brokerage in Cyprus. A brokerage firm may only be registered as a member of the Cyprus Stock Exchange if it has been established and registered in accordance with the Companies Law of Cyprus (no branches).\n\n\nFI: At least one half of the founders, the members of the board of directors, at least one ordinary and one deputy member of the supervisory board and the person entitled to sign in the name of the credit institution shall have their permanent residence in the European Union. Exemption form these requirements may be granted by the competent authorities.\n\n\nHR: None, except for settlement and clearing services where the Central Depositary Agency (CDA) is the sole supplier in Croatia. Access to the services of the CDA will be granted to non-residents on a non-discriminatory basis. \n\n\nHU: Branches of foreign institutions are not allowed to provide asset management services for private pension funds or management of venture capital. The board of a financial institution should include at least two members, who are Hungarian citizens, residents in the meaning of the relevant foreign exchange regulations and have permanent residency in Hungary for at least one year.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIE: In the case of collective investment schemes constituted as unit trusts and variable capital companies (other than undertakings for collective investment in transferable securities, UCITS), the trustee/depository and management company is required to be incorporated in Ireland or in another European Union Member State (no branches). In the case of an investment limited partnership, at least one general partner must be incorporated in Ireland. To become a member of a stock exchange in Ireland, an entity must either (I) be authorised in Ireland, which requires that it be incorporated or be a partnership, with a head/registered office in Ireland, or (II) be authorised in another European Union Member State in accordance with the European Union Investment Services Directive.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nIT: In order to be authorised to manage the securities settlement system with an establishment in Italy, a company is required to be incorporated in Italy (no branches). In order to be authorised to manage central securities depository services with an establishment in Italy, companies are required to be incorporated in Italy (no branches). In the case of collective investment schemes other than UCITS harmonised under European Union legislation, the trustee/ depository is required to be incorporated in Italy or in another European Union Member State and established through a branch in Italy. Management companies of UCITS not harmonised under European Union legislation are also required to be incorporated in Italy (no branches). Only banks, insurance companies, investment firms and companies managing UCITS harmonised under European Union legislation having their legal head office in the European Union, as well as UCITS incorporated in Italy may carry out the activity of pension fund resources management. In providing the activity of door-to-door selling, intermediaries must utilise authorised financial salesmen resident within the territory of a European Union Member State. Representative offices of foreign intermediaries cannot carry out activities aimed at providing investment services.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLT: For the purpose of asset management, incorporation as a specialised management company (no branches) is required. Only firms having their registered office in Lithuania can act as the depositories of the assets.\n\n\nPT: Pension fund management may be provided only by specialized companies incorporated in Portugal for that purpose and by insurance companies established in Portugal and authorised to take up the life insurance business or by entities authorised to pension fund management in other European Union Member States (unbound for direct branching from non-European Union countries).\n\n\nRO: Branches of foreign institutions are not allowed to provide asset management\u00a0services.\n\n\nSK: Investment services in the Slovak Republic can be provided by banks, investment companies, investment funds and security dealers which have legal form of jointstock company with equity capital according to the law (no branches). \n\n\nSI: Unbound for private pension funds (non-compulsory pension funds). \n\n\nSE: A founder of a savings bank shall be a natural person resident in the European Union.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n13. HEALTH SERVICES AND SOCIAL SERVICES\n48\n\n\n\n(only privately funded services)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Hospital Services\n\n\n(CPC 9311)\n\n\nB. Ambulance Services\n\n\n(CPC 93192)\n\n\nC. Residential health facilities other than hospital services\n\n\n(CPC 93193)\n\n\nD. Social Services\n\n\n(CPC 933)\n\n\n\n\nEU: Participation of private operators in the health and social network is subject to concession. Economic needs tests may apply. Main criteria: number of and impact on existing establishments, transport infrastructure, population density, geographic spread, and creation of new employment.\n\n\nAT, SI: Unbound for ambulance services.\n\n\nBG: Unbound for hospital services, for ambulance services and for residential health facilities other than hospital services. \n\n\nCZ, FI, MT, SE, SK: Unbound\n\n\nHU, SI: Unbound for social services.\n\n\nPL: Unbound for ambulance services, for residential health facilities other than hospital services and for social services.\n\n\nBE, UK: Unbound for ambulance services, for residential health facilities other than hospital services and for social services other than convalescent and rest houses and old people's homes.\n\n\nCY: Unbound for hospital services, ambulance services, for residential health facilities other than hospital services and for social services other than convalescent and rest houses and old people's homes.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n14. TOURISM AND TRAVEL RELATED SERVICES\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Hotel, Restaurants and Catering \n\n\n(CPC 641, CPC 642 and CPC 643)\n\n\nexcluding catering in air transport services\n49\n\n\n\n\n\nBG: Incorporation is required (no branches).\n\n\nIT: Economic needs tests applied on bars, cafes and restaurants. Main criteria: population and density of existing establishments.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB. Travel Agencies and Tour Operators Services (including tour managers)\n\n\n(CPC 7471)\n\n\n\n\nBG: Unbound for direct branching (incorporation is required).\n\n\nPT: Requirement of constitution of a commercial company having its corporate base in Portugal (unbound for branches).\n\n\nCY (for Ecuador only): A licence to establish and operate a tourism and travel company, as well as the renewal of an operating licence of an existing company, shall be granted only to EU natural or legal persons.\n\n\nCZ: Economic needs test based on population criterion.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC. Tourist Guides Services\n\n\n(CPC 7472)\n\n\n\n\nBG, CY, HU, LT, MT, PL: Unbound\n\n\n\n\n\n\n15. RECREATIONAL, CULTURAL AND SPORTING SERVICES (other than audio-visual services)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Entertainment Services (including Theatre, Live Bands, Circus and Discotheque Services) \n\n\n(CPC 9619)\n\n\n\n\nCY, CZ, FI, MT, PL, RO, SI, SK: Unbound \n\n\nBG: Unbound except for theatrical producer, singer group, band and orchestra entertainment services (CPC \n\n96191\n\n), services provided by authors, composers, sculptors, entertainers and other individual artists (CPC \n\n96192\n\n) and ancillary theatrical services (CPC \n\n96193\n\n).\n\n\nEE: Unbound for other entertainment services (CPC \n\n96199\n\n) except for cinema theatre services. \n\n\nLV: Unbound except for cinema theatre operation services (part of CPC \n\n96199\n\n).\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB. News and Press Agencies Services \n\n\n(CPC 962)\n\n\n\n\nFR: Foreign participation in companies publishing publications in the French language may not exceed 20 per cent of the capital or of voting rights in the company. Establishment of press agencies by foreign investors is subject to reciprocity.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC. Libraries, archives, museums and other cultural services \n50\n\n\n\n(CPC 963)\n\n\n\n\nBE, BG, CY, CZ, DE, DK, ES, EE, FI, FR, EL, HR, HU, IE, IT, LV, LU, MT, NL, PL, PT, RO, SK, SI, SE, UK: Unbound\n\n\nAT, LT: Participation of private operators in the libraries, archives, museums and other cultural services' network is subject to concession or licence.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nD. Sporting services\n\n\n(CPC 9641) \n\n\n\n\n\nAT, SI: Unbound for ski school services and mountain guide services.\n\n\nBG, CY, CZ, EE, LV, MT, PL, RO, SK: Unbound\n\n\n\n\n\n\nE. Recreation park and beach Services \n\n\n(CPC 96491)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\n16. TRANSPORT\n\n\nSERVICES\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Maritime transport\n51\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) International passenger transportation \n\n\n(CPC 7211 less national cabotage transport).\n\n\nb) International freight transportation\n\n\n(CPC 7212 less national cabotage transport)\n52\n\n\n\n\n\nEU: Unbound for the establishment of a registered company for the purpose of operating a fleet under the national flag of the State of establishment.\n\n\nBG: Unbound for direct branching (incorporation is required).\n\n\nBG, CY, DE, EE, ES, FR, FI, EL, IT, LT, LV, MT, PL, PT, RO, SI, SE: Feedering services by authorisation.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB. Internal Waterways Transport\n53\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Passenger transportation\n\n\n(CPC 7221)\n\n\nb) Freight transportation\n\n\n(CPC 7222)\n\n\n\n\nEU: Measures based upon existing or future agreements on access to inland waterways (incl. agreements following the Rhine-Main-Danube link) reserve some traffic rights for operators based in the countries concerned and meeting nationality criteria regarding ownership. Regulations implementing the Mannheim Convention on Rhine Shipping. \n\n\nEU: Unbound for the establishment of a registered company for the purpose of operating a fleet under the national flag of the State of establishment.\n\n\nAT: Nationality condition in order to set up a shipping company by natural persons. In the case of establishment as legal person, nationality condition for the board of directors and the supervisory board. Registered company or permanent establishment in Austria is required. In addition the majority of the business shares must be held by European Union citizens.\n\n\nBG: Unbound for direct branching (incorporation is required).\n\n\nFI: Services can be provided only by ships operating under the Finnish flag.\n\n\nHR: Unbound.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC. Rail Transport\n54\n\n\n\na) Passenger transportation\n\n\n(CPC 7111)\n\n\nb) Freight transportation\n\n\n(CPC 7112)\n\n\n\n\nBG: Unbound for direct branching (incorporation is required).\n\n\nHR: Unbound.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nD. Road Transport\n55\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Passenger Transportation\n\n\n(CPC 7121 and CPC 7122)\n\n\n\n\nEU: Foreign investors cannot provide transport services within a European Union Member State (cabotage), except for rental of nonscheduled services of buses with operator.\n\n\nEU: Economic needs test for taxi services. Main criteria: number of and impact on existing establishments, population density, geographic spread, impact on traffic conditions and creation of new employment.\n\n\nAT, BG: Exclusive rights and/or authorisation can only be granted to European Union nationals and to European Union juridical persons having their headquarters in the European Union.\n\n\nBG: Unbound for direct branching (incorporation is required).\n\n\nFI, LV: Authorisation required, not extended to foreign registered vehicles.\n\n\nLV, SE: Requirement on established entities to use vehicles with national registration.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nES: Economic needs test for CPC 7122. Main criteria: Local demand.\n\n\nIT, PT: Economic needs test for limousine services. Main criteria: number of and impact on existing establishments, population density, geographic spread, impact on traffic conditions and creation of new employment.\n\n\nES, IE, IT: Economic needs test for intercity bussing services. Main criteria: number of and impact on existing establishments, population density, geographic spread, impact on traffic conditions and creation of new employment.\n\n\nFR: Unbound for intercity bussing services.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) Freight Transportation\n56\n\n\n\n(CPC 7123, excluding transportation of mail on own account\n57\n).\n\n\n\n\nAT, BG: Exclusive rights and/or authorisation can only be granted to European\u00a0Union nationals and to European Union juridical persons having their headquarters in the European Union.\n\n\nBG: Unbound for direct branching (incorporation is required).\n\n\nFI, LV: Authorisation required, not extended to foreign registered vehicles.\n\n\nLV, SE: Requirement on established entities to use vehicles with national\u00a0registration.\n\n\nIT, SK: Economic needs test. Main criteria is local demand.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nE. Pipeline transport of goods other than fuel\n58\n\u00a0\n59\n\n\n\n(CPC 7139)\n\n\n\n\nAT: Exclusive rights can only be granted to European Union nationals and to European Union juridical persons having their headquarters in the European Union.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n17 SERVICES AUXILIARY TO TRANSPORT\n60\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Services auxiliary to Maritime Transport\n61\n\n\n\na) Maritime Cargo Handling Services\n\n\nb) Storage and warehousing Services\n\n\n(part of CPC 742)\n\n\nc) Customs Clearance Services\n\n\nd) Container Station and Depot Services\n\n\ne) Maritime Agency Services\n\n\nf) Maritime Freight Forwarding Services\n\n\n\n\nEU: Unbound for rental of vessels with crew, pushing and towing services and supporting services for maritime transport.\n\n\nIT: Economic needs test for maritime cargo-handling services. Main criteria: number of and impact on existing establishments, population density, geographic spread and creation of new employment.\n\n\nBG: Unbound for direct branching (incorporation is required). Participation in Bulgarian companies is limited to 49 per cent.\n\n\nSI: Only juridical persons established in the Republic of Slovenia (no branches) can perform customs clearance.\n\n\nHR: Unbound for c) Customs Clearance Services, d) Container Station and Depot Services, e) Maritime Agency Services and f) Maritime Freight Forwarding Services. For a) Maritime Cargo Handling Services, b) Storage and warehousing Services, j) Other supporting and auxiliary services (including catering), h) Pushing and towing services and i) Supporting services for maritime transport: None, except that foreign legal person is required to establish a company in Croatia which should be granted a concession by the port authority, following a public tendering procedure. The number of service suppliers may be limited reflecting limitations in port capacity. \n\n\n\n\n\n\ng) Rental of Vessels with Crew\n\n\n(CPC 7213)\n\n\nh) Pushing and towing services \n\n\n(CPC 7214)\n\n\ni) Supporting services for maritime transport \n\n\n(part of CPC 745)\n\n\nj) Other supporting and auxiliary services (including catering)\n\n\n(part of CPC 749)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB. Services auxiliary to internal waterways transport\n62\n\n\n\na) Cargo-handling services\n\n\n(part of CPC 741)\n\n\nb) Storage and warehouse services\n\n\n(part of CPC 742)\n\n\nc) Freight transport agency services \n\n\n(part of CPC 748)\n\n\nd) Rental of Vessels with Crew\n\n\n(CPC 7223)\n\n\ne) Pushing and towing services \n\n\n(CPC 7224)\n\n\nf) Supporting services for internal waterway transport\n\n\n( part of CPC 745)\n\n\ng) Other supporting and auxiliary services \n\n\n(part of CPC 749)\n\n\n\n\nEU: Measures based upon existing or future agreements on access to inland waterways (incl. agreements following the Rhine-Main-Danube link) reserve some traffic rights for operators based in the countries concerned and meeting nationality criteria regarding ownership. Regulations implementing the Mannheim Convention on Rhine Shipping.\n\n\nEU: Unbound for rental of vessels with crew, pushing and towing services and supporting services for internal waterway transport.\n\n\nAT: Nationality condition in order to set up a shipping company by natural persons. In the case of establishment as legal person, nationality condition for the board of directors and the supervisory board. Registered company or permanent establishment in Austria is required. In addition the majority of the business shares must be held by European Union citizens.\n\n\nBG: Unbound for direct branching (incorporation is required). Participation in Bulgarian companies is limited to 49 per cent.\n\n\nHU: Participation of the State may be required in an establishment.\n\n\nSI: Only juridical persons established in the Republic of Slovenia (no branches) can perform customs clearance. \n\n\nHR: Unbound.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC. Services auxiliary to rail transport\n63\n\u00a0\n\n\na) Cargo-handling services\n\n\n(part of CPC 741)\n\n\nb) Storage and warehouse services\n\n\n(part of CPC 742)\n\n\nc) Freight transport agency services \n\n\n(part of CPC 748)\n\n\nd) Pushing and towing services \n\n\n(CPC 7113)\n\n\ne) Supporting services for rail transport services \n\n\n(CPC 743)\n\n\nf) Other supporting and auxiliary services\n\n\n(part of CPC 749)\n\n\ng) Customs Clearance Services\n\n\n\n\nBG: Unbound for direct branching (incorporation is required). Participation in Bulgarian companies is limited to 49 per cent\n\n\nSI: Only juridical persons established in the Republic of Slovenia (no branches) can perform customs clearance\n\n\nHR: Unbound for d) pushing and towing services and g) Customs Clearance Services.\n\n\nHU: Unbound for customs clearance services\n\n\nPL: national restrictions concerning direct representation in customs clearance services: it can be performed by customs agents only who have the residence in the territory of European Union. \n\n\nFR: Unbound except if full reciprocity is granted.\n\n\nFI: Unbound for direct branching\n\n\nNL: the admittance of natural or juridical persons to act as customs representatives is subject to discretion by the inspector, as provided by articles\u00a01(3) and 1(9) of the General Customs Act. Admittance will be denied in case the applicant has been irrevocably sentenced for a criminal act in the past five years. Customs representatives, who are not a resident of or established in the Netherlands, are required to take residence or establish a fixed location in the Netherlands, before they perform activities as an admitted customs representative.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nD. Services auxiliary to road transport\n64\n\n\n\na) Cargo-handling services\n\n\n(part of CPC 741)\n\n\nb) Storage and warehouse services\n\n\n(part of CPC 742)\n\n\nc) Freight transport agency services \n\n\n(part of CPC 748)\n\n\n\n\nAT: For rental of commercial road vehicles with operators, authorisation can only be granted to European Union nationals and to European Union juridical persons having their headquarters in the European Union.\n\n\nBG: Unbound for direct branching (incorporation is required). Participation in Bulgarian companies is limited to 49 per cent.\n\n\nFI: For rental of commercial road vehicles with operators, authorisation required, not extended to foreign registered vehicles.\n\n\nSI: Only juridical persons established in the Republic of Slovenia (no branches) can perform customs clearance.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nd) Rental of Commercial Road Vehicles with Operators\n\n\n(CPC 7124)\n\n\ne) Supporting services for road transport equipment\n\n\n(CPC 744)\n\n\nf) Other supporting and auxiliary services\n\n\n(part of CPC 749)\n\n\ng) Customs Clearance Services\n\n\n\n\nHR: Unbound for d) Rental of Commercial Road Vehicles with Operators and g) Customs Clearance Services.\n\n\nHU: Unbound for customs clearance services \n\n\nPL: national restrictions concerning direct representation in customs clearance services: it can be performed by customs agents only who have the residence in the territory of European Union. \n\n\nFR: Unbound except if full reciprocity is granted.\n\n\nFI: Unbound for direct branching\n\n\nNL: the admittance of natural or juridical persons to act as customs representatives is subject to discretion by the inspector, as provided by articles\u00a01(3) and 1(9) of the General Customs Act. Admittance will be denied in case the applicant has been irrevocably sentenced for a criminal act in the past five years. Customs representatives, who are not a resident of or established in the Netherlands, are required to take residence or establish a fixed location in the Netherlands, before they perform activities as an admitted customs representative.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nD. Services auxiliary to air transport services\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Ground handling services (including catering)\n\n\n\n\n\nEU: Categories of activities depend of size of airport. The number of providers in each airport can be limited due to available-space constraints and to not less than two suppliers for other reasons.\n\n\nBG: Unbound for direct branching (incorporation is required).\n\n\nHR: Unbound.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) Storage and warehouse services\n\n\n(part of CPC 742)\n\n\n\n\nBG: Unbound for direct branching (incorporation is required).\n\n\nPL: For storage services of frozen or refrigerated goods and bulk storage services of liquids or gases, categories of activities depend of size of airport. The number of providers in each airport can be limited due to available-space constraints and to not less than two suppliers for other reasons.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nc) Freight transport agency services \n\n\n(part of CPC 748)\n\n\n\n\nBG: Unbound for direct branching (incorporation is required).\n\n\nHU: Unbound\n\n\nSI: Only juridical persons established in the Republic of Slovenia (no branches) can perform customs clearance.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nd) Rental of aircraft with crew\n\n\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0(CPC 734)\n\n\n\n\nEU: Aircraft used by European Union carriers have to be registered in a European\u00a0Union Member State licensing the carrier or, if the licensing European Union Member State allows so, elsewhere in the European Union. \n\n\nTo be registered, aircraft may be required to be owned either by natural persons meeting specific nationality criteria or by juridical persons meeting specific criteria regarding ownership of capital and control. \n\n\nAircraft must be operated by air carriers owned either by natural persons meeting specific nationality criteria or by juridical persons meeting specific criteria regarding ownership of capital and control.\n\n\n\n\n\n\ne) Sales and Marketing\n\n\n\n\nEU: Specific obligations for investors operating computer reservation systems that are owned or controlled by air carriers.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nf) Computer Reservations System\n\n\n\n\nEU: Specific obligations for investors operating computer reservation systems that are owned or controlled by air carriers. \n\n\n\n\n\n\ng) Airport management\n65\n\n\n\n\n\nBG: Unbound for direct branching (incorporation is required).\n\n\nPL: Foreign participation is limited to 49 per cent.\n\n\nHR: Unbound.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nh) Customs Clearance Services\n\n\n\n\nBG: Unbound for direct branching (incorporation is required).\n\n\nSI: Only juridical persons established in the Republic of Slovenia (no branches) can perform customs clearance.\n\n\nHR, HU: Unbound\n\n\nPL: national restrictions concerning direct representation in customs clearance services: it can be performed by customs agents only who have the residence in the territory of European Union. \n\n\nFR: Unbound except if full reciprocity is granted.\n\n\nFI: Unbound for direct branching\n\n\nNL: the admittance of natural or juridical persons to act as customs representatives is subject to discretion by the inspector, as provided by articles\u00a01(3) and 1(9) of the General Customs Act. Admittance will be denied in case the applicant has been irrevocably sentenced for a criminal act in the past five years. Customs representatives, who are not a resident of or established in the Netherlands, are required to take residence or establish a fixed location in the Netherlands, before they perform activities as an admitted customs representative. \n\n\n\n\n\n\nE. Services auxiliary to pipeline transport of goods other than fuel\n66\n\n\n\na) Storage and warehouse services of goods other than fuel transported by pipelines\n67\n\u00a0\n\n\n(part of CPC 742)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\n18. ENERGY SERVICES\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Services Incidental to Mining\n68\n\n\n\n(CPC 883)\n69\n\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB. Pipeline Transportation of fuels\n70\n\n\n\n(CPC 7131)\n\n\n\n\nAT, BE, BG, CY, CZ, DE, DK, ES, EE, FI, FR, EL, IE, IT, LV, LU, MT, NL, PL, PT, RO, SK, SI, SE, UK: Unbound \n\n\n\n\n\n\nC. Storage and warehouse services of fuels transported through pipelines\n71\n\n\n\n(part of CPC 742)\n\n\n\n\nCY, CZ, MT, PL, SK: Investors from countries which are energy suppliers may be prohibited to obtain control of the activity. Unbound for direct branching (incorporation is required).\n\n\n\n\n\n\nD. Wholesale trade services of solid, liquid and gaseous fuels and related products\n\n\n(CPC 62271)\n\n\nand wholesale trade services of electricity, steam and hot water\n72\n\n\n\n\n\nEU: Unbound for wholesale trade services of electricity, steam and hot water.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nE. Retailing Services of motor fuel\n\n\n(CPC 613)\n\n\nF. Retail sales of fuel oil, bottled gas, coal and wood\n\n\n(CPC 63297)\n\n\nand retailing services of electricity, (non bottled) gas, steam and hot water\n73\n\n\n\n\n\nEU: Unbound for retailing services of motor fuel, electricity, (non bottled) gas, steam and hot water. \n\n\nBE, BG, DK, FR, IT, MT, PT: For retail sales of fuel oil, bottled gas, coal and wood, authorisation for department stores (in the case of France only for large stores) is subject to an economic needs test. Main criteria: number of and impact on existing stores, population density, geographic spread, impact on traffic conditions and creation of new employment.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nG. Services incidental to energy distribution\n74\n\n\n\n(CPC 887)\n\n\n\n\nAT, BE, BG, CY, CZ, DE, DK, ES, EE, FI, FR, EL, IE, HU, IT, LU, LT, MT, NL, PL, PT, RO, SK, SE, UK: Unbound except for consultancy services, where: none.\n\n\nSI: Unbound except for services incidental the distribution of gas, where: none. \n\n\n\n\n\n\n19. OTHER SERVICES NOT INCLUDED ELSEWHERE\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Washing, Cleaning and Dyeing services\n\n\n(CPC 9701)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) Hairdressing services\n(CPC\u00a097021)\n\n\n\n\nIT: Economic needs tests applied on a national treatment basis. The economic needs test, when applied, sets a limit on the number of enterprises. Main criteria: population and density of existing business.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nc) Cosmetic treatment, manicuring and pedicuring services \n\n\n(CPC\u00a097022)\n\n\n\n\nIT: Economic needs tests applied on a national treatment basis. The economic needs test, when applied, sets a limit on the number of enterprises. Main criteria: population and density of existing business.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nd) Other beauty treatment services n.e.c \n\n\n(CPC\u00a097029)\n\n\n\n\nIT: Economic needs tests applied on a national treatment basis. The economic needs test, when applied, sets a limit on the number of enterprises. Main criteria: population and density of existing business.\n\n\n\n\n\n\ne) Spa services and non therapeutical massages, to the extent that they are provided as relaxation physical well-being services and not for medical or rehabilitation purposes\n75\n\u00a0\n76\n\n\n\n(CPC ver. 1.0 97230)\n\n\n\n\nNone\u00a0\n\n\n\n\n\n\ng) Telecommunications connection services\n\n\n(CPC 7543)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(1)\nThe absence of European Union Member State-specific reservations in a given sector is without prejudice to horizontal reservations or to sectoral EU-broad reservations that may apply.\n\n\n\n(2)\nAs regards services sectors, these limitations do not go beyond the limitations reflected in the existing commitments under the GATS.\n\n\n\n(3)\nGiven that public utilities often also exist at the sub-central level, detailed and exhaustive sector-specific listing is not practical. To facilitate comprehension, specific footnotes in this list of commitments will indicate in an illustrative and non-exhaustive way those sectors where public utilities play a major role. \n\n\n\n(4)\nAdvisory and consultancy services related to agriculture, hunting, forestry and fishing are to be found in BUSINESS SERVICES under 6.F.f) and 6.F.g).\n\n\n\n(5)\nThe horizontal limitation on public utilities applies.\n\n\n\n(6)\nDoes not include services incidental to mining rendered on a fee or contract basis at oil and gas fields which are to be found in ENERGY SERVICES under 18.A.\n\n\n\n(7)\nDoes not include advisory services incidental to manufacturing, which are to be found in BUSINESS SERVICES under 6.F.h).\n\n\n\n(8)\nThe sector is limited to manufacturing activities. It does not include activities which are audiovisual related or present a cultural content. \n\n\n\n(9)\nPublishing and printing on a fee or contract basis is to be found in BUSINESS SERVICES under 6.F.p).\n\n\n\n(10)\nThe horizontal limitation on public utilities applies.\n\n\n\n(11)\nThe horizontal limitation on public utilities applies.\n\n\n\n(12)\nIt does not include operation of electricity transmission and distribution systems on a fee or contract basis, which are to be found in ENERGY SERVICES,.\n\n\n\n(13)\nIt does not include transportation of natural gas and gaseous fuels via pipelines, transmission and distribution of gas on a fee or contract basis and sales of natural gas and gaseous fuels, which are to be found in ENERGY SERVICES.\n\n\n\n(14)\nIt does not include transmission and distribution of steam and hot water on a fee or contract basis and sales of steam and hot water, which are to be found in ENERGY\u00a0SERVICES.\n\n\n\n(15)\nIt includes legal advisory, legal representational, legal arbitration and conciliation/mediation, and legal documentation and certification services. Provision of legal services is only authorised in respect of public international law, European Union law and the law of any jurisdiction where the investor or its personnel is qualified to practice as a lawyer, and, like the provision of other services, is subject to licensing requirements and procedures applicable in European Union Member States. For lawyers providing legal services in respect of public international law and foreign law, these may take inter alia the form of compliance with local codes of ethics, use of home title (unless recognition with the host title has been obtained) insurance requirements, simple registration with the host country Bar or a simplified admission to the host country Bar through an aptitude test and a legal or professional domicile in the host country. Legal services in respect of European Union law shall in principle be carried out by or through a fully qualified lawyer admitted to the Bar in the European Union acting personally, and legal services in respect of the law of an European Union Member\u00a0State shall in principle be carried out by or through a fully qualified lawyer admitted to the Bar in that European Union Member State acting personally. Full admission to the Bar in the relevant European Union Member State might therefore be necessary for representation before courts and other competent authorities in the European Union since it involves practice of European Union and national procedural law. However, in some European Union Member\u00a0States, foreign lawyers not fully admitted to the Bar are allowed to represent in civil proceedings a party being a national or belonging to the State in which the lawyer is entitled to practice.\n\n\n\n(16)\nIt does not include legal advisory and legal representational services on tax matters, which are to be found under 1.A.a). Legal services.\n\n\n\n(17)\nThe supply of pharmaceuticals to the general public, like the provision of other services, is subject to licensing and qualification requirements and procedures applicable in European Union Member States . As a general rule, this activity is reserved to pharmacists. In some European Union Member States, only the supply of prescription drugs is reserved to\u00a0pharmacists. \n\n\n\n(18)\nThe horizontal limitation on public utilities applies.\n\n\n\n(19)\nPart of CPC 85201 which is to be found under 6.A.h) - Medical and dental services.\n\n\n\n(20)\nThe service involved relates to the profession of real estate agent and does not affect any rights and/or restrictions on natural and juridical persons purchasing real estate.\n\n\n\n(21)\nThe horizontal limitation on public utilities applies to technical testing and analysis services compulsory for the granting of marketing authorisations or for utilisation authorisations (e.g. car inspection, food inspection).\n\n\n\n(22)\nThe horizontal limitation on public utilities applies to certain activities related to mining (minerals, oil, gas, etc.).\n\n\n\n(23)\nMaintenance and repair services of transport equipment (CPC 6112, 6122, 8867 and CPC 8868) are to be found under 6.F. l) 1 to 6.F.l) 4.\n\nMaintenance and repair services of office machinery and equipment including computers (CPC 845) are to be found under 6.B. Computer services.\n\n\n\n(24)\nIt does not include printing services, which fall under CPC 88442 and are to be found under 6.F p).\n\n\n\n(25)\nThe term \"handling\" should be taken to include clearance, sorting, transport and delivery.\n\n\n\n(26)\n\"Postal item\" refers to items handled by any type of commercial operator, whether public or private.\n\n\n\n(27)\nE.g. letter, postcards.\n\n\n\n(28)\nBooks, catalogues are included hereunder.\n\n\n\n(29)\nJournals, newspapers, periodicals.\n\n\n\n(30)\nExpress delivery services may include, in addition to greater speed and reliability, value added elements such as collection from point of origin, personal delivery to addressee, tracing and tracking, possibility of changing the destination and addressee in transit, confirmation of receipt.\n\n\n\n(31)\nProvision of means, including the supply of ad hoc premises as well as transportation by a third party, allowing self-delivery by mutual exchange of postal items between users subscribing to this service. Postal item refers to items handled by any type of commercial operator, whether public or private.\n\n\n\n(32)\nFor subsectors i) to iv), individual licences imposing particular universal services obligations and/or financial contribution to a compensation fund may be required.\n\n\n\n(33)\n\"Items of correspondence\" : a communication in written form on any kind of physical medium to be conveyed and delivered at the address indicated by the sender on the item itself or on its wrapping. Books, catalogues, newspapers and periodicals are not regarded as items of correspondence.\n\n\n\n(34)\nTransportation of mail on own account by any land mode.\n\n\n\n(35)\nTransportation of mail on own account by air.\n\n\n\n(36)\nThese services do not include on-line information and/or data processing (including transaction processing) (part of CPC 843) which is to be found under 1.B. Computer services.\n\n\n\n(37)\nBroadcasting is defined as the uninterrupted chain of transmission required for the distribution of TV and radio programme signals to the general public, but does not cover contribution links between operators.\n\n\n\n(38)\nFootnote for clarification purposes: Some European Union Member States maintain public participation in certain telecommunication operators. European Union Member States reserve their rights to maintain such public participation in the future. This is not a market access limitation. In Belgium, government participation and voting rights in Belgacom are freely determined under legislative powers as is presently the case under the law of 21 March 1991 on the reform of governmentowned economic enterprises.\n\n\n\n(39)\nThese services cover the telecommunications service consisting of the transmission and reception of radio and television broadcast by satellite (the uninterrupted chain of transmission via satellite required for the distribution of TV and radio programme signals to the general public). This covers selling use of satellite services, but does not include the selling of television programme packages to households.\n\n\n\n(40)\nThe horizontal limitation on public utilities applies to the distribution of chemical products, of pharmaceuticals, of products for medical use such as medical and surgical devices, medical substances and objects for medical use, of military equipment and precious metals (and stones) and in some European Union Member States also to the distribution of tobacco and tobacco products and of alcoholic beverages. \n\n\n\n(41)\nThese services, which include CPC 62271, are to be found in ENERGY SERVICES under\u00a018.D.\n\n\n\n(42)\nIt does not include maintenance and repair services, which are to be found in BUSINESS SERVICES under 6.B. and 6.F.l).\n\nIt does not include retailing services of energy products which are to be found in ENERGY SERVICES under 18.E and 18.F.\n\n\n\n(43)\nRetail sales of pharmaceutical, medical and orthopaedic goods are to be found under PROFESSIONAL SERVICES in 6.A.k).\n\n\n\n(44)\nThe horizontal limitation on public utilities applies.\n\n\n\n(45)\nIt corresponds to sewage services.\n\n\n\n(46)\nIt corresponds to Cleaning Services of Exhaust Gases.\n\n\n\n(47)\nIt corresponds to parts of Nature and Landscape Protection Services.\n\n\n\n(48)\nThe horizontal limitation on public utilities applies.\n\n\n\n(49)\nCatering in air transport services is to be found in SERVICES AUXILARY TO TRANSPORT SERVICES under 17.D.a) Ground handling services.\n\n\n\n(50)\nThe horizontal limitation on public utilities applies.\n\n\n\n(51)\nThe horizontal limitation on public utilities applies to port services and other maritime transport services requiring the use of the public domain. \n\n\n\n(52)\nIncludes feedering services and movement of equipment by international maritime transport suppliers between ports located in the same State when no revenue is involved.\n\n\n\n(53)\nThe horizontal limitation on public utilities applies to port services and other internal waterway transport services requiring the use of the public domain.\n\n\n\n(54)\nThe horizontal limitation on limitation on public utilities applies in some European Union Member States.\n\n\n\n(57)\nPart of CPC 71235, which is to be found in COMMUNICATION SERVICES under 7.A. applies.\n\n\n\n(60)\nDoes not include maintenance and repair services of transport equipment, which are to be found in BUSINESS SERVICES under 6.F.l) 1 to 6.F.l) 4. \n\n\n\n(61)\nThe horizontal limitation on public utilities applies to port services, to services auxiliary to maritime transport requiring the use of the public domain and to pushing and towing services.\n\n\n\n(62)\nThe horizontal limitation on public utilities applies to port services, to services auxiliary to maritime transport requiring the use of the public domain and to pushing and towing services.\n\n\n\n(63)\nThe horizontal limitation on public utilities applies when the services require the use of the public domain.\n\n\n\n(64)\nThe horizontal limitation on public utilities applies when the services require the use of the public domain.\n\n\n\n(65)\nThe horizontal limitation on public utilities applies.\n\n\n\n(66)\nServices auxiliary to pipeline transportation of fuels are to be found in ENERGY SERVICES. under\u00a018.C.\n\n\n\n(67)\nThe horizontal limitations on public utilities applies.\n\n\n\n(68)\nThe horizontal limitations on public utilities applies.\n\n\n\n(69)\nIncludes the following service rendered on a fee or contract basis: advisory and consulting services relating to mining, on land site preparation, on land rig installation, drilling, drilling bits services, casing and tubular services, mud engineering and supply, solids control, fishing and downhole special operations, wellsite geology and drilling control, core taking, well testing, wireline services, supply and operation of completion fluids (brines), supply and installation of completion devices, cementing (pressure pumping), stimulation services (fracturing, acidising and pressure pumping), workover and well repair services, plugging and abandoning of\u00a0wells.\n\nDoes not include direct access to or exploitation of natural resources.\n\nDoes not include site preparation work for mining of resources other than oil and gas (CPC 5115), which is to be found under 8. CONSTRUCTION SERVICES. \n\n\n\n(70)\nThe horizontal limitations on public utilities applies.\n\n\n\n(71)\nThe horizontal limitation on public utilities applies.\n\n\n\n(72)\nThe horizontal limitation on public utilities applies.\n\n\n\n(73)\nThe horizontal limitation on public utilities applies.\n\n\n\n(74)\nExcept for consulting services, the horizontal limitation on public utilities applies.\n\n\n\n(75)\nTherapeutical massages and thermal cure services are to be found under 6.A.h) Medical services, 6.A.j) 2 Services provided by nurses, physiotherapists and para-medical personnel and health services (13.A and 13 C).\n\n\n\n(76)\nThe horizontal limitation on public utilities applies to Spa services and non therapeutical massages provided in domains of public utility such as certain water sources.\n\n\n\n\n\nTop  \n\n\n\n\n\n\nEUROPEAN COMMISSION\nBrussels, 4.4.2016\nCOM(2016) 173 final\nANNEX\nto the\nProposal for a Council Decision\non the signing, on behalf of the European Union, and provisional application of the Protocol of Accession to the Trade Agreement  between the European Union and its Member States, of the one part, and Colombia and Peru, of the other part, to take account of the Accession of Ecuador\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nANNEX X\n\n\n(New Section D of Annex VII to the Agreement referred to in Article 114 of the Agreement)\n\n\nLIST OF COMMITMENTS ON ESTABLISHMENT\n\n\n'SECTION\u00a0D\n\n\nECUADOR\n\n\nThis Schedule of Commitments is consistent with the constitutional and legal provisions governing the area of Establishment in Ecuador.\n\n\nFor the preparation of this offer, account was taken of the United Nations Statistics Division's International Standard Industrial Classification of all Economic Activities, Statistical Reports, Series M, No. 4, revised ISIC, version 3.1, 2002, and of the United Nations Statistics Division's Central Products Classification, Statistical Reports, Series M, No. 77, provisional, 1991.\n\n\nFor methodological revision and analysis purposes:\n\n\n\u2013No commitments of any kind are being made in the sectors or sub-sectors of economic activities not shown on the list\n\n\n\u2013For the economic sub-sectors in which commitments are being maintained or new commitments are being incorporated, the amendments appear in the left-hand column headed \u201cSector or sub-sector\u201d\n\n\n\u2013Reservations, conditions and exclusions relative to the rules on market access and national treatment and applied to maintained or newly-incorporated commitments appear in the right-hand column headed \u201cDescription of reservations\u201d. \n\n\n\u2013To complement the list, the same right-hand column includes any comments considered necessary on the commitment or reservation being incorporated or maintained. \n\n\n\u2013Commitments in specific sectors or sub-sectors are subject to the horizontal reservations and limitations included in the first section, which apply across the board and unconditionally to all sectors unless otherwise stated.\n\n\n\u2013The commitments do not include measures relating to requirements, licences or recognitions, procedures or processes necessary for the exercise or development of an economic activity, that apply even when not shown on the list, unless they are presented as restrictions on the rules on market access and national treatment\n\n\nThe reservations, conditions and exclusions included on the list below will not apply, insofar as they present inconsistencies, to the sub-sectors and modes committed by Ecuador on the Schedule of Specific Commitments undertaken for its membership of the World Trade Organisation \u2013 WTO in 1996, a recast version of which can be found in document S/DCS/W/ECU of 24 January 2003, produced from the original texts of and amendments to documents GATS/SC/98/Suppl.1 and GATS/SC/98/Suppl.2, of the WTO General Agreement on Trade in Services (GATS). Accordingly, the said reservations, conditions and exclusions will be applicable to and required for the new sectors and/or modes of supply set out on the list below.\n\n\nIn accordance with the provisions included in Article 107(3) relating to the scope of the rules in the Title on Trade in Services, Establishment and Electronic Commerce, no measures that may be adopted or maintained by the State of Ecuador in relation to grants and subsidies are listed.\n\n\nSimilarly, based on Article 107(5) of the Title on Trade in Services, Establishment and Electronic Commerce, Ecuador reserves the right to establish, maintain and fully implement its national legislation with the aim of attaining legitimate policy objectives in areas such as the protection of vulnerable groups, consumer protection, health and the environment among others. \n\n\nIn accordance with Article 107(4) of the Title on Trade in Services, Establishment and Electronic Commerce, this offer does not include services provided in the exercise of governmental authority.\n\n\nThe rights and obligations derived from this schedule of commitments are not directly applicable and effective and thus do not confer directly enforceable rights on natural or legal persons.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector or sub-sector\n\n\n\n\nDescription of reservations\n\n\n\n\n\n\nALL SECTORS\n\n\n\n\nInvestment\n\n\nInvestment in certain economic activities related to the exploitation of strategic sectors or for the provision of public services will require concession rights, licences, authorisations or other forms of permission to be obtained beforehand in accordance with the relevant legislation applicable to the respective sector, as well as domiciliation or creation of an establishment in Ecuador for legal persons incorporated under the laws of another country and whose main domicile is in another country.\n\n\nThis requirement applies to the provision of public drinking and irrigation water, sanitation, electrical energy, telecommunications, highway administration and port and airport infrastructure services, services related to energy exploitation in all its forms, exploitation of non-renewable natural resources, transport and refining of hydrocarbons, biodiversity and genetic heritage, water and the radio spectrum. \n\n\nThe total or partial acquisition of blocks of shares or any rights over the control, management or administration of companies active in the areas listed in the preceding paragraph may be subject to the approval of the competent authorities. \n\n\nThe criteria for the granting of licences, authorisations and other forms of permission shall be transparent and non-discriminatory as regards the participation of establishments from the EU Party and shall not constitute a quantitative restriction for the establishment.\n\n\nThe specific commitments undertaken by Ecuador in this Agreement in strategic sectors and public services shall be considered as constituting the exceptional circumstances provided for in national legislation in relation to the delegation to private initiative in the provision of public services and in the strategic sectors.\n\n\nOwnership of land or waters\n\n\nForeign natural or legal persons may not, in any capacity, acquire land or concessions in national security zones for economic exploitation purposes.\n\n\nEcuador reserves the right to adopt or maintain measures related to the ownership of property by foreign nationals in border areas, on the national coasts or on island territory.\n\n\nRecruitment of foreign workers\n\n\nAny employer with a staff of more than 10 employees must employ Ecuadorian nationals at a proportion of not less than 90% of the staff of ordinary employees and not less than 80% of the skilled employees, specialists, administrative staff or persons in posts of responsibility. This restriction does not apply to employers with a staff of up to 10 employees. \n\n\nLegal representation\n\n\nThe legal representatives of all national or foreign companies that negotiate or contract obligations in Ecuador shall have an agent or representative in the Republic who can respond to requests and comply with the relevant requirements, and who must be resident in Ecuador.\n\n\nSocial Economy\n\n\nIn accordance with the Constitution of the Republic, Ecuador reserves the right to establish measures granting preferential and differential treatment to the sectors that operate and pursue activities using the social economy model, including the associative and community cooperative sectors. \n\n\nTax Arrangements\n\n\nTransfers or remittances of all kinds are subject to a currency outflow tax in Ecuador, which is considered fully compatible with the provisions of Article 296.\n\n\nCultural Heritage and Natural Heritage\n\n\nEcuador reserves the right to adopt or maintain any measure that grants rights or preferences to local communities with regard to the support, fostering, promotion and development of expressions related to the intangible cultural heritage. Similarly, it reserves the right to adopt or maintain any measure that grants rights or preferences to local communities with regard to the protection, preservation, recovery and promotion of Ecuador's natural heritage, taken to mean all of the physical, biological and geological features of value from the environmental, scientific, cultural or landscape point of view, including the national system of protected areas and fragile and threatened ecosystems.\n\n\nPublishing Industry\n\n\nEcuador reserves the right to adopt or maintain any measure that grants to a natural or legal person of the EU Party the same treatment as granted to a natural or legal person from Ecuador in the publishing sector of the latter Party.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1.\u00a0AGRICULTURE, LIVESTOCK, HUNTING AND FORESTRY\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Agriculture, hunting\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 011, 012, 013, 014, 015) excluding advisory and consultancy services\n1\n\n\n\n\n\nMA: None\n2\n\n\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB Forestry and logging\n\n\n(ISIC rev.3.1: 020) excluding advisory and consultancy services\n\n\n\n\nMA: None, except for the number of establishments, total number of operations and total production quantity.\n\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2. Fishing and aquaculture \n\n\n(ISIC rev.3.1: 0501, 0502) excluding advisory and consultancy services\n\n\n\n\nMA: None\n\n\nNT: None except:\n\n\nArtisanal fishing is reserved exclusively for Ecuadorian fishermen.\n\n\nFishing vessels may only recruit foreign crew if they have received the appropriate authorisation from the corresponding public body and for a specified length of time. \n\n\nInland maritime traffic is generally reserved for Ecuadorian vessels; foreign vessels may not travel on inland waterways without prior authorisation\n\n\nEntry into the country by shrimpers, prawn-fishing vessels and factory vessels flying a foreign flag is restricted, except where they need dock services for repairs or in the event of an unscheduled docking. \n\n\nForeign investment in larval laboratories and aquaculture research centres shall require the authorisation of the competent public authority.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3. Mining and quarrying \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA) Mining of coal and lignite; extraction of peat\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 10)\n\n\n\n\nMA: None\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB) Extraction of crude petroleum and natural gas (ISIC rev 3.1: 1110)\n\n\nDoes not include services incidental to mining rendered on a fee or contract basis at oil and gas fields.\n\n\n\n\nMA: Unbound\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC) Mining of metal ores (ISIC rev 3.1: 13)\n\n\n\n\n\nMA: None\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nD) Other mining and quarrying (ISIC rev 3.1: 14)\n\n\n\n\nMA: None\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nF) Manufacture of wood and of products of wood and cork, except furniture; manufacture of articles of straw and plaiting materials (ISIC rev 3.1: 20)\n\n\n\n\nMA: None\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nI) Manufacture of kiln products (ISIC rev 3.1: 231)\n\n\n\n\nMA: None\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nU) Recycling (ISIC rev 3.1: 37)\n\n\n\n\nMA: None\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4.
