Manufacture of furniture; manufacturing n.e.c. (ISIC rev 3.1: 361, 369)\n\n\n\n\nMA, NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nU. Recycling (ISIC rev 3.1: 37) \n\n\n\n\nMA: None\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5. PRODUCTION, TRANSMISSION AND DISTRIBUTION ON OWN ACCOUNT OF ELECTRICITY, GAS, STEAM AND HOT WATER (EXCLUDING NUCLEAR BASED ELECTRICITY GENERATION)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA) Production of electricity; transmission and distribution of electricity on own account (part of ISIC rev 3.1: 4010)\n\n\n\n\nMA: Unbound\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB) Distribution of gaseous fuels through mains (part of ISIC rev 3.1: 4020)\n\n\n\n\nMA: None\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC) Production of steam and hot water; distribution of steam and hot water on own account (part of ISIC rev 3.1: 4030).\n\n\n\n\nMA: None\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1. BUSINESS SERVICES\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Professional Services\n\n\n\n\nFor the purposes of exercising most professional services in Ecuador, professional qualifications obtained abroad must be recognised by the national competent authority, which generally requires residence in Ecuador before it can grant such recognition.\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Legal services (CPC 861) Only advisory services on foreign legislation and international law (excluding advisory services and legal representation under national law)\n\n\n\n\nMA, NT: None \n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) Accounting, auditing and bookkeeping services (CPC 862);\n\n\n\n\nMA, NT: None, except that accounting associations or companies may, for the joint exercise of the profession, consist solely of Ecuadorian nationals, or of Ecuadorian nationals and foreigners, in which case they shall consist of at least two-thirds Ecuadorian accountants, with any capital to respect the same proportions. Such associations or companies must be entered in the National Register of Accountants.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nc) Taxation services (CPC 863)\n\n\n\n\nMA, NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nd) and g) Architectural services (CPC 8671) including urban planning and landscape architectural services (CPC 8674)\n\n\n\n\nMA, NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\ne) Engineering services (CPC 8672) excluding services procured by the State\n\n\n\n\nMA, NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nf) Integrated engineering services (CPC 8673) excluding services procured by the State\n\n\n\n\n\nMA, NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB. Computer and Related Services\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Consultancy services related to the installation of computer hardware (CPC 841)\n\n\n\n\nMA, NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) Software implementation services (CPC 842)\n\n\n\n\nMA, NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nc) Data processing services (CPC 843)\n\n\n\n\nMA, NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nd) Database services (CPC 844)\n\n\n\n\nMA, NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\ne) Maintenance and repair services of office equipment including computers (CPC 845) and other computer services (CPC 849)\n\n\n\n\nMA, NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nD. Real Estate Services (CPC 821 + 822)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Real estate services involving own or leased property (CPC 821)\n\n\n\n\nMA, NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) Real Estate services on a fee or contract basis (CPC 822)\n\n\n\n\nMA: None\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nE. Rental/leasing Services without Operators\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Leasing or rental services concerning private cars without operator (CPC 83101)\n\n\n\n\nMA, NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) Leasing or rental services concerning vessels without crew (CPC 83103)\n\n\n\n\nMA, NT: None, save that national waterborne or cabotage transport is reserved exclusively for merchant vessels flying the Ecuadorian flag.\n\n\nInternational maritime transport of hydrocarbons is reserved for vessels owned by Ecuadorian state undertakings.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n*F. Other Business Services\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Sale or leasing services of advertising space or time (CPC 8711)\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) Market research and public opinion polling services (CPC 864)\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nc) Management consulting services (CPC 865) \n\n\nd) Services related to management consulting (CPC 866)\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\ne) Technical testing and analysis services (CPC 8676)\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nh) Services incidental to mining (CPC 883)\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\ni) Services incidental to manufacturing (CPC 884+885)\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nm) Related scientific and technical consulting services (CPC 8675)\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nn) Maintenance and repair of equipment (CPC 633 + 8861-8866)\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\no) Building-cleaning services (CPC 874)\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nq) Packaging services(CPC 876)\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\ns) Convention services (CPC 87909*)\n\n\n\n\nMA: None\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nt) Repair services of other transport equipment, on a fee or contract basis (CPC 8868)\n\n\n\n\nMA: None\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2. COMMUNICATION SERVICES\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Postal and courier services (part of CPC 7511 and CPC 7512)\n\n\nServices relating to the handling\u00a0of postal items, according to the following list of sub-sectors, whether for domestic or foreign destinations: \n\n\n(i) Handling of addressed written communications on any kind of physical medium including the direct mail and hybrid mail services, \n\n\n(ii) Handling of addressed parcels and packages, \n\n\n(iii) Handling of addressed press products, \n\n\n(iv) Handling of items referred to in (i) to (iii) above as registered or insured mail, \n\n\n(v) Express delivery services for items referred to in (i) to (iii) above, \n\n\n(vi) Handling of non-addressed items, \n\n\n(vii) Document exchange\n\n\n\n4\n\n5\n\n6\nCommitments in sub-sectors (i), (iv) and (v) are excluded when they fall into the scope of the services which may be reserved for the State, which is: for items of correspondence the price of which is less than two and a half times the public basic tariff, provided that they weigh less than\u00a050 grams, plus the registered mail service used in the course of judicial or administrative procedures. (Part of CPC 751, part of CPC 71235 and part of CPC 73210)\n\n\n\n\nUnder Ecuadorian law, a concession or other form of permission is required to provide postal and courier services in Ecuador\n\n\nMA: None, save that until the end of the fifth year following the entry into force of this Agreement it shall be considered that the scope of the services that may be reserved consists of those items of correspondence of which the price and weight are defined by national legislation\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC. Telecommunications Services\n\n\nIncluding the services listed below, excluding broadcasting \n\n\nThese services do not cover the economic activity consisting of the provision of content which requires telecommunications services for its transport.\n\n\n\n\nThe State reserves the right to define, in future, the cases in which it may require a concession or other form of permission to provide any of the services.\n\n\nEcuador reserves the right to adopt or maintain measures to ensure preferential assignment of radio spectrum to its public operator (Corporaci\u00f3n Nacional de Telecomunicaciones) to guarantee provision of the universal telecommunications service in isolated rural sectors, marginal urban sectors, and to persons on lower incomes, under conditions that do not affect the supply of that scarce resource for access to and participation on the commercial market by private operators.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) All services consisting of the transmission and reception of signals by any electromagnetic means, excluding radio and television broadcasting\n\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) Satellite capacity provision services, to connect television and radio broadcasting stations\n\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nc) Others\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3. CONSTRUCTION AND RELATED ENGINEERING SERVICES\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. General construction work for buildings (CPC 512)\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB. General construction work for civil engineering (CPC 513) excluding services procured by the State\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None \n\n\n\n\n\n\nC. Installation and assembling work (CPC 514+516)\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nD. Building completion and finishing work (CPC 517)\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nE. Others (CPC 511+515+518).\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4. DISTRIBUTION SERVICES\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA) Commission agents' services (CPC 6211) excluding the selling of fuels\n\n\n\n\nMA: None \n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB) Wholesale Trade Services \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Wholesale trade in commercial motor vehicles, motorcycles and snowmobiles and parts and accessories thereof (part of CPC 6111, part of CPC 6113 and part of CPC 6121)\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) Wholesale trade services of telecommunications terminal equipment (part of CPC 7542)\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nc) Other wholesale trade services (CPC 622) except energy goods, minerals, chemicals and pharmaceutical goods.\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC) Retailing services (part of CPC 63)\n\n\nOnly with regard to:\n\n\nFood retailing services (CPC 631)\n\n\nNon-food retailing services (CPC 632)\n\n\nSales of motor vehicles (CPC 6111)\n\n\nSales of parts and accessories of motor vehicles (CPC 6113)\n\n\nSales of motorcycles and snowmobiles and related parts and accessories (CPC 6121)\n\n\nSales of telecommunications equipment (CPC 7542)\n\n\n\n\n\nMA; None\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nD. Franchising (CPC 8929)\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n6. ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA) Sewage services (CPC 9401)\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB) Refuse disposal services (CPC 9402)\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC) Sanitation and similar services (CPC 9403)\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nD) Cleaning services of exhaust gases (CPC 9404) Noise abatement services (CPC 9405) Nature and Landscape Protection Services (CPC 9406); Other (CPC 9409)\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n7. FINANCIAL SERVICES\n\n\n\n\nUnder Ecuadorian legislation, it is not permitted to open parent or operating offices of institutions in the social economy financing sector, such as: savings and credit cooperatives, mutual or associative entities, communal funds and banks, savings banks and any other legal form or denomination existing in the country of origin and corresponding to this sector.\n\n\nFor greater transparency, for the establishment in Ecuador of undertakings dedicated to insurance, reinsurance and related services and the provision of banking services, other financial services and securities services in all their forms, express authorisation and compliance with all of the provisions laid down in the laws in force related to such activities are required. \n\n\nCreditors of the branches in Ecuador of a foreign financial institution shall enjoy preferential rights over the assets held in the country by that institution in the event of the liquidation of its parent office or the winding-up of its business affairs in Ecuador for any reason.\n\n\nFor greater transparency, the branches of foreign financial institutions, including insurance and reinsurance companies, must be established in Ecuador with minimum capital equal to that required for national financial institutions. \n\n\nForeign financial institutions that propose to open representation offices to serve as information centres for their clients or to place funds in the country in the form of lending or investments shall be required to obtain prior authorisation from the respective control body and may not perform any of the financial intermediation services provided for by the law. Furthermore, they shall refrain from providing information or advertising or providing any management or processing services related to operations of this type. They may not solicit funds or deposits in Ecuador for investment in another country, neither may they offer or invest in Ecuador securities issued in another country. \n\n\nFor greater transparency, the auxiliary services of the financial services related to the provision and transfer of financial information and the processing of financial data shall be registered in accordance with the rules laid down by the Superintendency of Banking, Insurance and Private Pension Fund Administrators. The said auxiliary services may not collect, maintain and deliver credit information. Financial information services or the processing of financial data shall be subject to the Ecuadorian provisions regulating the protection of such information.\n\n\nFor greater transparency, legal persons who provide financial services, including insurance, auxiliary services and securities, shall be established in accordance with the legal form of legal liability companies or persons in conformity with Ecuadorian law and are subject to non-discriminatory legal restrictions and to the allocation of minimum capital.\n\n\nFor greater transparency, institutions in the private financing system, their directors and main shareholders may not, either directly or indirectly, hold shares and units in undertakings or commercial companies outside the financial sector that have a presence in or are active on the Ecuadorian market, including those regulated by the Securities Market Act or the General Insurance Act.\n\n\nIn the interests of greater clarity, the providers of banking financial services in Ecuador through the set up of financial bodies or the total or partial acquisition of the shares of an existing financial body may not acquire or maintain a shareholding in bodies dedicated to the provision of insurance services or insurance-related services, securities services or securities-related services.\n\n\nA financial group in Ecuador consists of a bank that owns financial or auxiliary services companies and the subsidiaries within or outside Ecuador of any one of these, as provided for in the Organic Monetary and Financial Code in its version in force on September 12th 2014.\n\n\nRegardless of its composition, a financial group may not be made up of more than one bank, nor may it own more than one financial or auxiliary services company dedicated to the same activity.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. INSURANCE SERVICES\n\n\n\n\n\n1)Ecuador reserves the right to adopt measures geared towards assigning the provision of specific services associated with the management of public resources to insurance or reinsurance companies that are partially or totally owned by the State of Ecuador.\n\n\n2)Foreign insurance and reinsurance companies and intermediaries of foreign insurance and reinsurance companies may not open representation offices.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1) Insurance against risks associated with commercial maritime transport, covering vehicles, goods and the corresponding liability, and insurance against risks in aviation associated with international transport of goods\n\n\n\n\n\nMA: None\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2) Reinsurance and retrocession:\n\n\n\n\nMA: None\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3) Direct insurance (including co-insurance): \n\n\nI)Life\n\n\nII)Non-life\n\n\n\uf0b7Accident and medical insurance services.\n\n\n\uf0b7Freight insurance services\n\n\n\uf0b7Fire and other damage to property insurance services\n\n\n\uf0b7Financial loss insurance services\n\n\n\uf0b7General liability insurance services\n\n\n\n\n\nMA: None\n\n\nNT: None.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4) Insurance intermediation, such as brokerage and agency\n\n\n\n\nMA: None. \n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5) Services auxiliary to insurance, such as consultancy, actuarial, risk assessment and claim settlement services.\n\n\n\n\nMA; None\n\n\nNT: None \n\n\n\n\n\n\nB. BANKING AND OTHER FINANCIAL SERVICES (excluding insurance)\n\n\n\n\nEcuador reserves the right to adopt measures geared towards assigning the provision of specific services associated with the management of public resources to financial institutions that are partially or totally owned by the State of Ecuador.\n\n\nBranches are not permitted in the securities market institutions. \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Acceptance of deposits and other repayable funds from the public (CPC 81115-81119);\n\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) Lending of all types, including consumer credit, mortgage credit, factoring by financial institutions, and financing of commercial transactions (CPC 8113)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nc) Financial leasing services (CPC 8112)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nd) Payment and money transmission services: credit, charge and debit cards, travellers' cheques and bankers' drafts (CPC 81339)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\ne) Guarantees and commitments (CPC 81199)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nf) Trading for own account or for account of customers, whether on an exchange or in an over-the-counter market, the following:\n\n\n- money market instruments (cheques, bills, certificate of deposits etc.) (part of CPC 81339);\n\n\n- foreign exchange (CPC 81333),\n\n\n- derivative products: futures and options (part of CPC 81339)\n\n\n- exchange rate and interest rate instruments, swaps and forward rate agreements. (part of CPC 81339)\n\n\n- transferable securities (CPC 81321)\n\n\n- other negotiable instruments and financial assets, including bullion (part of CPC 71339)\n\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\ng) Participation in issues of all kinds of securities, including underwriting and placement as agent (whether publicly or privately) and provision of services related to such issues (CPC 8132)\n\n\n\n\nMA: None, except that registration of the issuer and of the securities to be issued is required \n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\ni) Asset management: cash or portfolio management, collective investment management, custodial, depository and trust services. (CPC 8119 + 81323)\n\n\n\n\nMA: None\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nj) settlement and clearing services for financial assets, including securities, derivative products, and other negotiable instruments. (CPC 81339 or 81319)\n\n\n\n\nMA: None\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nk) Advisory and other auxiliary financial services on all the activities listed under the heading banking and other financial services (excluding insurance):credit reference and analysis, investment and portfolio research and advice, advice on acquisitions and on corporate restructuring (CPC 8131 or 8133) \n\n\n\n\nMA: None, except than to collect, maintain and deliver credit information. \n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nl) Provision and transfers of financial information, financial data processing and related software by providers of other financial services. (CPC 8131)\n\n\n\n\nMA: None, except than to collect, maintain and deliver credit information.\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n8. HEALTH AND SOCIAL SERVICES (except those listed under 1.A h-j of the Classification W120)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA) Hospital services (CPC 9311)\n\n\n\n\n\nMA; None, except that the services offered by health and prepaid medical care companies must be provided by joint stock companies, whether national or foreign.\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n9. TOURISM AND TRAVEL RELATED SERVICES\n\n\n\n\nBefore starting any tourist activity as described in the Tourism Act, all natural or legal persons, undertakings or companies must obtain the relevant registration, namely registration of the tourism services provider in the public register of tourism entrepreneurs and establishments, within the Ministry of Tourism of Ecuador.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA) Hotels and Restaurants (including Catering) (CPC 641-643)\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB) Travel Agencies and Tour Operators Services\u00a0(including tour managers) (CPC 7471) \n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC) Tourist guides services (CPC 7472)\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n10. RECREATIONAL, CULTURAL AND SPORTING SERVICES\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA) Entertainment Services (including theatre, live bands and circus services) (CPC 9619)\n\n\n\nExcluded are: Gambling and Betting Services (CPC 96492)\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None, save that impresarios, natural or legal persons who contract foreign artistes, musical groups or orchestras shall be required to present national artistes as part of the same show, with such artistes to make up 60% of the artistic performance.\n\n\nThe wages paid to Ecuadorian artistes shall be no lower than 50% of those paid to the foreign artiste(s).\n\n\nThe provisions of the two preceding indents shall not apply in the cases of performances by foreign artistes, musical groups or orchestras sponsored by their respective governments or by national or international public bodies or organisations, or to those in which it is not possible to include the corresponding Ecuadorian counterparts because of the special artistic nature of the performance.\n\n\nForeign artistic performances sponsored by governments of other countries or by national or international public bodies or organisations must obtain the approval of the Ministry of Labour and Social Welfare, via the Directorate of Employment and Human Resources in consultation with FENARPE (the Ecuadorian National Federation of Professional Artistes).\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB) News and Press Agency Services (CPC\u00a0962)\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC) Libraries, archives, museums and other cultural services (CPC 963)\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nD) Sporting and other Recreational Services (CPC 964)\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n11. TRANSPORT SERVICES\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA) Maritime Transport Services\n\n\na) Passenger transportation (CPC 7211)\n\n\n\n\nMA; None\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) Freight transportation (CPC 7212) excluding national cabotage transport. Includes movement of equipment as long as no revenue is generated for the provider.\n\n\n\n\nMA: None \n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB. Internal Waterways Transport\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Passenger transportation (CPC 7221)\n\n\n\n\nMA: None\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) Freight transportation (CPC 7222) \n\n\n\n\nMA: None\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC. Rail transport\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nPassenger transportation (CPC 7111)\n\n\n\n\nMA: None\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nFreight transportation (CPC 7112) \n\n\n\n\nMA: None\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nF) Road Transport Services\n\n\na) Passenger transport services\n\n\nb) Freight transport services\n\n\nc) Rental of commercial vehicles with operator (CPC\u00a07121+7122+7123+7124) \n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None, save that Ecuador reserves the right to adopt or maintain any measure in relation to international land passenger or freight transport operations in border areas. \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n12. SERVICES AUXILIARY TO TRANSPORT\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA) Auxiliary services\u00a0(for maritime transport only)\n\n\na) Cargo-handling services\n\n\nb) Storage and warehousing services\n\n\nc) Freight transport agency services\n\n\nd) Towing and pushing assistance\n\n\ne) Provisioning, fuelling and watering\n\n\nf) Navigation aid services\n\n\ng) Emergency repair services\n\n\nh) Anchorage, berth and berthing services\n\n\n(CPC 741+742+748+749)\n\n\n\n\nHolders of concessions and other forms of permission to provide port services must be incorporated in Ecuador and have as their main corporate purpose the provision of such services or the performance of other activities related to the operation or administration of ports. In the case of natural persons, they must be domiciled in Ecuador and hold the corresponding authorisation.\n\n\nMA; NT: None, save that the loading, unloading and storage of hydrocarbons shall be assigned exclusively to national, State-owned or mixed shipping companies of which the State holds at least 51% of the share capital.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Services auxiliary to internal waterways transport\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None \n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) Storage and warehousing services \n\n\n(Part of CPC 742)\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nd) Rental of vessels with crew \n\n\n(CPC 7223)\n\n\n\n\nMA: Unbound\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\ne) Pushing and towing services \n\n\n(CPC 7224)\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\ng) Other supporting and auxiliary services \n\n\n(Part of CPC 749)\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC. Services auxiliary to rail transport\n\n\nd) Supporting services for rail transport services (CPC 743)\n\n\nf) Other supporting and auxiliary services (part of CPC 749)\n\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nD. Services auxiliary to road transport\n\n\na) Cargo-handling services\n\n\nb) Storage and warehousing services\n\n\nc) Freight transport agency services\n\n\ne) Supporting services for road transport equipment\n\n\nf) Other supporting and auxiliary services (CPC 741+ 742+ 744+ 749) (part of CPC 741)\n\n\n\n\n\nHolders of concessions and other forms of permission to provide port services must be incorporated in Ecuador and have as their main corporate purpose the provision of such services or the performance of other activities related to the operation or administration of ports. In the case of natural persons, they must be domiciled in Ecuador and hold the corresponding authorisation.\n\n\nMA; NT: None, save that the loading, unloading and storage of hydrocarbons shall be assigned exclusively to national, State-owned or mixed shipping companies of which the State holds at least 51% of the share capital.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nE. Services auxiliary to air transport services\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Airport operation services excluding cargo handling (CPC 7461 services)\n\n\n\n\nMA: NT: None\n7\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) Aircraft repair and maintenance services (Part of CPC 8868)\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None, save that in Ecuadorian companies only aeronautical technical personnel of Ecuadorian nationality may perform paid aeronautical activity in the country and the use of foreign technicians or foreign instructors of Ecuadorian technicians may only be authorised when this is necessary for the provision or improvement of an aeronautical service. Such authorisations will be granted by the Directorate-General for Civil Aviation for a period of no longer than six months, renewable for a similar period if the proven need for this persists. During these periods the contracted staff shall provide the appropriate training to the Ecuadorian staff who will replace them.\u00a0\n\n\n\n\n\n\nc) Selling and marketing of air transport services. \n\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nd) Computerised reservation services\n\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n13. ENERGY SERVICES\n\n\n\n\nIn order to conclude exploration and production contracts, foreign undertakings must establish a branch or set up a company in accordance with the Companies Act, establish a location in Ecuador and appoint an agent or legal representative resident in Ecuador. Foreign nationals must be entered in the public registers and appoint a legal representative of Ecuadorian nationality and resident in Ecuador.\n\n\nEcuador reserves the right to define the cases in which it may require a concession or other form of permission to provide such services. \n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. SERVICES INCIDENTAL TO EXPLORATION AND PRODUCTION\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nRelated scientific and technical consulting services;\n\n\n(CPC 8675)\n\n\n\nServices incidental to mining\n\n\n(CPC 883)\n\n\n\nMaintenance and repair services of metal products, of machinery and equipment, and of electrical machinery\n\n\n(part of CPC 8861-8866)\n\n\n\nEngineering services\n\n\n(CPC 8672)\n\n\n\nIntegrated engineering services\n\n\n(CPC 8673)\n\n\n\nManagement consulting services (CPC 865)\n\n\n\nServices related to management consulting\n\n\n(CPC 866)\n\n\n\nTechnical testing and analysis services\n\n\n(CPC 8676)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB. SERVICES INCIDENTAL TO THE CONSTRUCTION OF ENERGY INFRASTRUCTURE \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nConstruction of energy infrastructure\n\n\n\nLong distance pipelines, communication and power lines (cables) (CPC 51340)\n\n\n\nUrban pipelines and cables; ancillary works (CPC 51350)\n\n\n\nConstructions for mining and manufacturing (CPC 51360)\n\n\n\nRenting services related to equipment for construction or demolition of buildings or civil engineering works, with operators (CPC 518)\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMA: Unbound\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nD. STORAGE AND WAREHOUSING SERVICES\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nStorage services of liquids or gases (CPC 74220)\n\n\n\n\n\nMA: Unbound\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n'\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(1)\nAdvisory and consultancy services related to agriculture, hunting, forestry and fishing are to be found in BUSINESS SERVICES.\n\n\n\n(2)\nWithout prejudice to the powers of the Government of Ecuador to exercise its powers and regulate and introduce new regulations on the promotion of sustainable production and fair trade in agricultural goods, the development of agricultural practices that protect and promote food sovereignty, the fostering of economic and social conditions for farmers and rural communities and for the preservation, restoration and distribution of arable soils. \n\n\n\n(3)\nThe sector is limited to manufacturing activities. It does not include activities that are audiovisual related or present a cultural content. \n\n\n\n(4)\n\u201cItems of correspondence\u201d shall include written communications on any kind of physical medium to be conveyed and delivered at the address indicated by the sender on the item itself or on its wrapping. Books, catalogues, newspapers and other regular publications shall not be considered items of correspondence.\n\n\n\n(5)\nTransportation of mail on own account by any land mode.\n\n\n\n(6)\nTransportation of mail on own account by air.\n\n\n\n(7)\nSubject to concession\n\n\n\n\n\nTop  \n\n\n\n\n\n\nEUROPEAN COMMISSION\nBrussels, 4.4.2016\nCOM(2016) 173 final\nANNEX\nto the\nProposal for a Council Decision\n on the signing, on behalf of the European Union, and provisional application of the Protocol of Accession to the Trade Agreement  between the European Union and its Member States, of the one part, and Colombia and Peru, of the other part, to take account of the Accession of Ecuador\n\n\n\n\n\n\nANNEX XI\n\n\n(Section B of Annex VIII to the Agreement referred to in Article 118 of the Agreement)\n\n\nLIST OF COMMITMENTS ON CROSS-BORDER SUPPLY OF SERVICES \n\n\n'SECTION\u00a0B\n\n\nEU PARTY\n\n\nThe following abbreviations are used:\n\n\nAT\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Austria\n\n\nBE\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Belgium\n\n\nBG\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Bulgaria\n\n\nCY\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Cyprus\n\n\nCZ\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Czech Republic\n\n\nDE\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Germany\n\n\nDK\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Denmark\n\n\nES\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Spain\n\n\nEE\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Estonia\n\n\nEU\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0European Union, including all its Member States\n\n\nFI\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Finland\n\n\nFR\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0France\n\n\nEL\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Greece\n\n\n\n\nHR\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Croatia\n\n\nHU\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Hungary\n\n\nIE\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Ireland\n\n\nIT\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Italy\n\n\nLV\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Latvia\n\n\nLT\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Lithuania\n\n\nLU\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Luxembourg\n\n\nMT\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Malta\n\n\nNL\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The Netherlands\n\n\nPL\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Poland\n\n\nPT\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Portugal\n\n\nRO\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Romania\n\n\n\nSK\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Slovak Republic\n\n\nSI\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Slovenia\n\n\nSE\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Sweden\n\n\nUK\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0United Kingdom\n\n\n1.The list of commitments below indicates the services sectors liberalised pursuant to Article\u00a0121 of this Agreement, and, by means of reservations, the market access and national treatment limitations that apply to signatory Andean Countries services and services suppliers in those sectors. The list is composed of the following elements:\n\n\n(a)A first column indicating the sector or sub-sector in which the commitment is assumed by the Party, and the scope of liberalisation to which the reservations apply; and\n\n\n(b)A second column describing the applicable reservations.\n\n\nWhen the column referred to under subparagraph (b) only includes European Union Member State -specific reservations, European Union Member States not mentioned therein undertake commitments in the sector concerned without reservations\n1\n. \n\n\n\n\nCross-border supply of services in sectors or sub-sectors covered by this Agreement and not mentioned in the list below is not committed. \n\n\n2.In identifying individual sectors and sub-sectors:\n\n\n(a)\"CPC\" means the Central Products Classification as set out in Statistical Office of the United Nations, Statistical Papers, Series M, N\u00b0 77, CPC prov,\u00a01991;and\n\n\n(b)\"CPC ver. 1.0\" means the Central Products Classification as set out in Statistical Office of the United Nations, Statistical Papers, Series M, N\u00b0 77, CPC ver 1.0, 1998.\n\n\n3.The list below does not include measures relating to qualification requirements and procedures, technical standards and licensing requirements and procedures when they do not constitute a market access or a national treatment limitation within the meaning of Articles\u00a0119 and 120 of this Agreement. Those measures (e.g. need to obtain a license, universal service obligations, need to obtain recognition of qualifications in regulated sectors, need to pass specific examinations, including language examinations), even if not listed, apply in any case to signatory Andean Countries service suppliers.\n\n\n4.The list below is without prejudice to the feasibility of Mode 1 in certain services sectors and sub-sectors and without prejudice to the existence of public monopolies and exclusive rights as described in the list of commitments on establishment.\n\n\n5.In accordance with Article 107, paragraph 3 of this Agreement, the list below does not include measures concerning subsidies granted by the Parties.\n\n\n6.The rights and obligations arising from this list of commitments shall have no self-executing effect and thus confer no rights directly to individual natural persons or juridical persons.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector or Sub-Sector\n\n\n\n\nDescription of Reservations\n\n\n\n\n\n\nALL SECTORS\n\n\n\n\nReal estate\n\n\nFor Modes 1 and 2\n\n\nAT, BG, CY, CZ, DK, EE, EL, FI, HU, IE, IT, LT, LV, MT, PL, RO, SI, SK: Limitations on acquisition of land and real estate by foreign investors\n2\n.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1. BUSINESS SERVICES\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Professional Services\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Legal Services \n\n\n(CPC 861)\n3\n\n\n\nexcluding legal advisory and legal documentations and certification services provided by legal professionals entrusted with public functions, such as notaries, huissiers de justice or other officiers publics et minist\u00e9riels\n\n\n\n\nFor Modes 1 and 2\n\n\nAT, CY, ES, EL, LT, MT, SK: Full admission to the Bar, required for the practice of domestic (European Union and its Member States) law, is subject to a nationality condition.\n\n\nHR: Unbound for practicing of Croatian law.\n\n\nBE, FI: Full admission to the Bar, required for legal representation services, is subject to a nationality condition, coupled with residency requirements. In Belgium quotas apply for appearing before the \"Cour de cassation\" in non-criminal cases.\n\n\nBG: Foreign lawyers can only provide legal representation services of a national of their home country and subject to reciprocity and cooperation with a Bulgarian lawyer. For legal mediation services permanent residence is required.\n\n\nFR: Lawyers' access to the profession of \"avocat aupr\u00e8s de la Cour de Cassation\" and \"avocat aupr\u00e8s du Conseil d'Etat\" is subject to quotas and to a nationality condition.\n\n\nHU: Full admission to the Bar is subject to a nationality condition, coupled with residency requirements. For foreign lawyers the scope of legal activities is limited to the provision of legal advice.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLV: Nationality requirement for sworn solicitors, to whom legal representation in criminal proceedings is reserved.\n\n\nDK: Marketing of legal advice activities is restricted to lawyers with a Danish licence to practice and law firms registered in Denmark. Requirement of a Danish legal examination in order to obtain a Danish licence.\n\n\nSE: Admission to the Bar, necessary only for the use of the Swedish title \"advokat\", is subject to a residency requirement.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) 1. Accounting and Bookkeeping Services\n\n\n(CPC 86212 other than \"auditing services\", CPC 86213, CPC 86219 and CPC 86220)\n\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1\n\n\nFR, HU, IT, MT, RO, SI: Unbound\n\n\nAT: Nationality condition for representation before competent authorities\n\n\nFor Mode 2\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) 2. Auditing services\n\n\n(CPC 86211 and 86212 other than accounting services)\n\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1\n\n\nBE, BG, CY, DE, ES, FI, FR, EL, HU, IE, IT, LU, MT, NL, PT, RO, SI, UK: Unbound\n\n\nAT: Nationality condition for representation before competent authorities and for performing audits provided for in specific Austrian laws (e.g. joint stock companies law, stock exchange law, banking law, etc.).\n\n\nHR: Foreign audit firms may provide audit services on Croatian territory when they have established a branch.\n\n\nSE: Only auditors approved in Sweden may perform legal auditing services in certain legal entities, a.o. in all limited companies. Only such persons may be shareowners or form partnerships in companies which practice qualified auditing (for official purposes). Residency required for approval.\n\n\nLT: Auditor's report must be prepared in conjunction with an auditor accredited to practice in Lithuania\n\n\nFor Mode 2\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nc) Taxation Advisory Services\n\n\n(CPC 863)\n4\n\n\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1\n\n\nAT: Nationality condition for representation before competent authorities.\n\n\nCY: Tax agents must be duly authorized by the Minister of Finance. Authorization is subject to an economic needs test. The criteria used are analogous to those for granting permission for foreign investment (listed in horizontal section), as they apply to this sub-sector, always taking into consideration the employment situation in the sub-sector.\n\n\nBG, MT, RO, SI: Unbound\n\n\nFor Mode 2\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nd) Architectural services\n\n\nand\n\n\ne) Urban planning and landscape architectural services\n\n\n(CPC 8671 and CPC 8674)\n\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1\n\n\nAT: Unbound except for planning services.\n\n\nBE, BG, CY, EL, IT, MT, PL, PT, SI: Unbound\n\n\nDE: Application of the national rules on fees and emoluments for all services which are performed from abroad.\n\n\nHR: Natural and legal persons may supply architectural services upon approval of the Croatian Chamber of Architects. A design or project elaborated abroad must be recognized (validated) by an authorized natural or legal person in Croatia with regard to its compliance with Croatian Law. Unbound for urban planning.\n\n\nHU, RO: Unbound for landscape architectural services\n\n\nFor Mode 2\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nf) Engineering services; and\n\n\ng) Integrated engineering services\n\n\n(CPC 8672 and CPC 8673)\n\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1\n\n\nAT, SI: Unbound except for pure planning services.\n\n\nBG, CY, EL, IT, MT, PT: Unbound\n\n\nHR: Natural and legal persons may supply engineering services upon approval of the Croatian Chamber of Engineers. A design or project elaborated abroad must be recognized (validated) by an authorized natural or legal person in Croatia with regard to its compliance with Croatian Law.\n\n\nFor Mode 2\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nh) Medical (including Psychologists), and Dental services\n\n\n(CPC 9312 and \n\n\npart of CPC 85201) \n\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1\n\n\nAT, BE, BG, CY, DE, DK, EE, ES, FI, FR, EL, IE, IT, LU, MT, NL, PT, RO, SK, UK: Unbound \n\n\nHR: Unbound, except for telemedicine.\nSI: Unbound for social medicine, sanitary, epidemiological, medical/ecological services, the supply of blood, blood preparations and transplants and autopsy.\n\n\nFor Mode 2\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\ni) Veterinary services\n\n\n(CPC 932)\n\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1\n\n\nAT, BE, BG, CY, CZ, DE, DK, EE, ES, FR, EL, HU, IE, IT, LV, LT, MT, NL, PT, RO, SI, SK: Unbound \n\n\nUK: Unbound except for veterinary laboratory and technical services supplied to veterinary surgeons, general advice, guidance and information e.g.: nutritional, behaviour and pet care.\n\n\nFor Mode 2\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nj) 1. Midwives services\n\n\n(part of CPC 93191)\n\n\nj) 2. Services provided by Nurses, Physiotherapists and Paramedical Personnel\n\n\n(part of CPC 93191)\n\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1\n\n\nAT, BE, BG, CY, CZ, DE, DK, EE, ES, FR, EL, HU, IE, IT, LV, LT, LU, MT, NL, PT, RO, SI, SK, UK: Unbound\n\n\nFI, PL: Unbound except for nurses. \n\n\nHR: Unbound, except for telemedicine.\n\n\nFor Mode 2\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nk) Retail sales of pharmaceuticals and retail sales of medical and orthopaedical goods \n\n\n(CPC 63211)\n\n\nand other services supplied by pharmacists\n5\n\n\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1\n\n\nAT, BE, BG, DE, CY, CZ (for Ecuador only), DK, ES, FI, FR, EL, IE, IT, LU, MT, NL, PL, PT, RO, SK, SE, SI, UK: Unbound\n\n\nCZ (for Colombia and Peru only), LV, LT: Unbound except for mail order.\n\n\nHU: Unbound except for CPC 63211.\n\n\nFor Mode 2\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB. Computer and Related Services\n\n\n(CPC 84)\n\n\n\n\nFor Modes 1 and 2\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC. Research and Development Services\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Research and Development services on natural sciences\n\n\n(CPC 851)\n\n\nb) Research and Development services on Social Sciences and Humanities\n\n\n(CPC 852 excluding psychologists services)\n6\n\n\n\nc) Interdisciplinary Research and Development services\n\n\n(CPC 853)\n\n\n\n\nFor a) and c):\n\n\nFor Modes 1 and 2\n\n\nEU: For publicly funded Research and Development services, exclusive rights and/or authorisations can only be granted to European Union nationals and to European Union juridical persons having their headquarters in the European\u00a0Union.\n\n\nFor b):\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nD. Real Estate Services\n7\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Involving Own or Leased Property \n\n\n(CPC 821)\n\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1\n\n\nBG, CY, CZ, EE, HU, IE, LV, LT, MT, PL, RO, SK, SI: Unbound\n\n\nHR: Commercial presence required. \n\n\nFor Mode 2\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) On a Fee or Contract Basis\n\n\n(CPC 822)\n\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1\n\n\nBG, CY, CZ, EE, HU, IE, LV, LT, MT, PL, RO, SK, SI: Unbound\n\n\nHR: Commercial presence required. \n\n\nFor Mode 2\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nE. Other Business Services \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Advertising\n\n\n(CPC 871)\n\n\n\n\nFor Modes 1 and 2:\n\n\nNone.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) Market Research and Opinion Polling\n\n\n(CPC 864)\n\n\n\n\nFor Modes 1 and 2:\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nc) Management Consulting Services\n\n\n(CPC 865)\n\n\n\n\nFor Modes 1 and 2:\n\n\nNone.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nd) Services Related to Management Consulting\n\n\n(CPC 866)\n\n\n\n\nFor Modes 1 and 2:\n\n\nHU: Unbound for arbitration and conciliation services (CPC 86602).\n\n\n\n\n\n\ne) Technical Testing and Analysis Services\n\n\n(CPC 8676)\n\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1\n\n\nIT: Unbound for the profession of biologist and chemical analyst.\n\n\nHR: Unbound for services related to issuance of mandatory certificates and similar official documents.\n\n\nBG, CY, CZ, MT, PL, RO, SK, SE: Unbound\n\n\nFor Mode 2\n\n\nBG, CY, CZ, MT, PL, RO, SK, SE: Unbound\n\n\nHR: Unbound for services related to issuance of mandatory certificates and similar official documents.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nf) Advisory and Consulting services incidental to Agriculture, Hunting and Forestry\n\n\n(part of CPC 881)\n\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1\n\n\nIT: Unbound for activities reserved to agronomist and \"periti agrari\".\n\n\nCY, EE, MT, RO, SI: Unbound\n\n\nFor Mode 2\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\ng) Advisory and Consulting Services Relating to Fishing\n\n\n(part of CPC 882)\n\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1\n\n\nLV, MT, RO, SI: Unbound\n\n\nFor Mode 2\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nh) Advisory and Consulting Services incidental to Manufacturing\n\n\n(part of CPC 884 and part of CPC 885)\n\n\n\n\nFor Modes 1 and 2\n\n\nNone.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\ni) Placement and Supply Services of Personnel \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\ni) 1. Executive search \n\n\n(CPC 87201)\n\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1\n\n\nAT, BG, CY, CZ, DE, EE, ES, FI, HR, IE, LV, LT, MT, PL, PT, RO, SK, SI, SE: Unbound\n\n\nFor Mode 2\n\n\nAT, BG, CY, CZ, DE, EE, ES, FI, HR, IE, LV, LT, MT, PL, PT, RO, SK, SI: Unbound\n\n\n\n\n\n\ni) 2. Placement Services \n\n\n(CPC 87202)\n\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1\n\n\nAT, BE, BG, CY, CZ, DE, DK, EE, ES, EL, FI, FR, HR, IE, IT, LU, LV, LT, MT, NL, PL, PT, RO, SI, SE, SK, UK: Unbound \n\n\nFor Mode 2\n\n\nAT, BG, CY, CZ, DE, DK, EE, ES, EL, FI, FR, HR, IE, IT, LU, LV, LT, MT, NL, PL, PT, RO, SI, SK, UK: Unbound\n\n\n\n\n\n\ni) 3. Supply Services of office support personnel\n\n\n(CPC 87203)\n\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1\n\n\nAT, BG, CY, CZ, DE, EE, ES, FI, FR, HR, IT, IE, LV, LT, MT, NL, PL, PT, RO, SE, SK, SI: Unbound\n\n\nFor Mode 2\n\n\nAT, BG, CY, CZ, DE, EE, ES, FI, FR, HR, IT, IE, LV, LT, MT, NL, PL, PT, RO, SK, SI: Unbound\n\n\n\n\n\n\nj) 1. Investigation Services\n\n\n(CPC 87301)\n\n\n\n\nFor Modes 1 and 2\n\n\nBE, BG, CY, CZ, DE, DK, ES, EE, FI, FR, EL, HR, HU, IE, IT, LV, LT, LU, MT, NL, PL, PT, RO, SK, SI, UK: Unbound \n\n\n\n\n\n\nj) 2. Security Services \n\n\n(CPC 87302, CPC 87303, CPC 87304 and CPC 87305)\n\n\n\n\nFor Modes 1 and 2\n\n\nHU: Unbound for CPC 87304, CPC 87305. \n\n\nBE, BG, CY, CZ, ES, EE, FI, FR, HR, IT, LV, LT, MT, PT, PL, RO, SI, SK: Unbound \n\n\n\n\n\n\nk) Related Scientific and Technical Consulting Services\n\n\n(CPC 8675)\n\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1\n\n\nBE, BG, CY, DE, DK, ES, FR, EL, IE, IT, LU, MT, NL, PL, PT, RO, SI, UK: Unbound for exploration services.\n\n\nHR: Services of basic geological, geodetic and mining consulting services as well as related environmental protection consulting services on the territory of Croatia can be carried out only jointly with/or through domestic legal persons.\n\n\nFor Mode 2\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nl) 1. Postal and Courier Services\n\n\n(Services relating to the handling\n10\n of postal items\n11\n according to the following list of sub-sectors, whether for domestic or foreign destinations: (i) Handling of addressed written communications on any kind of physical medium\n12\n, including Hybrid mail service and Direct mail, (ii) Handling of addressed parcels and packages\n13\n, (iii) Handling of addressed press products\n14\n, (iv) Handling of items referred to in (i) to (iii) above as registered or insured mail, (v) Express delivery services\n15\n for items referred to in (i) to (iii) above,( vi) Handling of non-addressed items, (vii) Document exchange\n16\n.\n\n\n\n\nFor Modes 1 and 2\n\n\nNone\n17\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSub-sectors (i), (iv) and (v) are however excluded when they fall into the scope of the services which may be reserved, which is: for items of correspondence the price of which is less than two and a half times the public basic tariff, provided that they weigh less than 50 grams\n18\n, plus the registered mail service used in the course of judicial or administrative procedures.) \n\n\n(part of CPC 751, part of CPC 71235\n19\n and part of CPC 73210\n20\n)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB. Telecommunications Services\u00a0\n\n\nThese services do not cover the economic activity consisting of the provision of content which requires telecommunications services for its transport.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) All services consisting of the transmission and reception of signals by any electromagnetic means\n21\n, excluding broadcasting\n22\n\u00a0\n\n\n\n\nFor Modes 1 and 2\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) Satellite broadcast transmission services\n23\n\n\n\n\n\nFor Modes 1 and 2\n\n\nEU: None except that service providers in this sector may be subject to obligations to safeguard general interest objectives related to the conveyance of content\u00a0through their network in line with the European Union regulatory framework for electronic communications.\n\n\nBE: Unbound\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3. CONSTRUCTION AND RELATED ENGINEERING SERVICES (CPC 511, CPC 512, CPC 513, CPC 514, CPC 515, CPC 516, CPC 517 and CPC 518) \n\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1\n\n\nCY, CZ, HU, LV, MT, SK: Unbound\n\n\n\nFor Mode 2\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4.DISTRIBUTION SERVICES\n\n\n(excluding distribution of arms, munitions, explosives and other war material)\n\n\nA. Commission Agents' Services\n\n\na) Commission Agents' Services of motor vehicles, motorcycles and snowmobiles and parts and accessories thereof\n\n\n(part of CPC 61111, part of CPC 6113 and part of CPC 6121 ) \n\n\nb) Other Commission Agents' Services\n\n\n(CPC 621)\n\n\nB. Wholesale Trade Services\n\n\na) Wholesale Trade Services of motor vehicles, motorcycles and snowmobiles and parts and accessories thereof\n\n\n(part of CPC 61111, part of CPC 6113 and part of CPC 6121 )\n\n\n\n\nFor Modes 1 and 2\n\n\nEU: Unbound for distribution of chemical products, of precious metals (and stones).\n\n\nAT: Unbound for distribution of pyrotechnical goods, of ignitable articles and blasting devices and of toxic substances.\n\n\nAT, BG: Unbound for distribution of products for medical use such as medical and surgical devices, medical substances and objects for medical use.\n\n\nHR: Unbound for tobacco products.\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1\n\n\nAT, BG, PL, RO: Unbound for distribution of tobacco and tobacco products. \n\n\nIT: For wholesale trade services, state monopoly on tobacco.\n\n\nBG, FI, PL, RO: Unbound for distribution of alcoholic beverages.\n\n\nSE: Unbound for retail distribution of alcoholic beverages\n\n\nAT, BG, CZ, FI, RO, SK, SI: Unbound for distribution of pharmaceuticals. \n\n\nBG, HU, PL: Unbound for commodity brokers' services.\n\n\nFR: For commission agents' services, unbound for traders and brokers working in 17 markets of national interest on fresh food products. Unbound for wholesale of pharmaceuticals.\n\n\nMT: Unbound for commission agents' services.\n\n\nBE, BG, CY, CZ, DE, DK, ES, FR, EL, IE, IT, LU, MT, NL, PL, PT, SK, UK: For retailing services, unbound except for mail order.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) Wholesale Trade Services of telecommunication terminal equipment\n\n\n(part of CPC 7542)\n\n\nc) Other wholesale trade services\n\n\n(CPC 622 excluding wholesale trade services of energy products\n24\n )\n\n\nC. Retailing Services\n25\n\n\n\nRetailing Services of motor vehicles, motorcycles and snowmobiles and parts and accessories thereof \n\n\n(CPC 61112, part of CPC 6113 and part of CPC 6121 )\n\n\nRetailing Services of telecommunication terminal equipment\n\n\n(part of CPC 7542)\n\n\nFood retailing services \n\n\n(CPC 631)\n\n\nRetailing services of other (non-energy) goods, except retail sales of pharmaceutical, medical and orthopaedic goods\n26\n\n\n\n(CPC 632 excluding CPC 63211 and 63297)\n\n\nD. Franchising \n\n\n(CPC 8929)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n5. EDUCATIONAL SERVICES (only privately-funded services) \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Primary Education Services \n\n\n(CPC 921)\n\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1\n\n\nBG, CY, FI, FR, HR, IT, MT, RO, SE, SI: Unbound\n\n\nFor Mode 2\n\n\nCY, FI, HR, MT, RO, SE, SI: Unbound\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB. Secondary Education Services\n\n\n(CPC 922)\n\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1\n\n\nBG, CY, FI, FR, HR, IT, MT, RO, SE: Unbound\n\n\nFor Mode 2\n\n\nCY, FI, MT, RO, SE: Unbound \n\n\nFor Modes 1 and 2\n\n\nLV: Unbound for education services relating to technical and vocational secondary school-type education services for handicapped students (CPC 9224). \n\n\n\n\n\n\nC. Higher Education Services\n\n\n(CPC 923)\n\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1\n\n\nAT, BG, CY, FI, FR, IT, MT, RO, SE: Unbound\n\n\nFor Mode 2\n\n\nAT, BG, CY, FI, MT, RO, SE: Unbound\n\n\nFor Modes 1 and 2\n\n\nCZ, SK: Unbound for higher education services, except post-secondary technical and vocational education services (CPC 92310).\n\n\n\n\n\n\nD. Adult Education Services\n\n\n(CPC 924)\n\n\n\n\nFor Modes 1 and 2\n\n\nAT: Unbound for adult education services by means of radio or television broadcasting.\n\n\nCY, FI, MT, RO, SE: Unbound.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nE. Other education services\n\n\n(CPC 929)\n\n\n\n\nFor Modes 1 and 2\n\n\nAT, BE, BG, CY, DE, DK, ES, EE, FI, FR, EL, HU, IE, IT, LV, LT, LU, MT, NL, PL, PT, RO, SI, SE, UK: Unbound.\n\n\nHR: None for correspondence education or education via telecommunications.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n6. Solid/hazardous waste management, excluding cross-border transport of hazardous waste\n\n\na) Refuse Disposal Services\n\n\n(CPC 9402)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\n\n\nb) Sanitation and Similar Services\n\n\n(CPC 9403)\n\n\nC. Protection of ambient air and climate\n\n\n(CPC 9404)\n28\n\n\n\nD. Noise and vibration abatement\n\n\n(CPC 9405)\n\n\nF. Protection of biodiversity and landscape \n\n\na) Nature and landscape protection services\n\n\n(part of CPC 9406)\n\n\nG. FINANCIAL SERVICES\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Insurance and insurance-related services\n\n\n\n\n\nFor Modes 1 and 2\n\n\nAT, BE, CZ, DE, DK, ES, FI, FR, EL, HU, IE, IT, LU, NL, PL, PT, RO, SK, SE, SI, UK: Unbound for direct insurance services except for insurance of risks relating to:\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Maritime shipping and commercial aviation and space launching and freight (including satellites), with such insurance to cover any or all of the following: the goods being transported, the vehicle transporting the goods and any liability arising therefrom; and \n\n\n(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0goods in international transit.\n\n\nAT: Promotional activity and intermediation on behalf of a subsidiary not established in the European Union or of a branch not established in Austria (except for reinsurance and retrocession) are prohibited. Compulsory air insurance, except for insurance of international commercial air transport, can be underwritten only by a subsidiary established in the European Union or by a branch established in Austria. Higher premium tax is due for insurance contracts (except for contracts on reinsurance and retrocession) which are written by a subsidiary not established in the European Union or by a branch not established in Austria. Exception from the higher tax can be granted.\n\n\nDK: Compulsory air transport insurance can be underwritten only by firms established in the European Union. No persons or companies (including insurance companies) may for business purposes in Denmark assist in effecting direct insurance for persons resident in Denmark, for Danish ships or for property in Denmark, other than insurance companies licensed by Danish law or by Danish competent authorities.\n\n\nDE: Compulsory air insurance policies can be underwritten only by a subsidiary established in the European Union or by a branch established in Germany. If a foreign insurance company has established a branch in Germany, it may conclude insurance contracts in Germany relating to international transport only through the branch established in Germany.\n\n\nFR: Insurance of risks relating to ground transport may be carried out only by insurance firms established in the European Union.\n\n\nPL: Unbound for reinsurance and retrocession except for risks relating to goods in international trade.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nPT: Air and maritime transport insurance, covering goods, aircraft, hull and liability can be underwritten only by firms established in the European Union; only persons or companies established in the European Union may act as intermediaries for such insurance business in Portugal.\n\n\nRO: Reinsurance on international market is allowed only if the reinsured risk cannot be placed on the domestic market.\n\n\nES: For actuarial services, residence requirement and three-year relevant experience.\n\n\nFor Mode 1\n\n\nAT, BE, CZ, DE, DK, ES, FI, FR, EL, HU, IE, IT, LU, NL, PT, RO, SK, SE, SI, UK: Unbound for direct insurance intermediation services except for insurance of risks relating to:\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Maritime shipping and commercial aviation and space launching and freight (including satellites), with such insurance to cover any or all of the following: the goods being transported, the vehicle transporting the goods and any liability arising therefrom; and \n\n\n(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0goods in international transit.\n\n\nBG: Unbound for direct insurance, except for services supplied by foreign suppliers to foreign persons in the territory of the Republic of Bulgaria. Transport insurance, covering goods, insurance of vehicles as such and liability insurance regarding risks located in the Republic of Bulgaria may not be underwritten by foreign insurance companies directly. A foreign insurance company may conclude insurance contracts only through a branch. Unbound for deposit insurance and similar compensations schemes, as well as mandatory insurance schemes.\n\n\nCY, LV, MT: Unbound for direct insurance services except for insurance of risks relating to:\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Maritime shipping and commercial aviation and space launching and freight (including satellites), with such insurance to cover any or all of the following: the goods being transported, the vehicle transporting the goods and any liability arising therefrom; and \n\n\n(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0goods in international transit.\n\n\nLT: Unbound for direct insurance services except for insurance of risks relating to:\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Maritime shipping and commercial aviation and space launching and freight (including satellites), with such insurance to cover any or all of the following: the goods being transported, the vehicle transporting the goods and any liability arising therefrom; and \n\n\n(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0goods in international transit, except related to land transport where the risk is located in Lithuania.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nBG, LV, LT, PL: Unbound for insurance intermediation.\n\n\nFI: Only insurers having their head-office in the European Union or having their branch in Finland may offer direct insurance (including co-insurance) services. The supply of insurance broker services is subject to a permanent place of business in the European Union.\n\n\nHR: Unbound for direct insurance and direct insurance intermediation services, except\n\n\na) life insurance: for the supply of life insurance to foreign persons residing in Croatia;\n\n\nb) non-life insurance: for the supply of non-life insurance to foreign persons residing in Croatia other than automobile liability\n\n\nc) marine, aviation, transport. \n\n\nHU: The supply of direct insurance in the territory of Hungary by insurance companies not established in the European Union is allowed only through a branch office registered in Hungary.\n\n\nIT: Unbound for the actuarial profession. Transport insurance of goods, insurance of vehicles as such and liability insurance regarding risks located in Italy may be underwritten only by insurance companies established in the European Union. This reservation does not apply for international transport involving imports into Italy.\n\n\nSE: The supply of direct insurance is allowed only through an insurance service supplier authorised in Sweden, provided that the foreign service supplier and the Swedish insurance company belong to the same group of companies or have an agreement of cooperation between them.\n\n\n\nFor Mode 2\n\n\nAT, BE, BG, CZ, CY, DE, DK, ES, FI, FR, EL, HU, IE, IT, LU, MT, NL, PL, PT, RO, SK, SE, SI, UK: Unbound for intermediation.\n\n\nBG: For direct insurance, Bulgarian natural and juridical persons, as well as foreign persons who conduct business activity in the territory of the Republic of Bulgaria, can conclude insurance contracts only with suppliers with respect to their activity in Bulgaria, which are licensed to conduct insurance activity in Bulgaria. Insurance compensation resulting from these contracts shall be paid in Bulgaria. Unbound for deposit insurance and similar compensations schemes, as well as mandatory insurance schemes.\n\n\nHR: Unbound for direct insurance and direct insurance intermediation services, except\n\n\na) life insurance: for the ability of foreign persons residing in Croatia to obtain life insurance;\n\n\nb) non-life insurance: \n\n\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0(i) for the ability of foreign persons residing in Croatia to obtain non-life insurance other than automobile liability; \n\n\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0(ii) - personal or property risk insurance that is not available in Croatia; - companies purchasing insurance abroad in connection with investment works abroad including the equipment for those works; - for ensuring the return of foreign loans (collateral insurance); - personal and property insurance of wholly-owned enterprises and joint ventures which perform an economic activity in a foreign country, if it is in accordance with the regulations of that country or it is required by its registration; - ships under construction and overhaul if it is stipulated by the contract concluded with the foreign client (buyer);\n\n\nc) marine, aviation, transport. \n\n\nIT: Transport insurance of goods, insurance of vehicles as such and liability insurance regarding risks located in Italy may be underwritten only by insurance companies established in the European Union. This reservation does not apply for international transport involving imports into\u00a0Italy.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB. Banking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1\n\n\nAT, BE, BG, CZ, DE, DK, ES, FI, FR, EL, HU, IE, IT, LU, NL, PL, PT, SK, SE, UK: Unbound except for provision of financial information and financial data processing and for advisory and other auxiliary services excluding intermediation.\n\n\nBE: Establishment in Belgium is required for the provision of investment advisory services.\n\n\nBG: Limitations and conditions relating to the use of telecommunications network may apply.\n\n\nCY: Unbound except for trading of transferable securities, for provision of financial information and financial data processing and for advisory and other auxiliary services excluding intermediation.\n\n\nEE: For acceptance of deposits, requirement of authorisation by Estonian financial Supervision Authority and registration under Estonian Law as a joint-stock company, a subsidiary or a branch.\n\n\nEE: The establishment of a specialised management company is required to perform the activities of management of investment funds, and only firms having their registered office in the European Union can act as depositories of the assets of investment funds.\n\n\nHR: Unbound except for lending, financial leasing, payment and money transmission services, guarantees and commitments, money broking , provision and transfer of financial information and advisory and other auxiliary financial services, excluding intermediation.\n\n\nLT: The establishment of a specialised management company is required to perform the activities of management of unit trusts and investment companies, and only firms having their registered office in the European Union can act as depositories of the assets of investment funds.\n\n\nIE: The provision of investment services or investment advice requires either: \n\n\n(I)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0authorisation in Ireland, which normally requires that the entity be incorporated or be a partnership or a sole trader, in each case with a head/registered office in Ireland (authorisation may not be required in certain cases, e.g. where a third country service provider has no commercial presence in Ireland and the service is not provided to private individuals), or \n\n\n(II)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0authorisation in another European Union Member State in accordance with the European Union Investment Services Directive.\n\n\nIT: Unbound for \"promotori di servizi finanziari\" (financial salesmen).\n\n\nLV: Unbound except for participation in issues of all kinds of securities, for provision of financial information and financial data processing and for advisory and other auxiliary services excluding intermediation.\n\n\nLT: Commercial presence is required for pension fund management\n\n\nMT: Unbound except for acceptance of deposits, for lending of all types, for provision of financial information and financial data processing and for advisory and other auxiliary services excluding intermediation. \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nPL: For the provision and transfer of financial information, and financial data processing and related software: Requirement to use the public telecommunication network, or the network of other authorised operator.\n\n\nRO: Unbound for financial leasing, for trading of money market instruments, foreign exchange, derivative products, exchange rate and interest rate instruments, transferable securities and other negotiable instruments and financial assets, for participation in issues of all kinds of securities, for asset management and for settlement and clearing services for financial assets. Payments and money transmission services are allowed only through a resident bank.\n\n\nSI: \n\n\n(1)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Participation in issues of Treasury bonds, pension fund management: Unbound.\n\n\n(2)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0All other sub-sectors, except provision and transfer of financial information, accepting credits (borrowing of all types), and accepting guarantees and commitments from foreign credit institutions by domestic legal entities and sole proprietors and advisory and other auxiliary financial services: Unbound \n\n\nMembers of the Slovenian Stock Exchange must be incorporated in the Republic of Slovenia or be branches of foreign investment firms or banks.\n\n\nFor Mode 2\n\n\nBG: Limitations and conditions relating to the use of telecommunications network may apply.\n\n\nPL: For the provision and transfer of financial information, and financial data processing and related software: Requirement to use the public telecommunication network, or the network of another authorised operator. \n\n\n\n\n\n\n8. HEALTH SERVICES AND SOCIAL SERVICES \n\n\n(only privately-funded services)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Hospital Services\n\n\n(CPC 9311)\n\n\nC. Residential health facilities other than hospital services\n\n\n(CPC 93193)\n\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1\n\n\nAT, BE, BG, DE, CY, CZ, DK, ES, EE, FI, FR, EL, HR, IE, IT, LV, LT, MT, LU, NL, PL, PT, RO, SI, SE, SK, UK: Unbound\n\n\nFor Mode 2\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nD.
