OTHER SERVICES NOT INCLUDED ELSEWHERE\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Washing, Cleaning and Dyeing services\n\n\n(CPC 9701)\n\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1:\n\n\nEU: Unbound\n\n\nFor Mode 2\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) Hairdressing services\n(CPC\u00a097021)\n\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1:\n\n\nEU: Unbound\n\n\nFor Mode 2\n\n\nNone.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nc) Cosmetic treatment, manicuring and pedicuring services \n\n\n(CPC\u00a097022)\n\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1:\n\n\nEU: Unbound\n\n\nFor Mode 2\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\nd) Other beauty treatment services n.e.c \n\n\n(CPC\u00a097029)\n\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1:\n\n\nEU: Unbound\n\n\nFor Mode 2\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\ne) Spa services and non therapeutical massages, to the extent that they are provided as relaxation physical well-being services and not for medical or rehabilitation purposes\n37\n\n\n\n(CPC ver. 1.0 97230)\n\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1:\n\n\nEU: Unbound\n\n\nFor Mode 2\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\ng) Telecommunications connection services (CPC 7543)\n\n\n\n\nFor Modes 1 and 2\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n'\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(1)\nThe absence of European Union Member State-specific reservations in a given sector is without prejudice to horizontal reservations or to sectoral European Union-broad reservations that may apply.\n\n\n\n(2)\nAs regards services sectors, these limitations do not go beyond the limitations reflected in the existing GATS commitments.\n\n\n\n(3)\nIt includes legal advisory, legal representational, legal arbitration and conciliation/mediation, and legal documentation and certification services. Provision of legal services is only authorised in respect of public international law, European Union law and the law of any jurisdiction where the service supplier or its personnel is qualified to practice as a lawyer, and, like the provision of other services, is subject to licensing requirements and procedures applicable in European Union Member States. For lawyers providing legal services in respect of public international law and foreign law, these may take inter alia the form of compliance with local codes of ethics, use of home title (unless recognition with the host title has been obtained) insurance requirements, simple registration with the host country Bar or a simplified admission to the host country Bar through an aptitude test and a legal or professional domicile in the host country. Legal services in respect of European Union law shall in principle be carried out by or through a fully qualified lawyer admitted to the Bar in the European Union acting personally, and legal services in respect of the law of a European Union Member State shall in principle be carried out by or through a fully qualified lawyer admitted to the Bar in that European Union Member State acting personally. Full admission to the Bar in the relevant European Union Member State might therefore be necessary for representation before courts and other competent authorities in the European Union since it involves practice of European Union and national procedural law. However, in some European Union Member States, foreign lawyers not fully admitted to the Bar are allowed to represent in civil proceedings a party being a national or belonging to the State in which the lawyer is entitled to practice.\n\n\n\n(4)\nIt does not include legal advisory and legal representational services on tax matters, which are to be found under 1.A.a). Legal services.\n\n\n\n(5)\nThe supply of pharmaceuticals to the general public, like the provision of other services, is subject to licensing and qualification requirements and procedures applicable in European Union Member States. As a general rule, this activity is reserved to pharmacists. In some European Union Member States, only the supply of prescription drugs is reserved to pharmacists. \n\n\n\n(6)\nPart of CPC 85201, which is to be found under 1.A.h). Medical and dental services.\n\n\n\n(7)\nThe service involved relates to the profession of real estate agent and does not affect any rights and/or restrictions on natural and juridical persons purchasing real estate.\n\n\n\n(8)\nMaintenance and repair services of transport equipment (CPC 6112, 6122, 8867 and CPC 8868) are to be found under l.F. l) 1 to 1.F.l) 4\n\nMaintenance and repair services of office machinery and equipment including computers (CPC 845) are to be found under 1.B. COMPUTER SERVICES.\n\n\n\n(9)\nIt does not include printing services, which fall under CPC 88442 and are to be found under 1.F p).\n\n\n\n(10)\nThe term \"handling\" should be taken to include clearance, sorting, transport and delivery.\n\n\n\n(11)\n\"Postal item\" refers to items handled by any type of commercial operator, whether public or private.\n\n\n\n(12)\nE.g. letter, postcards.\n\n\n\n(13)\nBooks, catalogues are included hereunder.\n\n\n\n(14)\nJournals, newspapers, periodicals.\n\n\n\n(15)\nExpress delivery services may include, in addition to greater speed and reliability, value added elements such as collection from point of origin, personal delivery to addressee, tracing and tracking, possibility of changing the destination and addressee in transit, confirmation of receipt.\n\n\n\n(16)\nProvision of means, including the supply of ad hoc premises as well as transportation by a third party, allowing self-delivery by mutual exchange of postal items between users subscribing to this service. Postal item refers to items handled by any type of commercial operator, whether public or\u00a0private.\n\n\n\n(17)\nFor subsectors i) to iv), individual licences imposing particular universal services obligations and/or financial contribution to a compensation fund may be required.\n\n\n\n(18)\n\"Items of correspondence\": a communication in written form on any kind of physical medium to be conveyed and delivered at the address indicated by the sender on the item itself or on its wrapping. Books, catalogues, newspapers and periodicals are not regarded as items of correspondence.\n\n\n\n(19)\nTransportation of mail on own account by any land Mode.\n\n\n\n(20)\nTransportation of mail on own account by air.\n\n\n\n(21)\nThese services do not include on-line information and/or data processing (including transaction processing) (part of CPC 843) which is to be found under 1.B. Computer services.\n\n\n\n(22)\nBroadcasting is defined as the uninterrupted chain of transmission required for the distribution of TV and radio programme signals to the general public, but does not cover contribution links between operators.\n\n\n\n(23)\nThese services cover the telecommunications service consisting of the transmission and reception of radio and television broadcast by satellite (the uninterrupted chain of transmission via satellite required for the distribution of TV and radio programme signals to the general public). This covers selling use of satellite services, but does not include the selling of television programme packages to households.\n\n\n\n(24)\nThese services, which include CPC 62271, are to be found in ENERGY SERVICES under 18.D.\n\n\n\n(25)\nDoes not include maintenance and repair services, which are to be found in BUSINESS SERVICES under 1.B. and 1.F.l). Does not include retailing services of energy products which are to be found in ENERGY SERVICES under 13.E and 13.F.\n\n\n\n(26)\nRetail sales of pharmaceutical, medical and orthopaedic goods are to be found under PROFESSIONAL SERVICES in 1.A.k).\n\n\n\n(27)\nCorresponds to sewage services.\n\n\n\n(28)\nCorresponds to Cleaning Services of Exhaust Gases.\n\n\n\n(29)\nCorresponds to parts of Nature and Landscape Protection Services.\n\n\n\n(30)\nCatering in air transport services is to be found in SERVICES AUXILARY TO TRANSPORT SERVICES under 12.D.a) Groundhandling services.\n\n\n\n(31)\nIncludes feedering services and movement of equipment by international maritime transport suppliers between ports located in the same State when no revenue is involved.\n\n\n\n(32)\nPart of CPC 71235, which is to be found in COMMUNICATION SERVICES under 2.A. Postal and courier services. \n\n\n\n(33)\nPipeline transportation of fuels is to be found in ENERGY SERVICES under 13.B\n\n\n\n(34)\nIt does not include maintenance and repair services of transport equipment, which are to be found in BUSINESS SERVICES under 1.F.l) 1 to 1.F.l) 4. \n\n\n\n(35)\nServices auxiliary to pipeline transportation of fuels are to be found in ENERGY SERVICES under 13.C\n\n\n\n(36)\nIncludes the following service rendered on a fee or contract basis: advisory and consulting services relating to mining, on land site preparation, on land rig installation, drilling, drilling bits services, casing and tubular services, mud engineering and supply, solids control, fishing and downhole special operations, wellsite geology and drilling control, core taking, well testing, wireline services, supply and operation of completion fluids (brines) supply and installation of completion devices, cementing (pressure pumping), stimulation services (fracturing, acidising and pressure pumping), workover and well repair services, plugging and abandoning of\u00a0wells.\n\nDoes not include direct access to or exploitation of natural resources.\n\nDoes not include site preparation work for mining of resources other than oil and gas (CPC 5115), which is to be found under 3; CONSTRUCTION SERVICES. \n\n\n\n(37)\nTherapeutical massages and thermal cure services are to be found under 1.A.h) Medical services, 1.A.j) 2 Services provided by nurses, physiotherapists and para-medical personnel and health services (8.A and 8 C).\n\n\n\n\n\nTop  \n\n\n\n\n\n\nEUROPEAN COMMISSION\nBrussels, 4.4.2016\nCOM(2016) 173 final\nANNEX\nto the\nProposal for a Council Decision\non the signing, on behalf of the European Union, and provisional application of the Protocol of Accession to the Trade Agreement  between the European Union and its Member States, of the one part, and Colombia and Peru, of the other part, to take account of the Accession of Ecuador\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nANNEX XII\n\n\n(New Section D of Annex VIII to the Agreement referred to in Article 118 of the Agreement)\n\n\nLIST OF COMMITMENTS ON CROSS-BORDER SUPPLY OF SERVICES \n\n\n'SECTION\u00a0D\n\n\nECUADOR\n\n\nThis Schedule of Commitments is consistent with the constitutional and legal provisions governing the services sector in Ecuador and their compatibility with the undertakings made at multilateral level. \n\n\nFor the preparation of this offer, account was taken of the United Nations Statistics Division's Central Products Classification (CPC), Statistical Reports, Series M, No. 77, provisional, 1991, for the offer relating to cross-border trade in services.\n\n\nThe list below is composed of the following elements:\n\n\na)a first column indicating the sector or sub-sector in which the commitment is assumed by Ecuador, and the scope of the commitment to which the reservations apply;\n\n\nb)a second column describing the applicable reservations, the mode of supply and the obligation affected (Access to Markets - AM, or National Treatment - NT). AM and NT commitments are independent of each other; accordingly, if no AM commitment has been made (remaining \u201cunbound\u201d), this does not invalidate the NT commitment. \n\n\nFor methodological revision and analysis purposes, we would point out the following:\n\n\n\u2013No commitments of any kind are being made in the sectors or sub-sectors of services not shown on the list\n\n\n\u2013For the services sub-sectors in which commitments are being maintained or new commitments are being incorporated, the amendments appear in the left-hand column headed \u201cSector or sub-sector\u201d\n\n\n\u2013Reservations, conditions and exclusions relative to the rules on market access and national treatment and applied to maintained or newly-incorporated commitments appear in the right-hand column headed \u201cDescription of reservations\u201d. \n\n\n\u2013To complement the list, the same right-hand column includes \u201ccomments\u201d considered necessary on the commitment or reservation being incorporated or maintained.\n\n\n\u2013Commitments in specific sectors or sub-sectors are subject to the horizontal reservations and limitations included in the first section, which apply across the board and unconditionally to all sectors unless otherwise stated.\n\n\n\u2013The commitments do not include measures relating to requirements, technical standards, procedures or processes necessary for the provision of a service and that apply even when not shown on the list, unless they are presented as restrictions on the rules on market access and national treatment\n\n\nThe reservations, conditions and exclusions included on the list below will not apply, insofar as they present inconsistencies, to the sub-sectors and modes committed by Ecuador on the Schedule of Specific Commitments undertaken for its membership of the World Trade Organisation \u2013 WTO in 1996, a recast version of which can be found in document S/DCS/W/ECU of 24 January 2003, produced from the original texts of and amendments to documents GATS/SC/98/Suppl.1 and GATS/SC/98/Suppl.2, of the WTO General Agreement on Trade in Services (GATS). Accordingly, the said reservations, conditions and exclusions will be applicable to and required for the new sectors and/or modes of supply set out on the list below only.\n\n\nIn accordance with the provisions included in Article 107(3) relating to the scope of the rules in the Title on Trade in Services, Establishment and Electronic Commerce, no measures that may be adopted or maintained by the State of Ecuador in relation to grants and subsidies are listed.\n\n\n\n\nSimilarly, based on Article 107(5) of the Title on Trade in Services, Establishment and Electronic Commerce, Ecuador reserves the right to establish, maintain and fully implement its national legislation with the aim of attaining legitimate policy objectives in areas such as the protection of vulnerable groups, consumer protection, health and the environment among others. \n\n\nIn accordance with Article 107(4) of the Title on Trade in Services, Establishment and Electronic Commerce, this offer does not include services provided in the exercise of governmental authority.\n\n\nThe rights and obligations derived from this schedule of commitments are not directly applicable and effective and thus do not confer directly enforceable rights on natural or legal persons.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector or sub-sector\n\n\n\n\nDescription of reservations\n\n\n\n\n\n\nALL SECTORS\n\n\n\n\nProvision of services in strategic sectors and public services\n\n\nThe provision of public services and services in strategic sectors will require concession rights, licences, authorisations or other forms of permission to be obtained beforehand in accordance with the relevant legislation applicable to the respective sector. Where a requirement is laid down for the provision of the services to take place in part or in full on Ecuadorian territory, a requirement may also be laid down for domiciliation of an establishment in Ecuador for legal persons incorporated under the laws of another country and whose main domicile is in another country.\n\n\nSuch requirements apply to the provision of public services and those related to energy exploitation in all its forms, telecommunications, exploitation of non-renewable natural resources, transport and refining of hydrocarbons, biodiversity and genetic heritage, water and the radio spectrum. \n\n\nThe total or partial acquisition of blocks of shares or any rights over the control, management or administration of companies active in the areas listed in the preceding paragraph may be subject to the approval of the competent authorities.\n\n\nThe criteria for the granting of licences, authorisations and other forms of permission shall be transparent and non-discriminatory as regards the participation of service providers from the EU Party and shall not constitute a quantitative restriction for the provision of the service.\n\n\nThe specific commitments undertaken by Ecuador in this Agreement in strategic sectors and public services shall be considered as constituting the exceptional circumstances provided for in national legislation in relation to the delegation to private initiative in the provision of public services and in the strategic sectors.\n\n\nOwnership of land or waters\n\n\nForeign national or legal persons may not, in any capacity, acquire land or concessions in national security zones for economic exploitation purposes.\n\n\nEcuador reserves the right to adopt or maintain measures related to the ownership of property by foreign nationals in border areas, on the national coasts or on island territory.\n\n\nEssential security\n\n\nThe manufacture, import, possession and use of chemical, biological and nuclear weapons is prohibited, as is the introduction into the national territory of nuclear waste and toxic waste.\n\n\nSocial Economy\n\n\nIn accordance with the provisions of the Constitution of the Republic, Ecuador reserves the right to establish measures granting preferential and differential treatment to the sectors that operate and pursue activities using the social economy model, including the associative and community cooperative sectors.\n\n\nCultural heritage and natural heritage\n\n\nEcuador reserves the right to adopt or maintain any measure that grants rights or preferences to local communities with regard to the support, fostering, promotion and development of expressions related to the intangible cultural heritage. Similarly, it reserves the right to adopt or maintain any measure that grants rights or preferences to local communities with regard to the protection, preservation, recovery and promotion of Ecuador's natural heritage, taken to mean all of the physical, biological and geological features of value from the environmental, scientific, cultural or landscape point of view, including the national system of protected areas and fragile and threatened ecosystems.\n\n\n\nPublishing industry\n\n\nEcuador reserves the right to adopt or maintain any measure that grants to a natural or legal person of the EU Party the same treatment as granted to a natural or legal person from Ecuador in the publishing sector of the latter Party.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1. BUSINESS SERVICES\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Professional Services\n\n\n\n\nFor the purposes of exercising most professional services in Ecuador, professional qualifications obtained abroad must be recognised by the national competent authority, which generally requires residence in Ecuador before it can grant such recognition.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Legal services (CPC 861) Only advisory services on foreign legislation and international law (excluding advisory services, legal representation and notarial services under national law)\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: None\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None \n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) Accounting, auditing and bookkeeping services (CPC 862);\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: Unbound\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nc) Taxation services (CPC 863)\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: Unbound\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nd) Architectural services (CPC 8671) \n\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: None\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\ng) Urban Planning and Landscape Architectural Services (CPC 8674)\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: None\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\ne) Engineering services (CPC 8672) excluding services procured by the State\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: None\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nf) Integrated engineering services (CPC 8673) excluding services procured by the State\n\n\n\n\n\n1)MA, NT: None\n\n\n2)MA, NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nh) Medical and dental services (CPC 9312)\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: None\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB. Computer and Related Services, exclusively:\n\n\nConsulting services related to the installation of computer hardware (CPC 841);\n\n\nMaintenance and repair services of office equipment including computers (845), and\n\n\nOther computer services (CPC\u00a0849).\n\n\n\n\n\n1)MA, NT: None \n\n\n2)MA, NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nE. Rental/Leasing Services without Operators\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Leasing or rental services concerning vessels without crew (CPC 83101 and 83103)\n\n\nb) Leasing or rental services of aircraft without crew (CPC 83104)\n\n\nc) Leasing or rental services of other means of transport without operators (83101+ 83102 + 83105)\n\n\nd) Leasing or rental services of other machinery and equipment without operators (83106-83109)\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: None\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nF. COMMUNICATION SERVICES\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Postal and courier services (part of CPC 7511 and CPC 7512)\n\n\nServices relating to the handling 7 of postal items 8, according to the following list of sub-sectors, whether for domestic or foreign destinations: \n\n\n(i) Handling of addressed written communications on any kind of physical medium including the direct mail and hybrid mail services, \n\n\n(ii) Handling of addressed parcels and packages, \n\n\n(iii) Handling of addressed press products, \n\n\n(iv) Handling of items referred to in (i) to (iii) above as registered or insured mail, \n\n\n(v) Express delivery services for items referred to in (i) to (iii) above, \n\n\n(vi) Handling of non-addressed items, \n\n\n(vii) Document exchange\n\n\nCommitments in sub-sectors (i), (iv) and (v) are excluded when they fall into the scope of the services which may be reserved for the State, which is: for items of correspondence\n1\n the price of which is less than two and a half times the public basic tariff, provided that they weigh less than\u00a050 grams, plus the registered mail service used in the course of judicial or administrative procedures. (Part of CPC 751, part of CPC 71235\n2\n and part of CPC 73210\n3\n)\n\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: Unbound until the end of the fifth year following the entry into force of this Agreement. None, from the sixth year onwards\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC. Telecommunications Services\n\n\nIncluding the services listed below, excluding broadcasting \n\n\nThese services do not cover the economic activity consisting of the provision of content which requires telecommunications services for its transport.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) All services consisting of the transmission and reception of signals by any electromagnetic means.\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: None\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) Satellite capacity provision services, to connect television and radio broadcasting stations \n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: None\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\no) Others\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: Unbound\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n3. FINANCIAL SERVICES\n\n\n\n\nThe provision of cross-border financial services in Ecuador, including insurance and insurance-related services, does not imply that the providers of such services may conduct or advertise business on Ecuadorian territory. Ecuador may define the terms \u201cconduct business\u201d and \u201cadvertise\u201d, wherever such definitions are not inconsistent with the commitments made by Ecuador for modes 1 and 2.\n\n\nEcuador may require written evidence of the authorisation granted by a competent authority of the other Party for the providers of cross-border financial services and for the financial products and instruments they offer in Ecuador.\n\n\nInsurance enterprises may contract reinsurance abroad, as long as the reinsurance enterprises are classified in accordance with international standards, and subjected to the rules laid down by the Superintendency of Banking, Insurance and Private Pension Fund Administrators (\u2018SBS - Superintendencia de Banca y Seguros\u2019). For greater transparency, if the insurance enterprises contract reinsurances directly, they should do it with enterprises included in the SBS reinsurance registry.\n\n\nThe auxiliary services of the financial services related to the provision and transfer of financial information and the processing of financial data shall be registered in accordance with the rules laid down by the Superintendency of Banking, Insurance and Private Pension Fund Administrators. The said auxiliary services may not collect, maintain and deliver credit information. For greater transparency, financial information services or the processing of financial data shall be subject to the Ecuadorian provisions regulating the protection of such information.\n\n\nFor greater transparency, the mandatory risk ratings for financial institutions incorporated under Ecuadorian law require the foreign risk-rating agencies to first register with the Ecuadorian Superintendency of Banking, Insurance and Private Pension Fund Administrators.\n\n\nOn the securities market, Ecuador will accept the risk rating by an agency recognised by the European Securities and Markets Authority (ESMA) as a \u201cNationally Recognized Statistical Rating Organisation \u2013 RSRO\u201d, in the event of a secondary public offering on the Ecuadorian securities market, securities issued abroad or a primary public offering on the Ecuadorian securities market by multilateral issuers recognised as local issuers. \n\n\nEcuador reserves the right to adopt or maintain measures that restrict the acquisition of obligatory insurance outside of Ecuador, or that require that obligatory insurance be purchased from suppliers established in Ecuador such as the Seguro Obligatorio de Accidentes de Tr\u00e1nsito (SOAT, Obligatory Traffic Accident Insurance). Ecuador reserves the right to adopt or maintain measures that restrict the acquisition of reinsurance and/or retrocession relating to such obligatory insurance outside of Ecuador, or that require that the services be acquired from providers established in Ecuador.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. ALL INSURANCE AND INSURANCE RELATED SERVICES \n\n\n\n\n\nIn order to be able to operate in Ecuador, non-resident insurance and reinsurance companies, intermediaries and providers of auxiliary insurance services must register and renew their registration in accordance with the rules laid down in national legislation.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1) Non-life insurance \n\n\n\n\nFor Mode 1 and Mode 2\n\n\nMA, NT: Unbound, except: \n\n\n(a) insurance of risks relating to: \n\n\n(i) maritime shipping and commercial aviation and space launching and freight (including satellites), with such insurance to cover any or all of the following: the goods being transported, the vehicle transporting the goods and any liability arising therefrom; and \n\n\n(ii) Goods in international transit.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n2) Reinsurance and retrocession\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; None\n\n\nNT: None \n\n\n2)MA: None\n\n\nNT: None \n\n\n\n\n\n\n3) Insurance intermediation, such as brokerage and agency\n\n\n\n\n1) MA and NT: Unbound, except for insurance of risks relating to:\n\n\ninternational maritime shipping and international commercial aviation and space launching and freight (including satellites), with such insurance to cover any or all of the following: the goods being transported, the vehicle transporting the goods and any liability arising therefrom and goods in international transit.\n\n\n2) MA unbound, except for insurance of risks relating to:\n\n\ninternational maritime shipping and international commercial aviation and space launching and freight (including satellites), with such insurance to cover any or all of the following: the goods being transported, the vehicle transporting the goods and any liability arising therefrom and goods in international transit.\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4) Services auxiliary to insurance for risk assessment (risk inspector), claim settlement (loss adjuster) and actuarial services\n\n\n\n\n1) MA: None\n\n\nNT: None\n\n\n2) MA: None \n\n\nNT: None \n\n\n\n\n\n\nB. BANKING AND OTHER FINANCIAL SERVICES (excluding insurance)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Acceptance of deposits and other repayable funds from the public (CPC 81115-81119);\n\n\nb) Lending of all types, including consumer credit, mortgage credit, factoring by financial institutions, and financing of commercial transactions (CPC 8113)\n\n\nc) Financial leasing services (CPC 8112)\n\n\nd) Payment and money transmission services: credit, charge and debit cards, travellers' cheques and bankers' drafts (CPC 81339)\n\n\ne) Guarantees and commitments (CPC 81199)\n\n\nf) Trading for own account or for account of customers, whether on an exchange or in an over-the-counter market, the following:\n\n\n- money market instruments (cheques, bills, certificate of deposits etc.) (part of CPC 81339);\n\n\n- foreign exchange (CPC 81333),\n\n\n- derivative products: futures and options (part of CPC 81339)\n\n\n- exchange rate and interest rate instruments, swaps and forward rate agreements. (part of CPC 81339)\n\n\n- transferable securities (CPC 81321)\n\n\n- other negotiable instruments and financial assets, including bullion (part of CPC 71339)\n\n\ng) Participation in issues of all kinds of securities, including underwriting and placement as agent (whether publicly or privately) and provision of services related to such issues (CPC 8132)\n\n\nh) Money broking (CPC 81339)\n\n\ni) Asset management: cash or portfolio management, collective investment management, custodial, depository and trust services. (CPC 8119 + 81323)\n\n\nj) settlement and clearing services for financial assets, including securities, derivative products, and other negotiable instruments. (CPC 81339 or 81319)\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: None.\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nk) Advisory and other auxiliary financial services on all the activities listed under the heading banking and other financial services (excluding insurance):credit reference and analysis, investment and portfolio research and advice, advice on acquisitions and on corporate restructuring (CPC 8131 or 8133) \n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: Unbound for services involving the collection, maintenance and delivery of credit information.\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None, except for services involving the collection, maintenance and delivery of credit information.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nl) Provision and transfers of financial information, financial data processing and related software by providers of other financial services. (CPC 8131)\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: None\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n8. HEALTH AND SOCIAL SERVICES (except those listed under 1.A h-j of the Classification W120)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nHospital services (CPC 9311)\n\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: None.\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n9. TOURISM AND TRAVEL RELATED SERVICES\n\n\n\n\nBefore starting any tourist activity as described in the Tourism Act, all natural or legal persons, undertakings or companies must obtain the relevant registration, namely registration of the tourism services provider in the public register of tourism entrepreneurs and establishments, in the Ministry of Tourism of Ecuador.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA) Hotels and Restaurants (Including Catering) (CPC 641-643);\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: None\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB) Travel Agencies and Tour Operators Services\u00a0(CPC 7471) B. Travel agencies and tour operators (including tour managers)\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: None\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC) Tourist Guides Services (CPC 7472)\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: None\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n10. RECREATIONAL, CULTURAL AND SPORTING SERVICES\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: None\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA) Entertainment Services (including theatre, live bands and circus services) (CPC 9619)\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: None\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB) News and Press Agency Services (CPC\u00a0962)\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: None\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC) Libraries, archives, museums and other cultural services (CPC 963)\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: None\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nD) Sporting and other recreational services\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: None\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4\n11. TRANSPORT SERVICES\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Maritime Transport\n\n\na. Passenger transportation (CPC 7211)\n\n\nb) Freight transportation (CPC 7222) excluding national cabotage transport. Includes movement of equipment as long as no revenue is generated for the provider.\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: None\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA.Internal Waterways Transport \n\n\na) Passenger transportation (CPC 7221)\n\n\nb) Freight transportation (CPC 7222) Excluding national cabotage transport. Includes movement of equipment as long as no revenue is generated for the provider.\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: None\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB.Rail Transport\n\n\na) Passenger transportation (CPC 7111)\n\n\nb) Freight transportation (CPC 7112)\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: Unbound\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nD) Road Transport Services\n\n\na) Passenger transport services\n\n\nb) Freight transport services\n\n\nc) Hire of commercial vehicles with driver \n\n\n(CPC 7121+ 7122+ 7123+ 7124) \n\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: Unbound\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n12. SERVICES AUXILIARY TO TRANSPORT\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Services auxiliary to Maritime Transport\n\n\na) Maritime Cargo Handling Services\n\n\nb) Storage and warehousing services (part of CPC 742) \n\n\nc) Customs clearance services\n\n\nd) Container station and depot services\n\n\ne) Maritime agency services\n\n\nf) Maritime freight forwarding services\n\n\ng) Rental of vessels without crew (CPC 7213)\n\n\nh) Pushing and towing services (CPC 7214)\n\n\ni) Supporting services for maritime transport (part of CPC 745)\n\n\nj) Other supporting and auxiliary services (part of CPC 749)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; None, save that the provision of auxiliary transport services in public ports is subject to concessions or other forms of permission. The loading, unloading and storage of hydrocarbons shall be assigned exclusively to national, State-owned or mixed shipping companies of which the State holds at least 51% of the share capital.\n\n\nNT: Unbound\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB. Services auxiliary to internal waterways transport\n\n\na) Cargo-handling services (part of CPC 741)\n\n\nb) Storage and warehousing services (part of CPC 742)\n\n\nc) Freight transport agency services (part of CPC 748)\n\n\nd) Rental of vessels with crew (CPC 7223)\n\n\ne) Pushing and towing services (CPC 7224)\n\n\nf) Supporting services for internal waterway transport (part of CPC 745)\n\n\ng) Other supporting and auxiliary services (part of CPC 749)\n\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; None, save that the provision of auxiliary transport services in public ports is subject to concessions or other forms of permission. The loading, unloading and storage of hydrocarbons shall be assigned exclusively to national, State-owned or mixed shipping companies of which the State holds at least 51% of the share capital.\n\n\nNT: Unbound\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC. Services auxiliary to rail transport\n\n\na) Cargo-handling services (part of CPC 741)\n\n\nb) Storage and warehousing services (Part of CPC 742)\n\n\nc) Freight transport agency services (part of CPC 748)\n\n\nd) Pushing and towing services (CPC 7113)\n\n\ne) Supporting services for rail transport services (CPC 743)\n\n\nf) Other supporting and auxiliary services (part of CPC 749)\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: Unbound\n\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nD. Services auxiliary to road transport\n\n\na) Cargo-handling services (part of CPC 741)\n\n\nb) Storage and warehousing services (part of CPC 742)\n\n\nc) Freight transport agency services (part of CPC 748)\n\n\nd) Rental of commercial road vehicles with operator (CPC 7124)\n\n\ne) Supporting services for road transport services (CPC 744)\n\n\nf) Other supporting and auxiliary services (part of CPC 749)\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: Unbound\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nE. Services auxiliary to air transport services\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Ground handling services (including catering)\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: Unbound\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) Storage and warehousing services (Part of CPC 742)\n\n\n\n\n1) MA, NT: Unbound*,\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nc) Freight transport agency services (part of CPC 748)\n\n\n\n\n1) MA, NT: None \n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nd) Rental of aircraft with crew (CPC 734)\n\n\n\n\n1) MA, NT: None \n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\ne) Sales and Marketing\n\n\n\n\n\n1) MA, NT: None \n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\nf) Computer Reservations System \n\n\n\n\n1) MA, NT: None \n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n\n13. ENERGY SERVICES\n\n\n\n\nIn order to conclude exploration and production contracts, foreign undertakings must establish a branch or set up a company in accordance with the Companies Act, establish a location in Ecuador and appoint an agent or legal representative resident in Ecuador. Foreign nationals must be entered in the public registers and appoint a legal representative of Ecuadorian nationality and resident in Ecuador.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. SERVICES INCIDENTAL TO EXPLORATION AND PRODUCTION\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nrelated scientific and technical consulting services;\n\n\n(CPC 8675) excluding services procured by the State\n\n\nServices incidental to mining\n\n\n(CPC 883)\n\n\nMaintenance and repair services of metal products, of machinery and equipment, and of electrical machinery\n\n\n(part of CPC 8861-8866)\n\n\nEngineering services\n\n\n(CPC 8672), excluding services procured by the State\n\n\nIntegrated engineering services\n\n\n(CPC 8673), excluding services procured by the State\n\n\nManagement consulting services\n\n\n(CPC 865)\n\n\nServices related to management consulting services\n\n\n(CPC 866)\n\n\nTechnical testing and analysis services\n\n\n(CPC 8676)\n\n\n\n\n1) MA; NT: None\n\n\n2) MA; NT: None\n\n\n\n\n\n'\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(1)\n\u201cItems of correspondence\u201d shall include written communications on any kind of physical medium to be conveyed and delivered at the address indicated by the sender on the item itself or on its wrapping. Books, catalogues, newspapers and other regular publications shall not be considered items of correspondence.\n\n\n\n(2)\nTransportation of mail on own account by any land mode.\n\n\n\n(3)\nTransportation of mail on own account by air.\n\n\n\n(4)\nWhere references in this sector are marked as \"Unbound*\u201d, this means that a binding commitment is not possible because the supply or provision of the service is not technically feasible. \n\n\n\n\n\nTop  \n\n\n\n\n\n\nEUROPEAN COMMISSION\nBrussels, 4.4.2016\nCOM(2016) 173 final\nANNEX\nto the\nProposal for a Council Decision\non the signing, on behalf of the European Union, and provisional application of the Protocol of Accession to the Trade Agreement  between the European Union and its Member States, of the one part, and Colombia and Peru, of the other part, to take account of the Accession of Ecuador\n\n\n\n\n\n\nANNEX XIII\n\n\n(Section B of Appendix 1 to Annex IX to the Agreement referred to in Article 124 of the Agreement)\n\n\nRESERVATIONS REGARDING TEMPORARY PRESENCE OF\nNATURAL PERSONS FOR BUSINESS PURPOSES\n\n\nAPPENDIX 1\n\n\nRESERVATIONS ON KEY PERSONNEL AND GRADUATE TRAINEES\n\n\n'SECTION\u00a0B\n\n\nEU PARTY\n\n\nThe following abbreviations are used:\n\n\nAT\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Austria\n\n\nBE\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Belgium\n\n\nBG\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Bulgaria\n\n\nCY\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Cyprus\n\n\nCZ\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Czech Republic\n\n\nDE\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Germany\n\n\nDK\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Denmark\n\n\nES\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Spain\n\n\nEE\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Estonia\n\n\nEU\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0European Union, including all its Member States\n\n\nFI\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Finland\n\n\n\n\nFR\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0France\n\n\nEL\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Greece\n\n\nHR\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Croatia\n\n\nHU\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Hungary\n\n\nIE\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Ireland\n\n\nIT\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Italy\n\n\nLV\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Latvia\n\n\nLT\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Lithuania\n\n\nLU\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Luxembourg\n\n\nMT\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Malta\n\n\nNL\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The Netherlands\n\n\nPL\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Poland\n\n\nPT\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Portugal\n\n\n\nRO\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Romania\n\n\nSK\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Slovak Republic\n\n\nSI\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Slovenia\n\n\nSE\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Sweden\n\n\nUK\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0United Kingdom\n\n\n1.The list of reservations below indicates the economic activities liberalised pursuant to Article\u00a0114 of this Agreement for which limitations on key personnel and graduate trainees in accordance with Article 124 of this Agreement apply and specifies such limitations. The lists are composed of the following elements:\n\n\n(a)a first column indicating the sector or sub-sector in which limitations apply; and\n\n\n\n\n(b)a second column describing the applicable limitations.\n\n\nWhen the column referred to under subparagraph (b) only includes European Union Member\u00a0State -specific reservations, European Union Member States not mentioned therein undertake commitments in the sector concerned without reservations\n1\n.\n\n\nThe European Union and its Member States do not undertake any commitment for key personnel and graduate trainees in economic activities which are not liberalised (remain unbound) pursuant to article 114 of this Agreement.\n\n\n2.In identifying individual sectors and sub-sectors:\n\n\n(a)\"ISIC rev 3.1\" means the International Standard Industrial Classification of all Economic Activities as set out in Statistical Office of the United Nations, Statistical Papers, Series M, N\u00b0 4, ISIC REV 3.1, 2002;\n\n\n(b)\"CPC\" means the Central Products Classification as set out in Statistical Office of the United Nations, Statistical Papers, Series M, N\u00b0 77, CPC prov, 1991; and\n\n\n(c)\"CPC ver. 1.0\" means the Central Products Classification as set out in Statistical Office of the United Nations, Statistical Papers, Series M, N\u00b0 77, CPC ver\u00a01.0,\u00a01998.\n\n\n3.Commitments on key personnel and graduate trainees do not apply in cases where the intent or effect of their temporary presence is to interfere with or otherwise affect the outcome of any labour/management dispute or negotiation. \n\n\n4.The list below does not include measures relating to qualification requirements and procedures, technical standards and licensing requirements and procedures, and measures regarding employment, work and social security conditions when they do not constitute a limitation within the meaning of Articles 112 and 113 of this Agreement. Those measures (e.g. need to obtain a license, need to obtain recognition of qualifications in regulated sectors, need to pass specific examinations, including language examinations, need to have a legal domicile in the territory where the economic activity is performed, need to comply with national regulations and practices concerning minimum wages and with collective wage agreements in the host country), even if not listed, apply in any case to key personnel and graduate trainees of investors of another Party. In accordance with Article 107 paragraph 3 of this Agreement, the list below does not include measures concerning subsidies granted by the\u00a0Parties.\n\n\n5.All requirements of the laws and regulations of the European Union and its Member States regarding entry, stay, work and social security measures shall continue to apply, including regulations concerning period of stay, minimum wages as well as collective wage agreements even if not listed below.\n\n\n6.The list below is without prejudice to the existence of public monopolies and exclusive rights as described in the list of commitments on establishment. \n\n\n7.In those sectors where economic needs tests are applied, their main criteria will be the assessment of the relevant market situation in the European Union Member States or the region where the service is to be provided, including with respect to the number of, and the impact on, existing services suppliers. \n\n\n8.The rights and obligations arising from this list of reservations shall have no self-executing effect and thus confer no rights directly to individual natural persons or juridical persons.\n\n\n'\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector or Sub-Sector\n\n\n\n\nDescription of Reservations\n\n\n\n\n\n\nALL SECTORS\n\n\n\n\nEconomic needs test\n\n\nBG, HU: Economic needs test is required for graduate trainees.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nALL SECTORS\n\n\n\n\nScope of intra-corporate transfers\n\n\nBG: The number of intra-corporate transferees is not to exceed 10 per cent of the average annual number of the European Union citizens employed by the respective Bulgarian juridical person: Where less than 100 persons are employed, the number of intra-corporate transferees may, subject to authorisation, exceed 10 per cent.\n\n\nHU: Unbound for natural persons who have been a partner in a juridical person of another Party.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nALL SECTORS\n\n\n\n\nManaging directors and auditors\n\n\nAT: Managing directors of branches of juridical persons have to be resident in Austria; natural persons responsible within a juridical person or a branch for the observance of the Austrian Trade Act must have a domicile in Austria.\n\n\nFI: A foreigner carrying on trade as private entrepreneur needs a trade permit and has to be permanently resident in the European Union. For all sectors, except telecommunications services, nationality condition and residence requirement for the managing director of a limited company. For telecommunications services, permanent residency for the managing director.\n\n\nFR: The managing director of an industrial, commercial or artisanal activity, if not holder of a residence permit, needs a specific authorisation.\n\n\nRO: The majority of the commercial companies' auditors and their deputies shall be Romanian citizens.\n\n\nSE: The managing director of a juridical person or a branch shall reside in\u00a0Sweden.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nALL SECTORS\n\n\n\n\nRecognition\n\n\nEU: European Union directives on mutual recognition of diplomas only apply to European Union nationals. The right to practise a regulated professional service in one European Union Member State does not grant the right to practice in another European Union Member State\n2\n.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n4. Manufacturing\n3\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nH. Publishing, printing and reproduction of recorded media\n\n\n(ISIC rev 3.1: 22), excluding publishing and printing on a fee or contract basis\n4\n\n\n\n\n\nHR: Residency requirement for publishers.\n\n\nIT: Nationality condition for publisher.\n\n\nPL: Nationality condition for the editor-in-chief of newspapers and journals.\n\n\nSE: Residency requirements for publisher and owner of publishing and printing company. \n\n\n\n\n\n\n6. BUSINESS SERVICES\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Professional Services\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Legal Services \n\n\n(CPC 861)\n5\n\n\n\nexcluding legal advisory and legal documentations and certification services provided by legal professionals entrusted with public functions, such as notaries, huissiers de justice or other officiers publics et minist\u00e9riels\n\n\n\n\nAT, CY, ES, EL, LT, MT, RO, SK: Full admission to the Bar, required for the practice of domestic (European Union and its Member States) law, is subject to a nationality condition. For ES, the competent authorities may grant waivers.\n\n\nBE, FI: Full admission to the Bar, required for legal representation services, is subject to a nationality condition, coupled with residency requirements. In Belgium quotas apply for appearing before the \"Cour de cassation\" in non-criminal cases.\n\n\nBG: Foreign lawyers can only provide legal representation services of a national of their home country and subject to reciprocity and cooperation with a Bulgarian lawyer. For legal mediation services permanent residence is required.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nFR: Lawyers' access to the profession of \"avocat aupr\u00e8s de la Cour de Cassation\" and \"avocat aupr\u00e8s du Conseil d'Etat\" is subject to quotas and to a nationality condition.\n\n\nHR: Full admission to the Bar, required for legal representation services, is subject to a nationality condition (EU Member States citizenship). \n\n\nHU: Full admission to the Bar is subject to a nationality condition, coupled with residency requirements. For foreign lawyers the scope of legal activities is limited to the provision of legal advice, which hast to take place on the basis of a collaboration contract concluded with a Hungarian attorney or law firm.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLV: Nationality requirement for sworn solicitors, to whom legal representation in criminal proceedings is reserved.\n\n\nDK: Marketing of legal advice activities is restricted to lawyers with a Danish license to practice. Requirement of a Danish legal examination in order to obtain a Danish licence.\n\n\nLU: Nationality condition for the supply of legal services in respect of Luxembourg and European Union law.\n\n\nSE: Admission to the Bar, necessary only for the use of the Swedish title \"advokat\", is subject to a residency requirement.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) 1. Accounting and Bookkeeping Services\n\n\n(CPC 86212 other than \"auditing services\", CPC 86213, CPC 86219 and CPC 86220)\n\n\n\n\nFR: Provision of accounting and bookkeeping services is conditional on a decision of the Minister of Economics, Finance and Industry, in agreement with the Minister of Foreign Affairs. The requirement of residence cannot exceed 5 years.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) 2. Auditing services\n\n\n(CPC 86211 and 86212 other than accounting services)\n\n\n\n\nAT: Nationality condition for representation before competent authorities and for performing audits provided for in specific Austrian laws (e.g. joint stock companies law, stock exchange law, banking law, etc.)\n\n\nDK: Residence requirement.\n\n\nES: Condition of nationality for statutory auditors and for administrators, directors and partners of companies other than those covered by the 8th EEC directive on company law.\n\n\nFI: Residency requirement for at least one of the auditors of a Finnish Liability company.\n\n\nEL: Condition of nationality for statutory auditors.\n\n\nHR: Only certified auditors holding a licence formally recognised by the Croatian Chamber of Auditors can provide auditing services. \n\n\nIT: Condition of nationality for administrators, directors and partners of companies other than those covered by the 8th EEC directive on company law. Residence requirement for individual auditors.\n\n\nSE: Only auditors approved in Sweden may perform legal auditing services in certain legal entities, a.o. in all limited companies. Residency required for\u00a0approval.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nc) Taxation Advisory Services\n\n\n(CPC 863)\u00a0\n6\n\n\n\n\n\nAT: Nationality condition for representation before competent authorities.\n\n\nBG, SI: Nationality condition for specialists.\n\n\nHU: Residency requirement\n\n\n\n\n\n\nd) Architectural services\n\n\nand\n\n\ne) Urban planning and landscape architectural services\n\n\n(CPC 8671 and CPC 8674)\n\n\n\n\nEE: At least one responsible person (project manager or consultant) must be resident in Estonia\n\n\nBG: Foreign specialists must have experience in the field of construction of at least two years. Nationality condition for urban planning and landscape architectural services\n\n\nEL, HR, HU, SK: Residence requirement\n\n\n\n\n\n\nf) Engineering services\n\n\nand\n\n\ng) Integrated engineering services\n\n\n(CPC 8672 and CPC 8673)\n\n\n\n\nEE: At least one responsible person (project manager or consultant) must be resident in Estonia\n\n\nBG: Foreign specialists must have experience in the field of construction of at least two years.\n\n\nEL, HR, HU, SK: Residence requirement.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nh) Medical (including psychologists) and Dental services\n\n\n(CPC 9312 and part of CPC 85201) \n\n\n\n\nCZ, IT, SK: Residence requirement.\n\n\nCZ, EE, RO, SK: Authorization by the competent authorities required for foreign natural persons.\n\n\nBE, LU: For graduate trainees, authorization by the competent authorities required for foreign natural persons.\n\n\nBG, CY, MT: Condition of nationality.\n\n\nDE: Condition of nationality which can be waived on an exceptional basis in cases of public health interest.\n\n\nDK: Limited authorization to fulfil a specific function can be given for maximum 18 months and requires residence.\n\n\nFR: Condition of nationality. However, access is possible within annually established quotas.\n\n\nLV: Practice of medical profession by foreigners requires the permission from local health authority, based on economic needs for medical doctors and dentists in a given region.\n\n\nPL: Practice of medical profession by foreigners requires the permission. Foreign medical doctors have limited election rights within the professional chambers.\n\n\nPT: Residence requirement for psychologists.\n\n\n\n\n\n\ni) Veterinary services\n\n\n(CPC 932)\n\n\n\n\nBG, CY, DE, EE, EL, FR, HR, HU, MT, SI: Nationality condition.\n\n\nCZ, SK: Nationality condition and residence requirement.\n\n\nIT: Residence requirement.\n\n\nPL: Nationality requirement. Foreign persons may apply for permission to practice\n\n\n\n\n\n\nj) 1. Midwives services\n\n\n(part of CPC 93191)\n\n\n\n\nAT: In order to establish a professional practice in Austria, the person concerned must have practised the profession in question at least three years preceding the setting up of that professional practice.\n\n\nBE, LU: For graduate trainees, authorization by the competent authorities required for foreign natural persons.\n\n\nCZ, CY, EE, RO, SK: Authorization by the competent authorities required for foreign natural persons.\n\n\nFR: Condition of nationality. However, access is possible within annually established quotas.\n\n\nHU: Nationality condition.\n\n\nIT: Residence requirement.\n\n\nLV: Economic needs determined by the total number of midwives in the given region, authorized by local health authorities.\n\n\nPL: Nationality condition. Foreign persons may apply for permission to practice.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nj) 2. Services provided by Nurses, Physiotherapists and Paramedical Personnel\n\n\n(part of CPC 93191)\n\n\n\n\nAT: Foreign services suppliers are only allowed in the following activities: nurses, physiotherapists, occupational therapists, logotherapists, dieticians and nutricians. In order to establish a professional practice in Austria, the person concerned must have practised the profession in question at least three years preceding the setting up of that professional practice.\n\n\nBE, FR, LU: For graduate trainees, authorization by the competent authorities required for foreign natural persons.\n\n\nCY, CZ, EE, RO, SK: Authorization by the competent authorities required for foreign natural persons.\n\n\nHU: Condition of nationality.\n\n\nDK: Limited authorization to fulfil a specific function can be given for maximum 18 months and requires residence.\n\n\nCY, CZ, EL, IT: Subject to economic needs test: decision is subject to regional vacancies and shortages.\n\n\nLV: Economic needs determined by the total number of nurses in the given region, authorized by local health authorities.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nk) Retail sales of pharmaceuticals and retail sales of medical and orthopaedical goods \n\n\n(CPC 63211)\n\n\nand other services supplied by pharmacists\n7\n\u00a0\n\n\n\n\nFR: Condition of nationality. However, within established quotas, access for third country nationals is possible provided the service provider holds the French degree in pharmacy.\n\n\nDE, EL, SK: Condition of nationality\n\n\nHU: Condition of nationality except for retail sales of pharmaceuticals and retail sales of medical and orthopaedical goods (CPC 63211).\n\n\nIT, PT: Residence requirement.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nD. Real Estate Services\n8\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Involving Own or Leased Property \n\n\n(CPC 821)\n\n\n\n\nFR, HU, IT, PT: Residence requirement.\n\n\nLV, MT, SI: Nationality condition.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) On a Fee or Contract Basis\n\n\n(CPC 822)\n\n\n\n\nDK: Residence requirement unless waived by the Danish Commerce and Companies Agency.\n\n\nFR, HU, IT, PT: Residence requirement\n\n\nCY (for Ecuador only), LV, MT, SI: Nationality condition.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nE. Rental/Leasing Services without Operators\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\ne) Relating to personal and household goods\n\n\n(CPC 832)\n\n\n\n\nEU: Nationality condition for graduate trainees.\n\n\nAT, BE, BG, CY, CZ, DE, DK, ES, FI, FR, EL, IE, IT, LU, MT, NL, PL, PT, RO, SK, SI, SE, UK: Nationality condition for specialists\n\n\n\n\n\n\nf) Telecommunications equipment rental\n\n\n(CPC 7541)\n\n\n\n\nEU: Nationality condition for specialists and for graduate trainees.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nF. Other Business Services \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\ne) Technical Testing and Analysis Services\n\n\n(CPC 8676)\n\n\n\n\nIT, PT: Residence requirements for biologist and chemical analyst.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nf) Advisory and Consulting services incidental to Agriculture, Hunting and Forestry\n\n\n(part of CPC 881)\n\n\n\n\nIT: Residence requirements for agronomists and \"periti agrari\".\n\n\n\n\n\n\nj) 2. Security Services \n\n\n(CPC 87302, CPC 87303, CPC 87304 and CPC 87305)\n\n\n\n\nBE: Nationality condition and residence requirement for management personnel.\n\n\nBG, CY, CZ, EE, LV, LT, MT, PL, RO, SI, SK: Nationality condition and residence requirement.\n\n\nDK: Nationality condition and residence requirement for managers and for airport guard services.\n\n\nES, PT: Nationality condition for specialized personnel.\n\n\nFR: Nationality condition for managing directors and directors.\n\n\nIT: Nationality condition and residence requirement in order to obtain necessary authorization for security guard services and the transport of valuables.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nk) Related Scientific and Technical Consulting Services\n\n\n(CPC 8675)\n\n\n\n\nBG: Nationality condition for specialists.\n\n\nDE: Nationality condition for publicly appointed surveyors.\n\n\nFR: Nationality condition for \"surveying\" operations relating to the establishment of property rights and to land law.\n\n\nIT, PT: Residence requirement.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nl) 1. Maintenance and repair of vessels\n\n\n(part of CPC 8868)\n\n\n\n\nMT: Nationality condition.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nl) 2. Maintenance and Repair of Rail Transport Equipment \n\n\n(part of CPC 8868)\n\n\n\n\nLV: Nationality condition.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n l) 3. Maintenance and Repair of motor vehicles, motorcycles, snowmobiles and road transport Equipment \n\n\n(CPC 6112, CPC 6122, part of CPC 8867 and part of CPC 8868)\n\n\n\n\nEU: For maintenance and repair of motor vehicles, motorcycles and snowmobiles, nationality condition for specialists and for graduate trainees.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nl) 5. Maintenance and Repair services of metal products, of (non office) machinery, of (non transport and non office) equipment and of personal and household goods\n9\n\n\n\n(CPC 633, CPC 7545, CPC 8861, CPC 8862, CPC 8864, CPC 8865 and CPC 8866)\n\n\n\n\nEU: Nationality condition for specialists and for graduate trainees.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nm) Building-Cleaning Services\n\n\n(CPC 874)\n\n\n\n\nCY, EE, HR, MT, PL, RO, SI: Nationality condition for specialists.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nn) Photographic Services\n\n\n(CPC 875)\n\n\n\n\nHR, LV: Nationality condition for speciality photography services.\n\n\nPL: Nationality condition for the supply of aerial photographic services.\n\n\n\n\n\n\np) Printing and Publishing\n\n\n(CPC 88442)\n\n\n\n\nHR: Residency requirement for publishers.\n\n\nSE: Residency requirements for publisher and owner of publishing and printing company\n\n\n\n\n\n\nr) 1. Translation and Interpretation Services\n\n\n(CPC 87905)\n\n\n\n\nFI: Residence requirement for certified translators\n\n\nDK: Residence requirement for authorized public translators and interpreters, unless waived by the Danish Commerce and Companies Agency. \n\n\n\n\n\n\nq) Convention Services\n\n\n(part of CPC 87909)\n\n\n\n\nSI: Nationality condition.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nr) 3. Duplicating services\n\n\n(CPC 87904)\n10\n\n\n\n\n\nAT, BE, BG, CY, CZ, DE, DK, ES, EE, FI, FR, EL, HU, IE, IT, LT, LU, MT, NL, PL, PT, RO, SK, SI, SE, UK: Nationality condition for specialists and for graduate trainees.\n\n\nLV: Economic needs test for specialists and nationality condition for graduate trainees.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n8. CONSTRUCTION AND RELATED ENGINEERING SERVICES (CPC 511, CPC 512, CPC 513, CPC 514, CPC 515, CPC 516, CPC 517 and CPC 518) \n\n\n\n\nBG: Foreign specialists must have experience in the field of construction of at least two years.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n9.DISTRIBUTION SERVICES\n\n\n(excluding distribution of arms, munitions and war material)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC. EDUCATIONAL SERVICES (only privately funded services) \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Primary Education Services \n\n\n(CPC 921) \n\n\n\n\n\nFR: Condition of nationality. However, third country nationals may obtain authorisation from competent authorities to establish and direct an education institution and to teach.\n\n\nIT: Condition of nationality for service providers who are authorised to issue State-recognized diplomas.\n\n\nEL: condition of nationality for teachers.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB. Secondary Education Services\n\n\n(CPC 922)\n\n\n\n\nFR: Condition of nationality. However, third country nationals may obtain authorisation from competent authorities to establish and direct an education institution and to teach.\n\n\nIT: Condition of nationality for service providers who are authorised to issue State-recognized diplomas.\n\n\nEL: Condition of nationality for teachers.\n\n\nLV: Condition of nationality for technical and vocational secondary school-type education services for handicapped students (CPC 9224) \n\n\n\n\n\n\nC. Higher Education Services\n\n\n(CPC 923)\n\n\n\n\nFR: Condition of nationality. However, third country nationals may obtain authorisation from competent authorities to establish and direct an education institution and to teach.\n\n\nCZ, SK: Condition of nationality for higher education services, except for post-secondary technical and vocational education services (CPC 92310). \n\n\nIT: Condition of nationality for service providers who are authorised to issue State-recognized diplomas.\n\n\nDK: Condition of nationality for professors.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n12. FINANCIAL SERVICES\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Insurance and insurance-related services\n\n\n\n\nAT: The management of a branch office must consist of two natural persons resident in Austria.\n\n\nEE: For direct insurance, the management body of an insurance joint-stock company with foreign capital participation may include citizens of nonEuropean Union countries only in proportion to the foreign participation and not more than half of the members of the management group. The head of the management of a subsidiary or an independent company must permanently reside in Estonia.\n\n\nES: Residency requirement and three years of experience for the actuarial profession.\n\n\nHR: Residency requirement.\n\n\nIT: Residency requirement for the actuarial profession.\n\n\nFI: The managing directors and at least one auditor of an insurance company shall have their place of residence in the European Union, unless the competent authorities have granted an exemption. The general agent of the foreign insurance company shall have his/her place of residence in Finland, unless the company has its head office in the European Union.\n\n\nPL: Residency requirement for insurance intermediaries\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB. Banking and other financial services (excluding insurance)\n\n\n\n\nBG: Permanent residence in Bulgaria is required for the executive directors and the managerial agent. \n\n\nFI: The managing directors and at least one auditor of credits institutions shall have their place of residence in the European Union, unless the Financial Supervision Authority has granted an exemption. The broker (individual person) on derivative exchange shall have his/her place of residence in the European Union.\n\n\nHR: Residency requirement. The management board shall direct the business of a credit institution from the territory of Croatia. At least one management board member must be fluent in the Croatian language. \n\n\nIT: Condition of residence within the territory of a European Union Member\u00a0State for \"promotori di servizi finanziari\" (financial salesmen)\n\n\nLT: (for Colombia and Peru): At least one manager must be a European Union citizen.\n\n\nLT: (for Ecuador): At least one head of a bank\u2019s administration must speak the Lithuanian language and permantly reside in the Republic of Lituania.\n\n\nPL: Nationality requirement for at least one of the bank executives.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n13. HEALTH SERVICES AND SOCIAL SERVICES\n\n\n(only privately funded services)\n\n\nA. Hospital Services\n\n\n(CPC 9311)\n\n\nB. Ambulance Services\n\n\n(CPC 93192)\n\n\nC. Residential health facilities other than hospital services\n\n\n(CPC 93193)\n\n\nE. Social Services\n\n\n(CPC 933)\n\n\n\n\nFR: The necessary authorisation for the access to management functions takes into consideration the availability of local managers.\n\n\nLV: Economic needs tests for doctors, dentists, midwives, nurses, physiotherapists and para-medical personnel.\n\n\nPL: Practice of medical profession by foreigners requires the permission. Foreign medical doctors have limited election rights within the professional\u00a0chambers.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n14. TOURISM AND TRAVEL RELATED SERVICES\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Hotel, Restaurants and Catering \n\n\n(CPC 641, CPC 642 and CPC 643)\n\n\nexcluding catering in air transport services\n12\n\n\n\n\n\nBG: The number of foreign managers is not to exceed the number of managers who are Bulgarian citizens, in cases where the public (state and/or municipal) share in the equity capital of a Bulgarian company exceeds 50 per cent \n\n\nHR: Nationality requirement for hospitality and catering services in households and rural homesteads.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB. Travel Agencies and Tour Operators Services (including tour managers)\n\n\n(CPC 7471)\n\n\n\n\nBG: The number of foreign managers is not to exceed the number of managers who are Bulgarian citizens, in cases where the public (state and/or municipal) share in the equity capital of a Bulgarian company exceeds 50 per cent.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC. Tourist Guides Services\n\n\n(CPC 7472)\n\n\n\n\nES, FR, EL, HR, IT, PL, PT: Nationality condition\n\n\nES, IT: The right to exercise the profession is reserved for the local organisations of tourist guides\n\n\n\n\n\n\n15. RECREATIONAL, CULTURAL AND SPORTING SERVICES\n\n\n(other than audio-visual services)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Maritime transport\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) International passenger transportation \n\n\n(CPC 7211 less national cabotage transport).\n\n\nb) International freight transportation\n\n\n(CPC 7212 less national cabotage transport)\n13\n\n\n\n\n\nEU: Nationality condition for ships' crews\n\n\nAT: Nationality condition for the majority of managing directors\n\n\n\n\n\n\nD. Road Transport \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Passenger Transportation\n\n\n(CPC 7121 and CPC 7122)\n\n\n\n\nAT: Nationality condition for persons and shareholders entitled to represent a juridical person or a partnership\n\n\nDK, HR: Nationality condition and residence requirement for managers.\n\n\nBG, MT: Nationality condition\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) Freight Transportation\n\n\n(CPC 7123, excluding transportation of mail on own account\n14\n).\n\n\n\n\nAT: Nationality condition for persons and shareholders entitled to represent a juridical person or a partnership\n\n\nBG, MT: Nationality condition\n\n\nHR: Nationality condition and residency requirement for managers.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nE. Pipeline transport of goods other than fuel\n15\n\n\n\n(CPC 7139)\n\n\n\n\nAT: Nationality condition for managing directors.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n17 SERVICES AUXILIARY TO TRANSPORT\n16\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Services auxiliary to Maritime Transport\n\n\na) Maritime Cargo Handling Services\n\n\nb) Storage and warehousing Services\n\n\n(part of CPC 742) \n\n\nc) Customs Clearance Services\n\n\nd) Container Station and Depot Services\n\n\ne) Maritime Agency Services \n\n\nf) Maritime Freight Forwarding Services\n\n\n\n\nEU: Nationality condition for crews for pushing, towing services, and for supporting services for maritime transport.\n\n\nAT: Nationality condition for the majority of managing directors for a), d), h), g), h), and i). \n\n\n\nBG, MT: Nationality condition\n\n\nDK: Requirement of residence for customs clearance services\n\n\nEL: Nationality condition for customs clearance services\n\n\nIT: Requirement of residence for \"raccomandatorio marittimo\"\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\ng) Rental of Vessels with Crew\n\n\n(CPC 7213)\n\n\nh) Pushing and towing services \n\n\n(CPC 7214)\n\n\ni) Supporting services for maritime transport \n\n\n(part of CPC 745)\n\n\nj) Other supporting and auxiliary services\n\n\n(part of CPC 749)\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nB. Services auxiliary to internal waterways transport\n\n\ne) Pushing and towing services \n\n\n(CPC 7224)\n\n\nf) Supporting services for internal waterway transport\n\n\n( part of CPC 745)\n\n\n\n\nEU: Nationality condition for crews\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC. Services auxiliary to road transport\n\n\nd) Rental of Commercial Road Vehicles with Operators\n\n\n(CPC 7124)\n\n\ne) Customs clearance services \n\n\n\n\n\nAT: Nationality condition for persons and shareholders entitled to represent a juridical person or a partnership for rental of commercial road vehicles with operators services.\n\n\nBG, MT: Nationality condition\n\n\nDK: Requirement of residence for customs clearance services\n\n\nEL: Nationality condition for customs clearance services\n\n\nPL: National restrictions concerning direct representation in customs clearance services: it can be performed by customs agents only who have the residence in the territory of European Union. \n\n\nFR: Unbound except if full reciprocity is granted.\n\n\nNL: The admittance of natural or juridical persons to act as customs representatives is subject to discretion by the inspector, as provided by articles 1(3) and 1(9) of the General Customs Act. Admittance will be denied in case the applicant has been irrevocably sentenced for a criminal act in the past five years. Customs representatives, who are not a resident of or established in the Netherlands, are required to take residence or establish a fixed location in the Netherlands, before they perform activities as an admitted customs representative.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nD. Services auxiliary to rail transport\n17\n\n\n\na) Customs clearance services \n\n\n\n\nBG, MT: Nationality condition\n\n\nDK: Requirement of residence for customs clearance services\n\n\nEL: Nationality condition for customs clearance services\n\n\nPL: National restrictions concerning direct representation in customs clearance services: it can be performed by customs agents only who have the residence in the territory of European Union.\n\n\nFR: Unbound except if full reciprocity is granted.\n\n\nNL: The admittance of natural or juridical persons to act as customs representatives is subject to discretion by the inspector, as provided by articles 1(3) and 1(9) of the General Customs Act. Admittance will be denied in case the applicant has been irrevocably sentenced for a criminal act in the past five years. Customs representatives, who are not a resident of or established in the Netherlands, are required to take residence or establish a fixed location in the Netherlands, before they perform activities as an admitted customs representative. \n\n\n\n\n\n\nE. Services auxiliary to air transport services\n\n\na) Customs clearance services\n\n\n\n\nBG, MT: Nationality condition\n\n\nDK: Requirement of residence for customs clearance services\n\n\nEL: Nationality condition for customs clearance services\n\n\nPL: National restrictions concerning direct representation in customs clearance services: it can be performed by customs agents only who have the residence in the territory of European Union. \n\n\nFR: Unbound except if full reciprocity is granted.\n\n\nNL: The admittance of natural or juridical persons to act as customs representatives is subject to discretion by the inspector, as provided by articles 1(3) and 1(9) of the General Customs Act. Admittance will be denied in case the applicant has been irrevocably sentenced for a criminal act in the past five years. Customs representatives, who are not a resident of or established in the Netherlands, are required to take residence or establish a fixed location in the Netherlands, before they perform activities as an admitted customs representative.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nF. Services auxiliary to pipeline transport of goods other than fuel\n18\n\n\n\na) Storage and warehouse services of goods other than fuel transported by pipelines \n\n\n(part of CPC 742)\n\n\n\n\nAT: Nationality condition for managing directors.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n18. ENERGY SERVICES\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Services Incidental to Mining\n\n\n(CPC 883)\n19\n\n\n\n\n\nSK: Residence requirement.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n19.
