trainees.\n\n\nAT: Nationality condition for graduate trainees.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nd) Other beauty treatment services n.e.c \n\n\n(CPC\u00a097029)\n\n\n\n\nBE, BG, CY, CZ, DE, DK, ES, EE, FI, FR, EL, HR, HU, IE, IT, LV, LT, LU, MT, NL, PL, PT, RO, SK, SI, SE, UK: Nationality condition for specialists and for graduate trainees.\n\n\nAT: Nationality condition for graduate trainees.\n\n\n\n\n\n\ne) Spa services and non therapeutical massages, to the extent that they are provided as relaxation physical well-being services and not for medical or rehabilitation purposes\n20\n\n\n\n(CPC ver. 1.0 97230)\n\n\n\n\nEU: Nationality condition for specialists and for graduate trainees.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(1)\nThe absence of European Union Member State-specific reservations in a given sector is without prejudice to horizontal reservations or to sectoral European Union -broad reservations that may apply.\n\n\n\n(2)\nIn order for third-country nationals to obtain European Union -wide recognition of their qualifications, it is necessary a Mutual Recognition Agreement negotiated within the framework defined in Article 129 of this Agreement.\n\n\n\n(3)\nThis sector does not include advisory services incidental to manufacturing, which are to be found in BUSINESS SERVICES under 6.F.h).\n\n\n\n(4)\nPublishing and printing on a fee or contract basis is to be found in BUSINESS SERVICES under 6.F.p).\n\n\n\n(5)\nIncludes legal advisory, legal representational, legal arbitration and conciliation/mediation, and legal documentation and certification services.\n\nProvision of legal services is only authorised in respect of public international law, European Union law and the law of any jurisdiction where the service supplier or its personnel is qualified to practice as a lawyer, and, like the provision of other services, is subject to licensing requirements and procedures applicable in European Union Member States. For lawyers providing legal services in respect of public international law and foreign law, these may take inter alia the form of compliance with local codes of ethics, use of home title (unless recognition with the host title has been obtained) insurance requirements, simple registration with the host country Bar or a simplified admission to the host country Bar through an aptitude test and a legal or professional domicile in the host country. Legal services in respect of European Union law shall in principle be carried out by or through a fully qualified lawyer admitted to the Bar in the European Union acting personally, and legal services in respect of the law of a European Union Member State shall in principle be carried out by or through a fully qualified lawyer admitted to the Bar in that European Union Member State acting personally. Full admission to the Bar in the relevant European Union Member State might therefore be necessary for representation before Courts and other competent authorities in the European Union since it involves practice of European Union and national procedural law. However, in some European Union Member States, foreign lawyers not fully admitted to the Bar are allowed to represent in civil proceedings a party being a national or belonging to the State in which the lawyer is entitled to practice.\n\n\n\n(6)\nDoes not include legal advisory and legal representational services on tax matters, which are to be found under\u00a01.A.a). Legal services.\n\n\n\n(7)\nThe supply of pharmaceuticals to the general public, like the provision of other services, is subject to licensing and qualification requirements and procedures applicable in European Union Member States. As a general rule, this activity is reserved to pharmacists. In some European Union Member States, only the supply of prescription drugs is reserved to pharmacists. \n\n\n\n(8)\nThe service involved relates to the profession of real estate agent and does not affect any rights and/or restrictions on natural and juridical persons purchasing real estate.\n\n\n\n(9)\nMaintenance and repair services of transport equipment (CPC 6112, 6122, 8867 and CPC\u00a08868) are to be found under 6.F. l) 1 to 6.F.l) 4.\n\nMaintenance and repair services of office machinery and equipment including computers (CPC 845) are to be found under 6.B. Computer services.\n\n\n\n(10)\nIt does not include printing services, which fall under CPC 88442 and are to be found under\u00a06.F p).\n\n\n\n(11)\nDoes not include maintenance and repair services, which are to be found in BUSINESS SERVICES under 6.B. and 6.F.l).\n\nIt does not include retailing services of energy products which are to be found in ENERGY SERVICES under\u00a018.E and 18.F.\n\n\n\n(12)\nCatering in air transport services is to be found in SERVICES AUXILARY TO TRANSPORT SERVICES under 17.D.a) Groundhandling services\n\n\n\n(13)\nIncludes feedering services and movement of equipment by international maritime transport suppliers between ports located in same State when no revenue is involved\n\n\n\n(14)\nPart of CPC 71235, which is to be found in COMMUNICATION SERVICES under 7.A. Postal and courier services. \n\n\n\n(15)\nPipeline transportation of fuels is to be found in ENERGY SERVICES under 18.B.\n\n\n\n(16)\nDoes not include maintenance and repair services of transport equipment, which are to be found in BUSINESS SERVICES under 6.F.l) 1 to 6.F.l) 4. \n\n\n\n(17)\nThe horizontal limitation on public utilities applies when the services require the use of the public domain.\n\n\n\n(18)\nServices auxiliary to pipeline transportation of fuels are to be found in ENERGY SERVICES. under 18.C.\n\n\n\n(19)\nIncludes the following service rendered on a fee or contract basis: advisory and consulting services relating to mining, on land site preparation, on land rig installation, drilling, drilling bits services, casing and tubular services, mud engineering and supply, solids control, fishing and downhole special operations, wellsite geology and drilling control, core taking, well testing, wireline services, supply and operation of completion fluids (brines) supply and installation of completion devices, cementing (pressure pumping), stimulation services (fracturing, acidising and pressure pumping), workover and well repair services, plugging and abandoning of\u00a0wells.\n\nDoes not include direct access to or exploitation of natural resources.\n\nDoes not include site preparation work for mining of resources other than oil and gas (CPC\u00a05115), which is to be found under 8. CONSTRUCTION SERVICES. \n\n\n\n(20)\nTherapeutical massages and thermal cure services are to be found under 6.A.h) Medical services, 6.A.j) 2 Services provided by nurses, physiotherapists and para-medical personnel and health services (13.A and 13 C).\n\n\n\n\n\nTop  \n\n\n\n\n\n\nEUROPEAN COMMISSION\nBrussels, 4.4.2016\nCOM(2016) 173 final\nANNEX\nto the\nProposal for a Council Decision\non the signing, on behalf of the European Union, and provisional application of the Protocol of Accession to the Trade Agreement  between the European Union and its Member States, of the one part, and Colombia and Peru, of the other part, to take account of the Accession of Ecuador\n\n\n\n\n\n\nANNEX XIV\n\n\n(New Section D of Appendix 1 to Annex IX to the Agreement referred to in Article 124 of the Agreement)\n\n\nRESERVATIONS REGARDING TEMPORARY PRESENCE OF\nNATURAL PERSONS FOR BUSINESS PURPOSES\n\n\nAPPENDIX 1\n\n\nRESERVATIONS ON KEY PERSONNEL AND GRADUATE TRAINEES\n\n\n'SECTION\u00a0D\n\n\nECUADOR\n\n\nThis Schedule of Commitments is consistent with the constitutional and legal provisions governing the temporary presence in Ecuador of persons for business purposes and their compatibility with the undertakings made at multilateral level.\n\n\nFor the preparation of this offer, account was taken of the United Nations Statistics Division's Central Products Classification, Statistical Reports, Series M, No. 77, provisional, 1991, for the offer relating to cross-border trade in services.\n\n\nThe list of reservations set out below indicates the economic activities liberalised pursuant to Article\u00a0114 of this Agreement for which limitations on key personnel and graduate trainees in accordance with Article 124 of the same apply, and specifies such limitations. Ecuador does not undertake any commitment for key personnel and graduate trainees in economic activities which are not liberalised (remain unbound) pursuant to Article 114 of this Agreement.\n\n\nFor methodological revision and analysis purposes, the list below is presented as follows:\n\n\n\u2013The services sectors affected by restrictions in this offer are shown on the left-hand side headed \u201cSector or sub-sector\u201d.\n\n\n\u2013To complement the list, the right-hand column includes the restrictions or limitations affecting the corresponding sector or sub-sector.\n\n\n\u2013Commitments in specific sectors or sub-sectors are subject to the horizontal reservations and limitations included in the first section, which apply across the board and unconditionally to all sectors unless otherwise stated.\n\n\nIn accordance with the provisions included in Article 107(7) relating to the scope of the rules in the Title on Trade in Services, Establishment and Electronic Commerce, no measures are listed that relate to regulation of the entry of natural persons into, or their temporary stay in, Ecuadorian territory, including those measures adopted or maintained by Ecuador as necessary to protect the integrity of, and to ensure the orderly movement of natural persons across, its borders.\n\n\nThe list below does not include measures relating to qualification requirements and procedures, technical standards and licensing requirements and procedures, and measures regarding employment, work and social security conditions. Such measures, which include but are not limited to: the need to obtain a license, the need to obtain recognition of qualifications in regulated sectors, the need to pass specific examinations, including language examinations, the need to have a legal domicile in the territory where the economic activity is performed, the need to comply with national regulations and practices concerning minimum wages and with collective wage agreements in the host country, even if not listed, apply in any case to key personnel and graduate trainees.\n\n\nThe rights and obligations derived from this schedule of commitments are not directly applicable and effective and thus do not confer directly enforceable rights on natural or legal persons.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector or sub-sector\n\n\n\n\nDescription of reservations\n\n\n\n\n\n\nHORIZONTAL COMMITMENTS\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nALL SECTORS\n\n\n\n\nAny employer with a staff of more than 10 employees must employ Ecuadorian nationals at a proportion of not less than 90% of the staff of ordinary employees and not less than 80% of the skilled employees, specialists, administrative staff or persons in posts of responsibility. This restriction does not apply to employers with a staff of up to 10 employees. This proportion shall also apply to the wages and salaries of the respective staff.\n\n\nEmployers, irrespective of their activity or nationality, shall give preference to the recruitment of national workers. \n\n\nAlthough this covers only the temporary entrance of persons for business purposes, it is clarified that where foreign staff are recruited for an establishment in Ecuador a written work contract, for a specified period and approved by the Ministry of Labour Relations, is required in addition to the appropriate visa.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nALL SECTORS \n\n\n\n\nThe recognition of academic degrees or certificates issued by foreign higher education bodies may be subject to bilateral agreements. If the higher education body does not appear on the list approved by the competent body and is not established in countries with which reciprocal agreements have been signed, an application for registration is required.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1. BUSINESS SERVICES\n\n\n\n\nFor registration in associations or guilds, different rates may apply to Ecuadorians and to foreign nationals.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Professional Services\n\n\n\n\nFor the purposes of exercising most professional services in Ecuador, professional qualifications obtained abroad must be recognised by the national competent authority, which generally requires residence in Ecuador before it can grant such recognition. If the employment of the person as key personnel or a graduate trainee does not involve the provision of service for third parties, this requirement does not apply.\n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Legal services (CPC 861) Only advisory services on foreign legislation and international law (excluding advisory services and representation in court cases under national law)\n\n\n\n\nForeign lawyers may exercise their profession, provided their qualification is recognised in Ecuador under the conditions laid down by law and in observance of the principle of reciprocity, if such condition is laid down in an international agreement in force.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nd) Architectural services\n\n\n(CPC 8671 and 8674)\n\n\n\n\nIn order for a foreign architect who qualified abroad to be able to obtain a permanent licence from the College of Architects of Ecuador to exercise the profession in the country, the following are required:\n\n\na) Submission of a properly reasoned application for authorisation to the National Register;\n\n\nb) Verification that Ecuadorian architects can practice with no restrictions in the applicant's country of origin.\n\n\nc) Verification that the applicant is present in the country legally, and more specifically of his/her immigrant status, in the light of the relevant legislation.\n\n\nd) Presentation of an academic qualification duly ratified in Ecuador; and\n\n\ne) Verification of the applicant's worthiness and solvency to exercise the activities proposed, with a certificate from the college or society of architects in his/her country of origin.\n\n\n\n\n\n\ne) Engineering services (CPC 8672)\n\n\nf) Integrated Engineering Services (CPC 8673)\n\n\n\n\n\nNational or foreign enterprises, and consortia of national and/or foreign enterprises formed for the performance of engineering works shall be obliged to have, for the performance of that work, a staff of engineers employed on the Project, not less than 80% of the total of which must be Ecuadorian engineers, until the tenth year of their establishment in the country. From the eleventh year onwards they must increase the percentage of Ecuadorian professionals by 4% per year, until it reaches 90%. In the event that there are no national professionals specialised in the tasks performed by the said enterprises or consortia, they shall be obliged to employ them to train them in the relevant field of specialisation.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nF. OTHER BUSINESS SERVICES\n\n\n\n\nFor the purposes of exercising most professional services in Ecuador, professional qualifications obtained abroad must be recognised by the national competent authority, which generally requires residence in Ecuador before it can grant such recognition. \n\n\n\n\n\n\nl) Investigation and security (CPC 873)\n\n\n\n\nOnly Ecuadorian citizens by birth will be authorised to administer and operate static security services, mobile security services, personal protection, transport of valuables, electronic security, satellite security, investigation and training in this area.\n\n\nStaff providing services in companies of this type as security guards and private investigators must meet nationality requirements.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n7. FINANCIAL SERVICES\n\n\n\n\nResidence requirements are laid down for legal agents and representatives.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n10. RECREATIONAL, CULTURAL AND SPORTING SERVICES\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA Entertainment Services\u00a0\n\n\n(including theatre, live bands and circus services)\n\n\n(CPC 9619)\n\n\n\n\nForeign artistes must obtain a 'carnet ocupacional' (occupational permit) and present up-to-date certification from the National Federation of Professional Artistes.\n\n\nBefore receiving the work permit granted to foreign artistes by the Ministry of Labour Relations, the artistes or their representative shall be required to sign a contract to give a performance free of charge in a location defined by the Ministry of Labour Relations in agreement with the corresponding Decentralised Autonomous Municipal Government.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n11. TRANSPORT SERVICES\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. MARITIME TRANSPORT SERVICES\n\n\n\nInternational Transport of freight and passengers\n\n\n(CPC 7211 and CPC 7212)\n\n\nExcept cabotage transport \n\n\n\n\n\nForeign officers and crews of national vessels shall require authorisation from the Directorate for the Merchant Marine and for the Coast in the case of ships requiring specialised handling and in the absence of any suitable Ecuadorian staff available.\n\n\n\nShips or merchant vessels flying the Ecuadorian flag and larger than 500 tons may only be commanded by captains who are Ecuadorian by birth: their officers may be Ecuadorian by birth or naturalised Ecuadorians who have also met the requirements laid down by the relevant regulation. The Directorate for the Merchant Marine and for the Coast may authorise the recruitment of foreign staff as officers and crew in cases that are duly justified and for reasons of provision of technical services, in accordance with the quotas set each year for each vessel in accordance with its capacity and service specialisation, but under no circumstances may their proportion exceed 40% of the total crew on board.\n\n\n\nVessels smaller than 500 tons may be commanded by captains who are Ecuadorian by birth or naturalised Ecuadorians, and the provisions of the preceding paragraph apply to their officers and crew.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC) AIR TRANSPORT SERVICES \n\n\nd) Repair and maintenance of aircraft (part of CPC 8868)\n\n\ne) Selling and marketing of air transport services.\n\n\nf) Computerised reservation services\n\n\n\n\n\nLicences for aviation personnel for citizens of foreign countries will be granted by the Director-General of Civil Aviation subject to verification of the standards under which the licence was issued or the reciprocity agreement with the foreign country.\n\n\n\nIn Ecuadorian companies, only aeronautical technical personnel of Ecuadorian nationality may perform paid aeronautical activity in the country and the use of foreign technicians or foreign instructors of Ecuadorian technicians may only be authorised when this is necessary for the provision or improvement of an aeronautical service. Such authorisations will be granted by the Directorate-General for Civil Aviation for a period of no longer than six months, renewable for a similar period if the proven need for this persists. During these periods the contracted staff shall provide the appropriate training to the Ecuadorian staff who will replace them.\u00a0\n\n\n\n\n\n\nF. ROAD TRANSPORT SERVICES\n\n\n\n\nEcuador reserves the right to adopt or maintain any measure in relation to international land passenger or freight transport operations in border areas. \n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Passenger transportation\n\n\n(CPC 7121+7122)\n\n\nFreight Transportation\n\n\n(CPC 7123)\n\n\nExcept road cabotage transport\n\n\nc) Rental of commercial vehicles with operator (CPC\u00a07121+7122+7123+7124)\n\n\n\n\n. \n\n\n\n\n\n\n'\n\n\n\n\n\nTop  \n\n\n\n\n\n\nEUROPEAN COMMISSION\nBrussels, 4.4.2016\nCOM(2016) 173 final\nANNEX\nto the\nProposal for a Council Decision\non the signing, on behalf of the European Union, and provisional application of the Protocol of Accession to the Trade Agreement  between the European Union and its Member States, of the one part, and Colombia and Peru, of the other part, to take account of the Accession of Ecuador\n\n\n\n\n\n\nANNEX XV\n\n\n(Section B of Appendix 2 to Annex IX to the Agreement referred to in Articles 126 and 127 of the Agreement)\n\n\nRESERVATIONS REGARDING TEMPORARY PRESENCE OF\nNATURAL PERSONS FOR BUSINESS PURPOSES\n\n\nAPPENDIX 2\n\n\nRESERVATIONS ON CONTRACTUAL SERVICES SUPPLIERS\nAND INDEPENDENT PROFESSIONALS\n\n\n'SECTION\u00a0B\n\n\nEU PARTY\n\n\nThe following abbreviations are used:\n\n\nAT\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Austria\n\n\nBE\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Belgium\n\n\nBG\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Bulgaria\n\n\nCY\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Cyprus\n\n\nCZ\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Czech Republic\n\n\nDE\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Germany\n\n\nDK\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Denmark\n\n\nES\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Spain\n\n\nEE\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Estonia\n\n\nEU\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0European Union, including all its Member States\n\n\nFI\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Finland\n\n\n\n\nFR\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0France\n\n\nEL\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Greece\n\n\nHR\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Croatia\n\n\nHU\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Hungary\n\n\nIE\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Ireland\n\n\nIT\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Italy\n\n\nLV\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Latvia\n\n\nLT\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Lithuania\n\n\nLU\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Luxembourg\n\n\nMT\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Malta\n\n\nNL\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The Netherlands\n\n\nPL\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Poland\n\n\nPT\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Portugal\n\n\n\nRO\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Romania\n\n\nSK\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Slovak Republic\n\n\nSI\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Slovenia\n\n\nSE\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Sweden\n\n\nUK\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0United Kingdom\n\n\n1.The list of reservations below indicates the services sectors liberalised by the EU\u00a0Party pursuant to Articles 126, paragraphs 2 and 3 and 127, paragraphs 2 and 3 of this Agreement and the specific discriminatory limitations which apply thereto. \n\n\nThe lists are composed of the following elements:\n\n\n\n\n(a)a first column indicating the sector or sub-sector in which limitations apply; and\n\n\n(b)a second column describing the applicable limitations;\n\n\nWhen no specific limitations, other than those specified in Title IV of this Agreement, apply to both contractual service suppliers (hereinafter referred to as \"CSS\") and independent professionals (hereinafter referred to as \"IP\"), \"none\" is inscribed next to the relevant European Union Member State(s).\n\n\n2.In identifying individual sectors and sub-sectors, \"CPC\" means the Central Products Classification as set out in Statistical Office of the United Nations, Statistical Papers, Series\u00a0M, No 77, CPC prov, 1991.\n\n\n3.The list below does not include measures relating to qualification requirements and procedures, technical standards and licensing requirements and procedures, and measures regarding employment, work and social security conditions when they do not constitute a discriminatory limitation within the meaning of Articles 126 paragraphs2 and 3 and 127, paragraphs 2 and 3 of this Agreement. Those measures (e.g. need to obtain a license, need to obtain recognition of qualifications in regulated sectors, need to pass specific examinations, including language examinations, need to have a legal domicile where the activity is performed, need to comply with national regulations and practices concerning minimum wages and with collective wage agreements in the host country), even if not listed, apply in any case to CSS and IP of another Party.\n\n\n4.In accordance with Article 107 paragraph 3 of this Agreement, the list below does not include measures concerning subsidies granted by the Parties.\n\n\n5.All requirements of the laws and regulations of the European Union and of its Member States regarding entry, stay, work and social security measures shall continue to apply, including regulations concerning period of stay, minimum wages as well as collective wage agreements even if not listed below.\n\n\n6.The list below is without prejudice to the existence of public monopolies and exclusive rights as described in the list of commitments on establishment.\n\n\n7.In those sectors where economic needs tests are applied, their main criteria will be the assessment of the relevant market situation in the European Union Member State or the region where the service is to be provided, including with respect to the number of, and the impact on, existing services suppliers.\n\n\n8.The rights and obligations arising from this list of reservations shall have no self-executing effect and thus confer no rights directly to individual natural persons or juridical persons.\n\n\n9.Commitments on CSS and IP do not apply in cases where the intent or effect of their temporary presence is to interfere with or otherwise affect the outcome of any labour/management dispute or negotiation.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector or Sub-Sector\n\n\n\n\nDescription of Reservations\n\n\n\n\n\n\nALL SECTORS\n1\n\n\n\n\n\nTransitional periods\n\n\nBG, RO: Commitments shall enter into force with effect from 1 January 2014. \n\n\n\nAT, BE, DE, DK, EL, ES, FI, FR, IE, IT, LU, NL, PT, SE, UK: None.\n\n\n\nRecognition\n\n\n\nEU: European Union directives on mutual recognition of diplomas only apply to nationals of European Union Member States. The right to practise a regulated professional service in one European Union Member State does not grant the right to practise in another European Union Member State\n2\n.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nLegal Advisory Services in respect of public international law and foreign law (i.e. non- European Union law)\n\n\n(part of CPC 861)\n3\n\n\n\n\n\nAT, CY, DE, EE, IE, LU, NL, SE, UK: None. \n\n\nES, IT, HR, EL, PL: Economic needs test for IP.\n\n\nLV: Economic needs test for CSS.\n\n\nBE: Economic needs test, except for CSS when the annual wage is above the amount defined by the relevant laws and regulations.\n\n\nBG, CZ, DK, FI, HU, LT, MT, PT, RO, SI, SK: Economic needs tests. \n\n\nDK: Marketing of legal advice activities is restricted to lawyers with a Danish license to practice. Requirement of a Danish legal examination in order to obtain a Danish licence.\n\n\nFR: Full (simplified) admission to the Bar through an aptitude test is\u00a0required.\n\n\nHR: Full admition to the Bar required for legal representation services, is subject to national condition.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nAccounting and Bookkeeping Services\n\n\n(CPC 86212 other than \"auditing services\", CPC 86213, CPC 86219 and CPC 86220)\n\n\n\n\nCY, DE, EE, ES, HR, IE, IT, LU, NL, PL, SI, SE, UK: None. \n\n\nAT: The employer must be member of the relevant professional body in the home country where such body exists. \n\n\nBE: Economic needs test, except for CSS when the annual wage is above the amount defined by the relevant laws and regulations.\n\n\nFR: Authorisation requirement.\n\n\nBG, CZ, DK, EL, FI, HU, LT, LV, MT, PT, RO, SK: Economic needs test. \n\n\n\n\n\n\nTaxation Advisory Services\n\n\n(CPC 863)\n4\n\n\n\n\n\nCY, DE, EE, ES, FR, IE, IT, LU, NL, PL, SI, SE, UK: None.\n\n\nAT: The employer must be member of the relevant professional body in the home country where such body exists; nationality condition for representation before competent authorities.\n\n\nBE: Economic needs test, except for CSS when the annual wage is above the amount defined by the relevant laws and regulations.\n\n\nBG, CZ, DK, EL, FI, HU, LT, LV, MT, RO, SK: Economic needs test. \n\n\nPT: Unbound.\n\n\nHR, HU: Residence requirement.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nArchitectural services\n\n\nand\n\n\nUrban planning and landscape architectural services\n\n\n(CPC 8671 and CPC 8674)\n\n\n\n\nCY, EE, EL, FR, IE, LU, MT, NL, SI, SE, UK: None.\n\n\nES, HR, IT, PL: Economic needs test for IP.\n\n\nLV: Economic needs test for CSS.\n\n\nFI: The natural person must demonstrate that (s)he possesses special knowledge relevant to the service being supplied. \n\n\nBE: Economic needs test, except for CSS when the annual wage is above the amount defined by the relevant laws and regulations.\n\n\nDK: Economic needs test except for CSS stays of up to three months.\n\n\nBG, CZ, DE, FI, HU, LT, PT, RO, SK: Economic needs test. \n\n\nAT: Planning services only, where: Economic needs test.\n\n\nHR, HU: Residence requirement.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nEngineering services\n\n\nand\n\n\nIntegrated engineering services\n\n\n(CPC 8672 and CPC 8673)\n\n\n\n\nCY, EE, EL, FR, IE, LU, MT, NL, SI, SE, UK: None.\n\n\nES, HR, IT, PL, PT: Economic needs test for IP. \n\n\nLV: Economic needs test for CSS.\n\n\nFI: The natural person must demonstrate that (s)he possesses special knowledge relevant to the service being supplied. \n\n\nBE: Economic needs test, except for CSS when the annual wage is above the amount defined by the relevant laws and regulations.\n\n\nDK: Economic needs test except for CSS stays of up to three months. \n\n\nBG, CZ, DE, FI, HU, LT, RO, SK: Economic needs test.\n\n\nAT: Planning services only, where: Economic needs test.\n\n\nHR, HU: Residence requirement.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMedical (including psychologists) and dental services\n\n\n(CPC 9312 and part of CPC 85201) \n\n\n\n\nSE: None.\n\n\nCY, CZ, DE, DK, EE, ES\n5\n, IE, IT, LU, MT, NL, PL, RO, SI: Economic needs test. \n\n\nAT: Unbound except for psychologists and dental services, where: Economic needs test.\n\n\nBE, BG, EL, FI, FR, HU, LT, LV, PT, SK, UK: Unbound. \n\n\n\n\n\n\nVeterinary services\n\n\n(CPC 932)\n\n\n\n\nSE: None.\n\n\nBE, CY, CZ, DE, DK, EE, EL, ES\n6\n, FI, IE, IT, LT, LU, MT, NL, PL, RO, SI: Economic needs test. \n\n\nAT, BG, FR, HR, HU, LV, PT, SK, UK: Unbound. \n\n\n\n\n\n\nMidwives services\n\n\n(part of CPC 93191)\n\n\n\n\nSE: None.\n\n\nAT, CY, CZ, DE, DK, EE, EL, ES, IE, IT, LT, LV, LU, MT, NL, PL, RO, SI: Economic needs test.\n\n\nBE, BG, FI, FR, HU, PT, SK, UK: Unbound. IP.\n\n\nBE: Economic needs test, except for CSS when the annual wage is above the amount defined by the relevant laws and regulations.\n\n\nDK: Economic needs test except for CSS stays of up to three months. \n\n\nAT, BG, CZ, FI, LT, RO, SK: Economic needs test.\n\n\nHU: Economic needs test, except for arbitration and conciliation services (CPC 86602), where: Unbound.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMaintenance and repair of vessels\n\n\n(part of CPC 8868)\n\n\n\n\nCY, EE, EL, ES, FR, HR, IT, LV, LU, NL, PL, PT, SK, SI, SE: None\n\n\nBE: Economic needs test, except for CSS when the annual wage is above the amount defined by the relevant laws and regulations.\n\n\nAT, BG, CZ, DE, DK, FI, HU, IE, LT, MT, RO, UK (for Colombia only): Economic needs test. \n\n\nUK (for Ecuador only): Unbound.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMaintenance and repair of rail transport equipment\n\n\n(part of CPC 8868)\n\n\n\n\nCY, EE, EL, ES, FR, HR, IT, LV, LU, MT, NL, PL, PT, SI, SE, UK (for Colombia only): None.\n\n\nBE: Economic needs test, except for CSS when the annual wage is above the amount defined by the relevant laws and regulations.\n\n\nAT, BG, CZ, DE, DK, FI, HU, IE, LT, RO, SK: Economic needs test.\n\n\nUK (for Ecuador only): Unbound.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMaintenance and repair of motor vehicles, motorcycles, snowmobiles and road transport equipment\n\n\n(CPC 6112, CPC 6122, part of CPC 8867 and part of CPC 8868)\n\n\n\n\nCY, EE, EL, ES, FR, HR, IT, LV, LU, NL, PL, PT, SI, SE: None.\n\n\nBE: Economic needs test, except for CSS when the annual wage is above the amount defined by the relevant laws and regulations.\n\n\nAT, BG, CZ, DE, DK, FI, HU, IE, LT, MT, RO, SK: Economic needs test.\n\n\nUK (for Colombia only): Economic needs test for maintenance and repair of motor vehicles, motorcycles, snowmobiles (CPC 6112, CPC 6122, part of CPC 8867).\n\n\nUK (for Ecuador only): Unbound.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMaintenance and repair of aircraft and parts thereof\n\n\n(part of CPC 8868)\n\n\n\n\nCY, EE, EL, ES, FR, HR, IT, LV, LU, MT, NL, PL, PT, SI, SE, UK (for Colombia only): None.\n\n\nBE: Economic needs test, except for CSS when the annual wage is above the amount defined by the relevant laws and regulations.\n\n\nAT, BG, CZ, DE, DK, FI, HU, IE, LT, RO, SK: Economic needs test. \n\n\nUK (for Ecuador only): Unbound.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nMaintenance and repair of metal products, of (non office) machinery, of (non transport and non office) equipment and of personal and household goods \n7\n\n\n\n(CPC 633, CPC 7545, CPC 8861, CPC 8862, CPC 8864, CPC 8865 and CPC 8866)\n\n\n\n\nCY, EE, EL, ES, FR, HR, IT, LV, LU, MT, NL, PL, PT, SI, SE, UK: None.\n\n\nBE: Economic needs test, except for CSS when the annual wage is above the amount defined by the relevant laws and regulations.\n\n\nAT, BG, CZ, DE, DK, FI, HU, IE, LT, RO, SK: Economic needs test. \n\n\n\n\n\n\nDesign services\n\n\n\n\nAT, BE, BG, CY, CZ, DE, DK, EE, EL, FI, FR, HR, HU, IE, IT, LT, LU, LV, MT, NL, PL, PT, RO, SK, SE, SI, UK: Unbound.\n\n\nES: none for CSS, unbound for IP. \n\n\n\n\n\n\nChemical engineering, pharmaceutics, photochemistry\n\n\n\n\nAT, BE, BG, CY, CZ, DE, DK, EE, EL, FI, FR, HR, HU, IE, LT, LU, LV, MT, NL, PL, PT, RO, SK, SE, SI, UK: Unbound.\n\n\nES, IT: none for CSS, unbound for Impendent Professionals. \n\n\n\n\n\n\nServices in cosmetics technology\n\n\n\n\nAT, BE, BG, CY, CZ, DE, DK, EE, EL, FI, FR, HR, HU, IE, IT, LT, LU, LV, MT, NL, PL, PT, RO, SK, SE, SI, UK: Unbound.\n\n\nES: none for CSS, unbound for IP.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSpecialised services in technology, engineering, marketing and sales for the automotive sector\n\n\n\n\nAT, BE, BG, CY, CZ, ES, DE, DK, EE, EL, FI, FR, HR, HU, IE, LT, LU, LV, MT, NL, PL, PT, RO, SK, SE, SI, UK: Unbound.\n\n\nIT: none for CSS, Economic needs test for IP.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nCommercial design services and marketing for the fashion textile industry, garments, footwear and articles\n\n\n\n\nAT, BE, BG, CY, CZ, DE, DK, EE, EL, FI, FR, HR, HU, IE, IT, LT, LU, LV, MT, NL, PL, PT, RO, SK, SE, SI, UK: Unbound.\n\n\nES: none for CSS, unbound for IP. \n\n\n\n\n\n\nTranslation and Interpretation Services\n\n\n(CPC 87905, excluding official or certified activities)\n\n\n\n\nCY, EE, FR, LU, LV, MT, NL, PT, SI, SE, UK: None.\n\n\nAT, BE, BG, CZ, DE, DK, ES, EL, FI, HU, IE, IT, LT, PL, RO, SK: Economic needs test.\n\n\nHR: Unbound for IP.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(1)\nNote for transparency for BE: where applicable, the referred to annual wage amount is currently set at\u00a033,677 euro (March 2007).\n\n\n\n(2)\nIn order for third-country nationals to obtain European Union-wide recognition of their qualifications, it is necessary a Mutual Recognition Agreement negotiated within the framework defined in Article 129 of this Agreement.\n\n\n\n(3)\nProvision of these services, like the provision of other services, is subject to licensing requirements and procedures applicable in the European Union Member States. These may take inter alia the form of compliance with local codes of ethics, use of home title (unless recognition with the host title has been obtained) insurance requirements, simple registration with the host country Bar or a simplified admission to the host country Bar through an aptitude test and a legal or professional domicile in the host country.\n\n\n\n(4)\nDoes not include legal advisory and legal representational services on tax matters, which are to be found under Legal Advisory Services in respect of public international law and foreign law.\n\n\n\n(5)\nFor medical (including psychologists) and dental services (CPC 9312 and part of CPC 85201) and as concerns Spain only, the economic needs test requirement does not apply to Colombia. \n\n\n\n(6)\nFor veterinary services (CPC 932) and as concerns Spain only, the economic needs test requirement does not apply to Colombia. \n\n\n\n(7)\nMaintenance and repair services of office machinery and equipment including computers (CPC 845) are to be found under Computer services.\n\n\n\n\n\nTop  \n\n\n\n\n\n\nEUROPEAN COMMISSION\nBrussels, 4.4.2016\nCOM(2016) 173 final\nANNEX\nto the\nProposal for a Council Decision\non the signing, on behalf of the European Union, and provisional application of the Protocol of Accession to the Trade Agreement  between the European Union and its Member States, of the one part, and Colombia and Peru, of the other part, to take account of the Accession of Ecuador\n\n\n\n\n\n\nANNEX XVI to XVII\n\n\nANNEX XVI\n\n\n(New Section D of Appendix 2 to Annex IX to the Agreement referred to in Article 126 and 127 of the Agreement)\n\n\nRESERVATIONS REGARDING TEMPORARY PRESENCE OF\nNATURAL PERSONS FOR BUSINESS PURPOSES\n\n\nAPPENDIX 2\n\n\nRESERVATIONS ON CONTRACTUAL SERVICES SUPPLIERS\nAND INDEPENDENT PROFESSIONALS\n\n\n'SECTION\u00a0D\n\n\nECUADOR\n\n\nThis Schedule of Commitments is consistent with the constitutional and legal provisions governing the temporary presence in Ecuador of persons for business purposes and their compatibility with the undertakings made at multilateral level.\n\n\nFor the preparation of this offer, account was taken of the United Nations Statistics Division's Central Products Classification, Statistical Reports, Series M, No. 77, provisional, 1991, for the offer relating to cross-border trade in services.\n\n\nThe list of reservations below indicates the economic activities liberalised pursuant to Articles 126, paragraphs 2 and 3 and 127, paragraphs 2 and 3 of this Agreement and the specific discriminatory limitations which apply thereto. Ecuador does not undertake any commitment for contractual service providers and professionals whose activities are not liberalised pursuant to Articles 126 and 127 of this Agreement.\n\n\nFor methodological revision and analysis purposes, the list below is presented as follows:\n\n\n\u2013The sectors of services out of which the sectors affected by restrictions in this offer are described are shown on the left-hand side headed \u201cSector or sub-sector\u201d.\n\n\n\u2013To complement the list, the right-hand column includes the restrictions or limitations affecting the corresponding sector or sub-sector.\n\n\n\u2013Commitments in specific sectors or sub-sectors are subject to the horizontal reservations and limitations included in the first section, which apply across the board and unconditionally to the categories of Contractual Service Providers and Independent Professionals.\n\n\nIn accordance with the provisions included in Article 107(7) relating to the scope of the rules in the Title on Trade in Services, Establishment and Electronic Commerce, no measures are listed that relate to regulation of the entry of natural persons into, or their temporary stay in, Ecuadorian territory, including those measures adopted or maintained by Ecuador as necessary to protect the integrity of, and to ensure the orderly movement of natural persons across, its borders.\n\n\nThe list below does not include measures related to requirements and procedures concerning qualifications, technical standards and requirements concerning degrees, and procedures related to employment, work and social security conditions. Such measures, which include but are not limited to: the need to obtain a licence, the need to obtain recognition of qualifications in regulated sectors, the need to pass specific examinations, including language examinations, the need to have a legal domicile in the territory where the economic activity is performed, the need to comply with national regulations and practices concerning minimum wages and with collective wage agreements in the host country, even if not listed, apply in any case to Contractual Service Providers and Independent Professionals.\n\n\nThe rights and obligations derived from this schedule of commitments are not directly applicable and effective and thus do not confer directly enforceable rights on natural or legal persons.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSector or sub-sector\n\n\n\n\nDescription of reservations\n\n\n\n\n\n\nHORIZONTAL COMMITMENTS\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nALL SECTORS \n\n\n\n\nThe recognition of academic degrees or certificates issued by foreign higher education bodies may be subject to bilateral agreements providing for reciprocity. If the higher education body does not appear on the list approved by the competent body and is not established in countries with which reciprocal agreements have been signed, an application for registration is required.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n1. BUSINESS SERVICES\n\n\n\n\nFor registration in associations or guilds for the purpose of exercising a profession, different rates may apply to Ecuadorians and to foreign nationals.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nA. Professional Services\n\n\n\n\nFor the purposes of exercising most professional services in Ecuador, professional qualifications obtained abroad must be recognised by the national competent authority, which generally requires residence in Ecuador before it can grant such recognition. \n\n\n\n\n\n\na) Legal services (CPC 861) Only advisory services on foreign legislation and international law (excluding advisory services and representation in court cases under national law)\n\n\n\n\n\nForeign lawyers may exercise their profession, provided their qualification is recognised in the country under the conditions laid down by law and in observance of the principle of reciprocity. It must be clarified that membership of the \"Foro del Consejo de la Judicatura\" (Judiciary Council Association) does not constitute a requirement for the provision of liberalised legal services. However, foreign lawyers who apply for admission to the cited Association shall be required to perform one year of pre-professional practice. \n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nb) Accounting, auditing and bookkeeping services\n\n\n(CPC 862)\n\n\n\n\nNone\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nd) Architectural services\n\n\n(CPC 8671 and 8674)\n\n\n\n\nIn order for a foreign architect who qualified abroad to be able to obtain a permanent licence from the College of Architects of Ecuador to exercise the profession in the country, the following are required:\n\n\na) Submission to the National Register of a properly reasoned application for authorisation;\n\n\nb) Verification that Ecuadorian architects can practise with no restrictions in the applicant's country of origin.\n\n\nc) Verification that the applicant is present in the country legally, and more specifically verification of his/her immigrant status, in the light of the relevant legislation.\n\n\nd) Presentation of an academic qualification duly ratified in Ecuador; and\n\n\ne) Verification of the applicant's worthiness and solvency to exercise the activities proposed, with a certificate from the college or society of architects in his/her country of origin.\n\n\n\n\n\n\ne) Engineering services (CPC 8672)\n\n\nf) Integrated Engineering Services (CPC 8673)\n\n\n\n\n\nNational or foreign enterprises, and consortia of national and/or foreign enterprises formed for the performance of engineering works shall be obliged to have, for the performance of that work, a staff of engineers employed on the Project, not less than 80% of the total of which must be Ecuadorian engineers, until the tenth year of their establishment in the country: from the eleventh year onwards they must increase the percentage of Ecuadorian professionals by 4% per year until it reaches 90%. In the event that there are no national professionals specialised in the tasks performed by the said enterprises or consortia, they shall be obliged to employ them to train them in the relevant field of specialisation.\n\n\nForeign civil engineers recruited on a temporary basis by State enterprises or institutions may only perform advisory, supervisory and training tasks.\n\n\nForeign engineers with a temporary licence may only sign documents related to the advisory, supervisory or training tasks for which they were recruited.\n\n\nForeign professionals in the field of engineering must meet the following requirements to be able to exercise their profession in the country:\n\n\na) Ratification of their qualification in any of the country's Higher Education Institutions recognised by the Higher Education Act;\n\n\nb) Presentation of the corresponding immigrants' visa in the country; and \n\n\nc) Professional licence obtained from the Ecuadorian Society of Engineers in accordance with the relevant Regulation.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nC. RESEARCH AND DEVELOPMENT SERVICES\u00a0(85)\n\n\n\n\nIn public procurement processes, foreign consultants, whether natural or legal persons, may only participate in those activities or areas where there is no technical capacity or experience among national consultants. An exception is made for consultancy contracts totally or partially funded with resources from loans granted by foreign governments or multilateral development organisations of which Ecuador is a member.\n\n\n\n\n\n\nF. OTHER BUSINESS SERVICES\n\n\n\n\nFor the purposes of exercising most professional services in Ecuador, professional qualifications obtained abroad must be recognised by the national competent authority, which generally requires residence in Ecuador at the time of the corresponding request before it can grant such recognition. \n\n\n\n\n\n\nm) Related scientific and technical consulting services (CPC 8675)\n\n\n\n\n\nIn public procurement processes, foreign consultants, whether natural or legal persons, may only participate in those activities or areas where there is no technical capacity or experience among national consultants. An exception is made for consultancy contracts totally or partially funded with resources from loans granted by foreign governments or multilateral development organisations of which Ecuador is a member.\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n'\n\n\nANNEX XVII\n\n\n(New Annex XI.a to the Agreement)\n\n\n'ANNEX XI.a (\n1\n)\n\n\nUnderstanding related to subparagraph (b) of the definition of 'services provided in the exercise of governmental authority' laid down in Article 152 of this Agreement\n\n\n1.The Parties understand that Title IV (Trade in Services, Establishment and Electronic Commerce) of this Agreement applies to the measures adopted or maintained by a Party relating to activities and services described in subparagraph (b) of the definition of \u2018services supplied in the exercise of governmental authority\u2019 as referred to in Article 152 of this Agreement, only to the extent that a Party allows its financial service suppliers to supply such activities and services in competition with a public entity or a financial service supplier. The Parties furthermore understand that Title IV of this Agreement does not apply to such measures to the extent that a Party reserves such activities and services to the government, a public entity, or a financial service supplier and they are not supplied in competition with another financial service supplier. \n\n\n2.Accordingly, the Parties recognise that each one may designate, formally or in effect, a monopoly, including a financial service supplier, to supply some or all of the activities or services included in the cited subparagraph (b), and that such a measure shall not be deemed incompatible with the obligations and commitments undertaken by the Parties in Title IV to this Agreement.'\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(1)\nThis Annex applies only between the EU Party and Ecuador.\n\n\n\n\n\nTop of the Protocol of Accession to the Trade Agreement  between the European Union and its Member States, of the one part, and Colombia and Peru, of the other part, to take account of the Accession of Ecuador\n\n\n\n\n\n\nANNEX XVIII\n\n\n(Section B of Appendix 1 to Annex XII to the Agreement)\n\n\n'SECTION B\n\n\nEU PARTY\n\n\nSUBSECTION 1\n\n\nCENTRAL GOVERNMENT ENTITIES \n\n\n\n\nTitle VI of \u0430\u0434\u043c\u0438\u043d\u0438\u0441\u0442\u0440\u0430\u0442\u0438\u0432\u043d\u0430\u0442\u0430 \u0440\u0435\u0444\u043e\u0440\u043c\u0430\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u041c\u0438\u043d\u0438\u0441\u0442\u0435\u0440\u0441\u0442\u0432\u043e \u043d\u0430 \u0444\u0438\u043d\u0430\u043d\u0441\u0438\u0442\u0435\n\n\n\nState agencies, State commissions, executive agencies and other State authorities established by law or by decree of the Council of \u0437\u0430 \u0445\u043e\u0440\u0430\u0442\u0430 \u0441 \u0443\u0432\u0440\u0435\u0436\u0434\u0430\u043d\u0438\u044f\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0410\u0433\u0435\u043d\u0446\u0438\u044f \u0433\u0435\u043e\u0434\u0435\u0437\u0438\u044f, \u043a\u0430\u0440\u0442\u043e\u0433\u0440\u0430\u0444\u0438\u044f \u0438 \u043a\u0430\u0434\u0430\u0441\u0442\u044a\u0440\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0410\u0433\u0435\u043d\u0446\u0438\u044f \u043f\u043e \u0435\u043d\u0435\u0440\u0433\u0438\u0439\u043d\u0430 \u0435\u0444\u0435\u043a\u0442\u0438\u0432\u043d\u043e\u0441\u0442\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0410\u0433\u0435\u043d\u0446\u0438\u044f \u043f\u043e \u0437\u0430\u0435\u0442\u043e\u0441\u0442\u0442\u0430\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0410\u0433\u0435\u043d\u0446\u0438\u044f \u043f\u043e \u043e\u0431\u0449\u0435\u0441\u0442\u0432\u0435\u043d\u0438 \u043f\u043e\u0440\u044a\u0447\u043a\u0438\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0411\u044a\u043b\u0433\u0430\u0440\u0441\u043a\u0430 \u0430\u0434\u043c\u0438\u043d\u0438\u0441\u0442\u0440\u0430\u0446\u0438\u044f\"\n\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0414\u0438\u0440\u0435\u043a\u0446\u0438\u044f \"\u041c\u0430\u0442\u0435\u0440\u0438\u0430\u043b\u043d\u043e-\u0442\u0435\u0445\u043d\u0438\u0447\u0435\u0441\u043a\u043e \u043e\u0441\u0438\u0433\u0443\u0440\u044f\u0432\u0430\u043d\u0435 \u0438 \u0441\u043e\u0446\u0438\u0430\u043b\u043d\u043e \u043e\u0431\u0441\u043b\u0443\u0436\u0432\u0430\u043d\u0435\" \u043d\u0430 \u041c\u0438\u043d\u0438\u0441\u0442\u0435\u0440\u0441\u0442\u0432\u043e \"\u041e\u043f\u0435\u0440\u0430\u0442\u0438\u0432\u043d\u043e \u0438\u0437\u0434\u0438\u0440\u0432\u0430\u043d\u0435\" \u043d\u0430 \"\u041f\u043e\u043b\u0438\u0446\u0438\u044f\"\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u041d\u0430\u0446\u0438\u043e\u043d\u0430\u043b\u043d\u0430 \u0441\u043b\u0443\u0436\u0431\u0430 \u0394\u03b9\u03bf\u03af\u03ba\u03b7\u03c3\u03b7\u03c2 \u03ba\u03b1\u03b9 \u03a0\u03c1\u03bf\u03c3\u03c9\u03c0\u03b9\u03ba\u03bf\u03cd\n\n\n\u2013\u039a\u03c5\u03b2\u03b5\u03c1\u03bd\u03b7\u03c4\u03b9\u03ba\u03cc \u03a4\u03c5\u03c0\u03bf\u03b3\u03c1\u03b1\u03c6\u03b5\u03af\u03bf\n\n\n\u2013\u03a4\u03bc\u03ae\u03bc\u03b1 \u03a5\u03c0\u03b7\u03c1\u03b5\u03c3\u03b9\u03ce\u03bd \u03a0\u03bb\u03b7\u03c1\u03bf\u03c6\u03bf\u03c1\u03b9\u03ba\u03ae\u03c2\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u03a5\u03c0\u03bf\u03c5\u03c1\u03b3\u03b5\u03af\u03bf \u03a0\u03b1\u03b9\u03b4\u03b5\u03af\u03b1\u03c2 \u03ba\u03b1\u03b9 \u03a0\u03bf\u03bb\u03b9\u03c4\u03b9\u03c3\u03bc\u03bf\u03cd\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u03a5\u03c0\u03bf\u03c5\u03c1\u03b3\u03b5\u03af\u03bf \u03a3\u03c5\u03b3\u03ba\u03bf\u03b9\u03bd\u03c9\u03bd\u03b9\u03ce\u03bd \u03ba\u03b1\u03b9 \u0388\u03c1\u03b3\u03c9\u03bd\n\n\n\u2013\u03a4\u03bc\u03ae\u03bc\u03b1 \u0394\u03b7\u03bc\u03bf\u03c3\u03af\u03c9\u03bd \u0388\u03c1\u03b3\u03c9\u03bd\n\n\n\u2013\u03a4\u03bc\u03ae\u03bc\u03b1 \u0391\u03c1\u03c7\u03b1\u03b9\u03bf\u03c4\u03ae\u03c4\u03c9\u03bd\n\n\n\u2013\u03a4\u03bc\u03ae\u03bc\u03b1 \u03a0\u03bf\u03bb\u03b9\u03c4\u03b9\u03ba\u03ae\u03c2 \u0391\u03b5\u03c1\u03bf\u03c0\u03bf\u03c1\u03af\u03b1\u03c2\n\n\n\u2013\u03a4\u03bc\u03ae\u03bc\u03b1 \u0395\u03bc\u03c0\u03bf\u03c1\u03b9\u03ba\u03ae\u03c2 \u039c\u03b5\u03c4\u03b1\u03c6\u03bf\u03c1\u03ce\u03bd\n\n\n\u2013\u03a4\u03bc\u03ae\u03bc\u03b1 \u0397\u03bb\u03b5\u03ba\u03c4\u03c1\u03bf\u03bc\u03b7\u03c7\u03b1\u03bd\u03bf\u03bb\u03bf\u03b3\u03b9\u03ba\u03ce\u03bd \u03a5\u03b3\u03b5\u03af\u03b1\u03c2\n\n\n\nLatvia\n\n\n\n(1)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Ministries, Secretariats of Ministries for special assignments, and their subordinate institutions:\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Aizsardz\u012bbas ministrija un t\u0101s padot\u012bb\u0101 eso\u0161\u0101s iest\u0101des\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0100rlietu ministrija un t\u0101s padot\u012bb\u0101 eso\u0161\u0101s iest\u0101des\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0B\u0113rnu un \u0123imenes lietu ministrija un t\u0101s padot\u012bb\u0101 eso\u0161\u0101s padot\u012bb\u0101 eso\u0161\u0101s iest\u0101des\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Iek\u0161lietu ministrija un t\u0101s padot\u012bb\u0101 eso\u0161\u0101s ministrija un t\u0101s padot\u012bb\u0101 eso\u0161\u0101s iest\u0101des\n\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Labkl\u0101j\u012bbas ministrija un t\u0101s padot\u012bb\u0101 eso\u0161\u0101s 96:\n\n\n\n\nBrooms, brushes, powder-puffs and sieves\n\n\n\n\n\n\nChapter 98:\n\n\n\n\nMiscellaneous manufactured articles\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSUBSECTION 2\n\n\n\nSUBCENTRAL GOVERNMENT ENTITIES\n\n\n\nTitle VI of this Agreement shall apply to the sub-central government entities referred to in this Subsection as regards the procurement of goods, services and construction services indicated below, when the value of the procurement has been estimated, in accordance with Article 173, paragraphs\u00a06 to 8, of this Agreement, as equal to or higher than the corresponding thresholds below:\n\n\n\nGoods:\n\n\nSpecified in Subsection 4\n\n\nThreshold\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0SDR 200 000 \n\n\n\n\n\n\nServices:\n\n\nSpecified in Subsection 5\n\n\nThreshold\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0SDR 200 000 \n\n\n\nConstruction services:\n\n\nSpecified in Subsection 6\n\n\nThreshold\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0SDR 5 000 000\n\n\n\nProcuring Entities: \n\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0All regional contracting entities\n\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0All local contracting entities\n\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0All contracting entities which are bodies governed by public law as defined by European Union Procurement Directives \n\n\n\nNote to this Subsection:\n\n\n\nA \"body governed by public law\" means a body:\n\n\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0established for the specific purpose of meeting needs in the general interest, not having an industrial or commercial character, \n\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0having legal personality, and\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0financed, for the most part, by the State, or regional or local authorities, or other bodies governed by public law, or subject to management supervision by those bodies or, having an administrative, managerial or supervisory board more than half of whose members are appointed by the State, regional or local authorities or by other bodies governed by public\u00a0law.\n\n\n\nAn indicative list of contracting authorities which are bodies governed by public law is included. \n\n\n\nINDICATIVE LISTS OF CONTRACTING AUTHORITIES WHICH ARE BODIES GOVERNED BY PUBLIC LAW AS DEFINED BY THE EUROPEAN UNION PROCUREMENT DIRECTIVES\n\n\n\nBelgium\n\n\n\nBodies:\n\n\n\nA\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Agence f\u00e9d\u00e9rale pour l'Accueil des demandeurs d'Asile \u2014 Federaal Agentschap voor Opvang van \"\u0416\u0435\u043b\u0435\u0437\u043e\u043f\u044a\u0442\u043d\u0430 \u0438\u043d\u0444\u0440\u0430\u0441\u0442\u0440\u0443\u043a\u0442\u0443\u0440\u0430\"\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0414\u041f \"\u041f\u0440\u0438\u0441\u0442\u0430\u043d\u0438\u0449\u043d\u0430 \u0438\u043d\u0444\u0440\u0430\u0441\u0442\u0440\u0443\u043a\u0442\u0443\u0440\u0430\"\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0414\u041f \u0432\u044a\u0437\u0441\u0442\u0430\u043d\u043e\u0432\u044f\u0432\u0430\u043d\u0435\"\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0414\u041f \"\u0422\u0440\u0430\u043d\u0441\u043f\u043e\u0440\u0442\u043d\u043e \u0441\u0442\u0440\u043e\u0438\u0442\u0435\u043b\u0441\u0442\u0432\u043e \u0438 \u0432\u044a\u0437\u0441\u0442\u0430\u043d\u043e\u0432\u044f\u0432\u0430\u043d\u0435\"\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0414\u041f \"\u0421\u044a\u043e\u0431\u0449\u0438\u0442\u0435\u043b\u043d\u043e \u0441\u0442\u0440\u043e\u0438\u0442\u0435\u043b\u0441\u0442\u0432\u043e \u0438 \u0432\u044a\u0437\u0441\u0442\u0430\u043d\u043e\u0432\u044f\u0432\u0430\u043d\u0435\"\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0414\u041f \"\u0420\u0430\u0434\u0438\u043e\u0430\u043a\u0442\u0438\u0432\u043d\u0438 \u043e\u0442\u043f\u0430\u0434\u044a\u0446\u0438\"\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0414\u041f \"\u041f\u0440\u0435\u0434\u043f\u0440\u0438\u044f\u0442\u0438\u0435 \u0437\u0430 \u0443\u043f\u0440\u0430\u0432\u043b\u0435\u043d\u0438\u0435 \u043d\u0430 \u0434\u0435\u0439\u043d\u043e\u0441\u0442\u0438\u0442\u0435 \u043f\u043e \u043e\u043f\u0430\u0437\u0432\u0430\u043d\u0435 \u043d\u0430 \u043e\u043a\u043e\u043b\u043d\u0430\u0442\u0430 \u0441\u0440\u0435\u0434\u0430\"\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0414\u041f \"\u0411\u044a\u043b\u0433\u0430\u0440\u0441\u043a\u0438 \u0441\u043f\u043e\u0440\u0442\u0435\u043d \u0442\u043e\u0442\u0430\u043b\u0438\u0437\u0430\u0442\u043e\u0440\"\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0414\u041f \"\u0414\u044a\u0440\u0436\u0430\u0432\u043d\u0430 \u043f\u0430\u0440\u0438\u0447\u043d\u043e-\u043f\u0440\u0435\u0434\u043c\u0435\u0442\u043d\u0430 \u043b\u043e\u0442\u0430\u0440\u0438\u044f\"\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0414\u041f \"\u041a\u0430\u0431\u0438\u044e\u043a\", \u0428\u0443\u043c\u0435\u043d\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0414\u041f \"\u0424\u043e\u043d\u0434 \u0437\u0430\u0442\u0432\u043e\u0440\u043d\u043e \u0434\u0435\u043b\u043e\"\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0414\u044a\u0440\u0436\u0430\u0432\u043d\u0438 \u0434\u0438\u0432\u0435\u0447\u043e\u0432\u044a\u0434\u043d\u0438 \u0441\u0442\u0430\u043d\u0446\u0438\u0438\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nState\u00a0Universities, established\u00a0pursuant\u00a0to\u00a0Article 13 of\u00a0the\u00a0\u0417\u0430\u043a\u043e\u043d\u0430 \u0437\u0430 \u0432\u0438\u0441\u0448\u0435\u0442\u043e \u043e\u0431\u0440\u0430\u0437\u043e\u0432\u0430\u043d\u0438\u0435 (\u043e\u0431\u043d., \u0414\u0412, \u0431\u0440.112/27.12.1995):\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0410\u0433\u0440\u0430\u0440\u0435\u043d \u0443\u043d\u0438\u0432\u0435\u0440\u0441\u0438\u0442\u0435\u0442 \u2013 \u041f\u043b\u043e\u0432\u0434\u0438\u0432\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0410\u043a\u0430\u0434\u0435\u043c\u0438\u044f \u0437\u0430 \u043c\u0443\u0437\u0438\u043a\u0430\u043b\u043d\u043e, \u0442\u0430\u043d\u0446\u043e\u0432\u043e \u0438 \u0438\u0437\u043e\u0431\u0440\u0430\u0437\u0438\u0442\u0435\u043b\u043d\u043e \u0438\u0437\u043a\u0443\u0441\u0442\u0432\u043e \u2013 \u041f\u043b\u043e\u0432\u0434\u0438\u0432\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0410\u043a\u0430\u0434\u0435\u043c\u0438\u044f \u043d\u0430 \u041c\u0438\u043d\u0438\u0441\u0442\u0435\u0440\u0441\u0442\u0432\u043e\u0442\u043e \u043d\u0430 \u0432\u044a\u0442\u0440\u0435\u0448\u043d\u0438\u0442\u0435 \u0440\u0430\u0431\u043e\u0442\u0438\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0412\u0435\u043b\u0438\u043a\u043e\u0442\u044a\u0440\u043d\u043e\u0432\u0441\u043a\u0438 \u0443\u043d\u0438\u0432\u0435\u0440\u0441\u0438\u0442\u0435\u0442 \"\u0421\u0432. \u0441\u0432. \u041a\u0438\u0440\u0438\u043b \u0438 \u041c\u0435\u0442\u043e\u0434\u0438\u0439\"\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0412\u0438\u0441\u0448\u0435 \u0432\u043e\u0435\u043d\u043d\u043e\u043c\u043e\u0440\u0441\u043a\u043e \u0443\u0447\u0438\u043b\u0438\u0449\u0435 \"\u041d. \u0419. \u0412\u0430\u043f\u0446\u0430\u0440\u043e\u0432\" \u2013 \u0412\u0430\u0440\u043d\u0430\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0412\u0438\u0441\u0448\u0435 \u0441\u0442\u0440\u043e\u0438\u0442\u0435\u043b\u043d\u043e \u0443\u0447\u0438\u043b\u0438\u0449\u0435 \"\u041b\u044e\u0431\u0435\u043d \u041a\u0430\u0440\u0430\u0432\u0435\u043b\u043e\u0432\" \u2013 \u0421\u043e\u0444\u0438\u044f\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0412\u0438\u0441\u0448\u0435 \u0442\u0440\u0430\u043d\u0441\u043f\u043e\u0440\u0442\u043d\u043e \u0443\u0447\u0438\u043b\u0438\u0449\u0435 \"\u0422\u043e\u0434\u043e\u0440 \u041a\u0430\u0431\u043b\u0435\u0448\u043a\u043e\u0432\" \u2013 \u0421\u043e\u0444\u0438\u044f\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0412\u043e\u0435\u043d\u043d\u0430 \u0430\u043a\u0430\u0434\u0435\u043c\u0438\u044f \"\u0413. \u0421. \u0420\u0430\u043a\u043e\u0432\u0441\u043a\u0438\" \u2013 \u0421\u043e\u0444\u0438\u044f\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u041d\u0430\u0446\u0438\u043e\u043d\u0430\u043b\u043d\u0430 \u043c\u0443\u0437\u0438\u043a\u0430\u043b\u043d\u0430 \u0430\u043a\u0430\u0434\u0435\u043c\u0438\u044f \"\u041f\u0440\u043e\u0444. \u041f\u0430\u043d\u0447\u043e \u0412\u043b\u0430\u0434\u0438\u0433\u0435\u0440\u043e\u0432\" \u2013 \u0421\u043e\u0444\u0438\u044f\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0418\u043a\u043e\u043d\u043e\u043c\u0438\u0447\u0435\u0441\u043a\u0438 \u0443\u043d\u0438\u0432\u0435\u0440\u0441\u0438\u0442\u0435\u0442 \u2013 \u0412\u0430\u0440\u043d\u0430\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u041a\u043e\u043b\u0435\u0436 \u043f\u043e \u0442\u0435\u043b\u0435\u043a\u043e\u043c\u0443\u043d\u0438\u043a\u0430\u0446\u0438\u0438 \u0438 \u043f\u043e\u0449\u0438 \u2013 \u0421\u043e\u0444\u0438\u044f\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u041b\u0435\u0441\u043e\u0442\u0435\u0445\u043d\u0438\u0447\u0435\u0441\u043a\u0438 \u0443\u043d\u0438\u0432\u0435\u0440\u0441\u0438\u0442\u0435\u0442 - \u0421\u043e\u0444\u0438\u044f\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u041c\u0435\u0434\u0438\u0446\u0438\u043d\u0441\u043a\u0438 \u0443\u043d\u0438\u0432\u0435\u0440\u0441\u0438\u0442\u0435\u0442 \"\u041f\u0440\u043e\u0444. \u0434-\u0440 \u041f\u0430\u0440\u0430\u0441\u043a\u0435\u0432 \u0418\u0432\u0430\u043d\u043e\u0432 \u0421\u0442\u043e\u044f\u043d\u043e\u0432\" \u2013 \u0412\u0430\u0440\u043d\u0430\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u041c\u0435\u0434\u0438\u0446\u0438\u043d\u0441\u043a\u0438 \u0443\u043d\u0438\u0432\u0435\u0440\u0441\u0438\u0442\u0435\u0442 \u2013 \u041f\u043b\u0435\u0432\u0435\u043d\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u041c\u0435\u0434\u0438\u0446\u0438\u043d\u0441\u043a\u0438 \u0443\u043d\u0438\u0432\u0435\u0440\u0441\u0438\u0442\u0435\u0442 \u2013 \u041f\u043b\u043e\u0432\u0434\u0438\u0432\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u041c\u0435\u0434\u0438\u0446\u0438\u043d\u0441\u043a\u0438 \u0443\u043d\u0438\u0432\u0435\u0440\u0441\u0438\u0442\u0435\u0442 \u2013 \u0421\u043e\u0444\u0438\u044f\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u041c\u0438\u043d\u043d\u043e-\u0433\u0435\u043e\u043b\u043e\u0436\u043a\u0438 \u0443\u043d\u0438\u0432\u0435\u0440\u0441\u0438\u0442\u0435\u0442 \"\u0421\u0432. \u0418\u0432\u0430\u043d \u0420\u0438\u043b\u0441\u043a\u0438\" \u2013 \u0421\u043e\u0444\u0438\u044f\n\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u041d\u0430\u0446\u0438\u043e\u043d\u0430\u043b\u0435\u043d \u0432\u043e\u0435\u043d\u0435\u043d \u0443\u043d\u0438\u0432\u0435\u0440\u0441\u0438\u0442\u0435\u0442 \"\u0412\u0430\u0441\u0438\u043b \u041b\u0435\u0432\u0441\u043a\u0438\" \u2013 \u0412\u0435\u043b\u0438\u043a\u043e \u0422\u044a\u0440\u043d\u043e\u0432\u043e\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u041d\u0430\u0446\u0438\u043e\u043d\u0430\u043b\u043d\u0430 \u0430\u043a\u0430\u0434\u0435\u043c\u0438\u044f \u0437\u0430 \u0442\u0435\u0430\u0442\u0440\u0430\u043b\u043d\u043e \u0438 \u0444\u0438\u043b\u043c\u043e\u0432\u043e \u0438\u0437\u043a\u0443\u0441\u0442\u0432\u043e \"\u041a\u0440\u044a\u0441\u0442\u044c\u043e \u0421\u0430\u0440\u0430\u0444\u043e\u0432\" \u2013 \u0421\u043e\u0444\u0438\u044f \n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u041d\u0430\u0446\u0438\u043e\u043d\u0430\u043b\u043d\u0430 \u0441\u043f\u043e\u0440\u0442\u043d\u0430 \u0430\u043a\u0430\u0434\u0435\u043c\u0438\u044f \"\u0412\u0430\u0441\u0438\u043b \u041b\u0435\u0432\u0441\u043a\u0438\" \u2013 \u0421\u043e\u0444\u0438\u044f\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u041d\u0430\u0446\u0438\u043e\u043d\u0430\u043b\u043d\u0430 \u0445\u0443\u0434\u043e\u0436\u0435\u0441\u0442\u0432\u0435\u043d\u0430 \u0430\u043a\u0430\u0434\u0435\u043c\u0438\u044f \u2013 \u0421\u043e\u0444\u0438\u044f\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u041f\u043b\u043e\u0432\u0434\u0438\u0432\u0441\u043a\u0438 \u0443\u043d\u0438\u0432\u0435\u0440\u0441\u0438\u0442\u0435\u0442 \"\u041f\u0430\u0438\u0441\u0438\u0439 \u0425\u0438\u043b\u0435\u043d\u0434\u0430\u0440\u0441\u043a\u0438\"\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0420\u0443\u0441\u0435\u043d\u0441\u043a\u0438 \u0443\u043d\u0438\u0432\u0435\u0440\u0441\u0438\u0442\u0435\u0442 \"\u0410\u043d\u0433\u0435\u043b \u041a\u044a\u043d\u0447\u0435\u0432\"\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0421\u043e\u0444\u0438\u0439\u0441\u043a\u0438 \u0443\u043d\u0438\u0432\u0435\u0440\u0441\u0438\u0442\u0435\u0442 \"\u0421\u0432. \u041a\u043b\u0438\u043c\u0435\u043d\u0442 \u041e\u0445\u0440\u0438\u0434\u0441\u043a\u0438\"\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0421\u043f\u0435\u0446\u0438\u0430\u043b\u0438\u0437\u0438\u0440\u0430\u043d\u043e \u0432\u0438\u0441\u0448\u0435 \u0443\u0447\u0438\u043b\u0438\u0449\u0435 \u043f\u043e \u0431\u0438\u0431\u043b\u0438\u043e\u0442\u0435\u043a\u043e\u0437\u043d\u0430\u043d\u0438\u0435 \u0438 \u0438\u043d\u0444\u043e\u0440\u043c\u0430\u0446\u0438\u043e\u043d\u043d\u0438 \u0442\u0435\u0445\u043d\u043e\u043b\u043e\u0433\u0438\u0438 \u2013 \u0421\u043e\u0444\u0438\u044f\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0421\u0442\u043e\u043f\u0430\u043d\u0441\u043a\u0430 \u0430\u043a\u0430\u0434\u0435\u043c\u0438\u044f \"\u0414. \u0410. \u0426\u0435\u043d\u043e\u0432\" \u2013 \u0421\u0432\u0438\u0449\u043e\u0432\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0422\u0435\u0445\u043d\u0438\u0447\u0435\u0441\u043a\u0438 \u0443\u043d\u0438\u0432\u0435\u0440\u0441\u0438\u0442\u0435\u0442 \u2013 \u0412\u0430\u0440\u043d\u0430\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0422\u0435\u0445\u043d\u0438\u0447\u0435\u0441\u043a\u0438 \u0443\u043d\u0438\u0432\u0435\u0440\u0441\u0438\u0442\u0435\u0442 \u2013 \u0413\u0430\u0431\u0440\u043e\u0432\u043e\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0422\u0435\u0445\u043d\u0438\u0447\u0435\u0441\u043a\u0438 \u0443\u043d\u0438\u0432\u0435\u0440\u0441\u0438\u0442\u0435\u0442 \u2013 \u0421\u043e\u0444\u0438\u044f\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0T\u0440\u0430\u043a\u0438\u0439\u0441\u043a\u0438 \u0443\u043d\u0438\u0432\u0435\u0440\u0441\u0438\u0442\u0435\u0442 - \u0421\u0442\u0430\u0440\u0430 \u0417\u0430\u0433\u043e\u0440\u0430\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0423\u043d\u0438\u0432\u0435\u0440\u0441\u0438\u0442\u0435\u0442 \"\u041f\u0440\u043e\u0444. \u0434-\u0440 \u0410\u0441\u0435\u043d \u0417\u043b\u0430\u0442\u0430\u0440\u043e\u0432\" \u2013 \u0411\u0443\u0440\u0433\u0430\u0441\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0423\u043d\u0438\u0432\u0435\u0440\u0441\u0438\u0442\u0435\u0442 \u0437\u0430 \u043d\u0430\u0446\u0438\u043e\u043d\u0430\u043b\u043d\u043e \u0438 \u0441\u0432\u0435\u0442\u043e\u0432\u043d\u043e \u0441\u0442\u043e\u043f\u0430\u043d\u0441\u0442\u0432\u043e \u2013 \u0421\u043e\u0444\u0438\u044f\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0423\u043d\u0438\u0432\u0435\u0440\u0441\u0438\u0442\u0435\u0442 \u043f\u043e \u0430\u0440\u0445\u0438\u0442\u0435\u043a\u0442\u0443\u0440\u0430, \u0441\u0442\u0440\u043e\u0438\u0442\u0435\u043b\u0441\u0442\u0432\u043e \u0438 \u0433\u0435\u043e\u0434\u0435\u0437\u0438\u044f \u2013 \u0421\u043e\u0444\u0438\u044f\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0423\u043d\u0438\u0432\u0435\u0440\u0441\u0438\u0442\u0435\u0442 \u043f\u043e \u0445\u0440\u0430\u043d\u0438\u0442\u0435\u043b\u043d\u0438 \u0442\u0435\u0445\u043d\u043e\u043b\u043e\u0433\u0438\u0438 \u2013 \u041f\u043b\u043e\u0432\u0434\u0438\u0432\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0425\u0438\u043c\u0438\u043a\u043e-\u0442\u0435\u0445\u043d\u043e\u043b\u043e\u0433\u0438\u0447\u0435\u043d \u0438 \u043c\u0435\u0442\u0430\u043b\u0443\u0440\u0433\u0438\u0447\u0435\u043d \u0443\u043d\u0438\u0432\u0435\u0440\u0441\u0438\u0442\u0435\u0442 - \u0421\u043e\u0444\u0438\u044f\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0428\u0443\u043c\u0435\u043d\u0441\u043a\u0438 \u0443\u043d\u0438\u0432\u0435\u0440\u0441\u0438\u0442\u0435\u0442 \"\u0415\u043f\u0438\u0441\u043a\u043e\u043f \u041a\u043e\u043d\u0441\u0442\u0430\u043d\u0442\u0438\u043d \u041f\u0440\u0435\u0441\u043b\u0430\u0432\u0441\u043a\u0438\"\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u042e\u0433\u043e\u0437\u0430\u043f\u0430\u0434\u0435\u043d \u0443\u043d\u0438\u0432\u0435\u0440\u0441\u0438\u0442\u0435\u0442 \"\u041d\u0435\u043e\u0444\u0438\u0442 \u0420\u0438\u043b\u0441\u043a\u0438\" \u2013 \u0411\u043b\u0430\u0433\u043e\u0435\u0432\u0433\u0440\u0430\u0434\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nState\u00a0and\u00a0municipal\u00a0schools\u00a0within\u00a0the\u00a0meaning\u00a0of\u00a0the \u0417\u0430\u043a\u043e\u043d\u0430 \u0437\u0430 \u043d\u0430\u0440\u043e\u0434\u043d\u0430\u0442\u0430 \u043f\u0440\u043e\u0441\u0432\u0435\u0442\u0430 (\u043e\u0431\u043d., \u0414\u0412, \u0431\u0440. 86/18.10.1991)\n\n\n\nCultural institutes within the meaning of the \u0417\u0430\u043a\u043e\u043d\u0430 \u0437\u0430 \u0437\u0430\u043a\u0440\u0438\u043b\u0430 \u0438 \u0431\u0440.50/1.6.1999):\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u041d\u0430\u0440\u043e\u0434\u043d\u0430 \u0431\u0438\u0431\u043b\u0438\u043e\u0442\u0435\u043a\u0430 \"\u0421\u0432. \u0441\u0432. \u041a\u0438\u0440\u0438\u043b \u0438 \u041c\u0435\u0442\u043e\u0434\u0438\u0439\" \n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0411\u044a\u043b\u0433\u0430\u0440\u0441\u043a\u0430 \u043d\u0430\u0446\u0438\u043e\u043d\u0430\u043b\u043d\u0430 \u0444\u043e\u043d\u043e\u0442\u0435\u043a\u0430\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0411\u044a\u043b\u0433\u0430\u0440\u0441\u043a\u0430 \"\u041a\u0443\u043b\u0442\u0443\u0440\u0430\"\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u041d\u0430\u0446\u0438\u043e\u043d\u0430\u043b\u0435\u043d \u0438\u043d\u0441\u0442\u0438\u0442\u0443\u0442 \u0437\u0430 (Bulgarian\u00a0cultural\u00a0institutes\u00a0abroad) \n\n\n\nState and/or municipal medical institutions referred to in Article 3(1) of the \u0417\u0430\u043a\u043e\u043d\u0430 \u0437\u0430 december 2007 af lov om universiteter (Universities, see Consolidation Act nr. 1368 of 7 December 2007 on universities).\n\n\n\nGermany\n\n\n\nCategories:\n\n\n\nLegal persons governed by public law:\n\n\n\nAuthorities, establishments and foundations governed by public law and created by Federal, State or local authorities particularly in the following fields:\n\n\n\n(1)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Authorities:\n\n\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Wissenschaftliche Hochschulen und verfasste Studentenschaften \u2014 (universities and established student bodies)\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0berufsst\u00e4ndige Vereinigungen (Rechtsanwalts-, Notar-, Steuerberater-, Wirtschaftspr\u00fcfer-, Architekten-, \u00c4rzte- und Apothekerkammern) \u2014 [professional associations representing lawyers, notaries, tax consultants, accountants, architects, medical practitioners and pharmacists]\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Wirtschaftsvereinigungen (Landwirtschafts-, Handwerks-, Industrie- und Handelskammern, Handwerksinnungen, Handwerkerschaften) \u2014 [business and trade associations: agricultural and craft associations, chambers of industry and commerce, craftmen's guilds, tradesmen's associations]\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Sozialversicherungen (Krankenkassen, Unfall- und Rentenversicherungstr\u00e4ger)\u2014 [social security institutions: health, accident and pension insurance funds]\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0kassen\u00e4rztliche Vereinigungen \u2014 (associations of panel doctors)\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Genossenschaften und Verb\u00e4nde \u2014 (cooperatives and other associations)\n\n\n\n(2)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Establishments and foundations:\n\n\n\nNon-industrial and non-commercial establishments subject to State control and operating in the general interest, particularly in the following fields:\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Rechtsf\u00e4hige Bundesanstalten \u2014 (Federal institutions having legal capacity)\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Versorgungsanstalten und Studentenwerke \u2014 (pension organisations and students' unions)\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Kultur-, Wohlfahrts- und Hilfsstiftungen \u2014 (cultural, welfare and relief foundations)\n\n\n\n\nLegal persons governed by private law:\n\n\n\nNon-industrial and non-commercial establishments subject to State control and operating in the general interest, including kommunale Versorgungsunternehmen (municipal utilities):\n\n\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Gesundheitswesen (Krankenh\u00e4user, Kurmittelbetriebe, medizinische Forschungseinrichtungen, Untersuchungs- und establishments]\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Kultur (\u00f6ffentliche B\u00fchnen, Orchester, Museen, Bibliotheken, Archive, zoologische und botanische G\u00e4rten) \u2014 [culture: public theatres, orchestras, museums, libraries, archives, zoological and botanical gardens]\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Soziales (Kinderg\u00e4rten, Kindertagesheime, Erholungseinrichtungen, Kinderund Jugendheime, Freizeiteinrichtungen, Gemeinschafts- und B\u00fcrgerh\u00e4user, Frauenh\u00e4user, Altersheime, Obdachlosenunterk\u00fcnfte) \u2014 [social welfare: nursery schools, children's playschools, rest-homes, children's homes, hostels for young people, leisure centres, community and civic centres, homes for battered wives, old people's homes, accommodation for the homeless]\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Sport (Schwimmb\u00e4der, Sportanlagen und -einrichtungen) \u2014 [sport: swimming baths, sports facilities]\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Sicherheit (Feuerwehren, Rettungsdienste) \u2014 [safety: fire brigades, other emergency services]\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Bildung (Umschulungs-, Aus-, Fort- und Weiterbildungseinrichtungen, Volksschulen) [education: training, further training and retraining establishments, adult evening classes]\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Wissenschaft, Forschung und Entwicklung (Gro\u00dfforschungseinrichtungen, wissenschaftliche Gesellschaften und Vereine, Wissenschaftsf\u00f6rderung) \u2014 [science, research and development: large-scale research institutes, scientific societies and associations, bodies promoting science]\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Entsorgung (Stra\u00dfenreinigung, Abfall- und Abwasserbeseitigung) \u2014 [refuse and garbage disposal services: street cleaning, waste and sewage disposal]\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Bauwesen und Wohnungswirtschaft (Stadtplanung, Stadtentwicklung, Wohnungsunternehmen soweit im Allgemeininteresse t\u00e4tig, Wohnraumvermittlung)\u2014 [building, civil engineering and housing: town planning, urban development, housing, enterprises (insofar as they operate in the general interest), housing agency services]\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Wirtschaft (Wirtschaftsf\u00f6rderungsgesellschaften) \u2014 (economy: organizations promoting economic development)\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Friedhofs- und Bestattungswesen \u2014 (cemeteries and burial services)\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Zusammenarbeit mit den Entwicklungsl\u00e4ndern (Finanzierung, technische Zusammenarbeit, Entwicklungshilfe, enterprises and public entities\n\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Legal persons governed by private law which are State-owned or which regularly receive at\u00a0least\u00a050\u00a0% of their annual budget in the form of State subsidies, pursuant to the applicable rules, or in which the State has a capital holding of at least 51\u00a0%\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Legal persons governed by private law which are owned by legal persons governed by public law, by local authorities of any level, including the Greek Central Association of Local Authorities (\u039a.\u0395.\u0394.\u039a.\u0395.), by local associations of \u2018communes', (local administrative areas) or by public enterprises or entities, or by legal persons as referred to in (b) or which regularly receive at\u00a0least\u00a050\u00a0% of their annual budget in the form of subsidies from such legal persons, pursuant to the applicable rules or to their own articles of association, or legal persons as referred to above which have a capital holding of at least 51\u00a0% in such legal persons governed by public law\n\n\n\nSpain\n\n\n\nCategories:\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Bodies and entities governed by public law which are subject to the Ley 30/2007, de 30 de octubre, de Contratos del Sector P\u00fablico, \u2014 [Spanish State legislation on procurement] \u2013, in accordance with its article 3, other than those which are part of the Administraci\u00f3n General del Estado \u2014 (general national administration) -, the Administraci\u00f3n de las Comunidades Aut\u00f3nomas \u2014 (administration of the autonomous regions) \u2013 and the Corporaciones Locales\u00a0\u2014 (local authorities).\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Entidades Gestoras y Servicios Comunes de la Seguridad Social \u2014 (administrative entities and common services of the health and social services). javnoj nabavi (Narodne novine broj 90/11) (Public Procurement Act, Official Gazette No. 90/11), i.e. legal persons established for the specific purpose of meeting needs in the general interest, not having an industrial or commercial character and which meet one of the following conditions:\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0they are financed from the State Budget or the budget of local or the budget of regional self-government unit or other such legal persons in more than 50%, or\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0they are subject to management supervision by state bodies, local and regional self-government units or other such legal persons, or\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0they have supervisory board, an administrative or managerial board, more than half of whose members are appointed by the state bodies, local and regional self-government units or other such legal persons.\n\n\n\nFor example:\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Agency Alan d.o.o.;\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0APIS IT schemes)\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Consorzi di bonifica (land reclamation consortia)\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Enti di sviluppo e di irrigazione (development or irrigation (organisations providing services in the public interest)\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Enti pubblici preposti ad attivit\u00e0 di spettacolo, sportive, turistiche e del tempo libero (public bodies engaged in -entertainment, sport, tourism and leisure activities)\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Enti culturali e di promozione artistica (organisations promoting culture and artistic activities)\n\n\n\n\n\nCyprus\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0391\u03c1\u03c7\u03ae \u03a1\u03b1\u03b4\u03b9\u03bf\u03c4\u03b7\u03bb\u03b5\u03cc\u03c1\u03b1\u03c3\u03b7\u03c2 \u039a\u03cd\u03c0\u03c1\u03bf\u03c5\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0395\u03c0\u03b9\u03c4\u03c1\u03bf\u03c0\u03ae \u039a\u03b5\u03c6\u03b1\u03bb\u03b1\u03b9\u03b1\u03b3\u03bf\u03c1\u03ac\u03c2 \u039a\u03cd\u03c0\u03c1\u03bf\u03c5\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0395\u03c0\u03af\u03c4\u03c1\u03bf\u03c0\u03bf\u03c2 \u03a1\u03c5\u03b8\u03bc\u03af\u03c3\u03b5\u03c9\u03c2 (this\u00a0category\u00a0refers\u00a0to\u00a0the \u03a3\u03c5\u03bc\u03b2\u03bf\u03cd\u03bb\u03b9\u03b1 \u0391\u03c0\u03bf\u03c7\u03b5\u03c4\u03b5\u03cd\u03c3\u03b5\u03c9\u03bd established\u00a0and\u00a0operating\u00a0according\u00a0to\u00a0the\u00a0provisions\u00a0of\u00a0the \u0391\u03c0\u03bf\u03c7\u03b5\u03c4\u03b5\u03c5\u03c4\u03b9\u03ba\u03ce\u03bd of\u00a01971)\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u03a3\u03c5\u03bc\u03b2\u03bf\u03cd\u03bb\u03b9\u03b1 \u03a3\u03c6\u03b1\u03b3\u03b5\u03af\u03c9\u03bd (this\u00a0category\u00a0refers\u00a0to\u00a0the \u039a\u03b5\u03bd\u03c4\u03c1\u03b9\u03ba\u03ac \u03ba\u03b1\u03b9 \u039a\u03bf\u03b9\u03bd\u03bf\u03c4\u03b9\u03ba\u03ac \u03a3\u03c5\u03bc\u03b2\u03bf\u03cd\u03bb\u03b9\u03b1 \u03a3\u03c6\u03b1\u03b3\u03b5\u03af\u03c9\u03bd run\u00a0by\u00a0local\u00a0authorities, established\u00a0and\u00a0operating\u00a0according\u00a0to\u00a0the\u00a0provisions\u00a0of\u00a0the \u03a3\u03c6\u03b1\u03b3\u03b5\u03af\u03c9\u03bd \u039d\u03cc\u03bc\u03bf\u03c5 N.26(\u0399) of 2003)\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u03a3\u03c7\u03bf\u03bb\u03b9\u03ba\u03ad\u03c2\u00a0\u0395\u03c6\u03bf\u03c1\u03b5\u03af\u03b5\u03c2 (This category refers to the \u03a3\u03c7\u03bf\u03bb\u03b9\u03ba\u03ad\u03c2\u00a0\u0395\u03c6\u03bf\u03c1\u03b5\u03af\u03b5\u03c2 established and operating according to the provisions of the \u03a3\u03c7\u03bf\u03bb\u03b9\u03ba\u03ce\u03bd\u00a0\u0395\u03c6\u03bf\u03c1\u03b5\u03b9\u03ce\u03bd\u00a0\u039d\u03cc\u03bc\u03bf\u03c5 N.108 of 2003)\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u03a4\u03b1\u03bc\u03b5\u03af\u03bf \u0398\u03ae\u03c1\u03b1\u03c2\n\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u039a\u03c5\u03c0\u03c1\u03b9\u03b1\u03ba\u03cc\u03c2
