institutions within the meaning of the Wet Educatie en Beroepsonderwijs (Law on Education and Vocational Education)\n\n\n\u2013Publicly funded universities and higher education institutions, the Open University, and the university hospitals, within the meaning of the Wet op het hoger onderwijs en wetenschappelijk onderzoek (Law on Higher Education and Scientific Research)\n\n\n\u2013School general interest, not having industrial or commercial character, and at the same time satisfying at least one of the following conditions: \n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0is fully or partially financed by a contracting authority, i. e. a government authority, municipality, Self-government Region or other legal person, which satisfies at the same time the conditions referred to in Article 1 (9) letter (a) or (b) or (c) of Directive 2004/18/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council\n\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0is managed or controlled by a contracting authority, i. e. by a government authority, municipality, Self-government Region or other body governed by public law, which satisfies at the same time the conditions referred to in Article 1 (9) letter (a) or (b) or (c) of Directive\u00a02004/18/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0is a contracting authority, i. e. a government authority, municipality, Self-government Region or other legal person, which satisfies at the same time the conditions referred to in Article\u00a01\u00a0(9) letter (a) or (b) or (c) of Directive 2004/18/EC of the European Parliament and of the Council, appoints or elects more than one half of the members of its managerial or supervisory board\n\n\n\nSuch persons are bodies governed by public law exercising the activity, as for example:\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0pursuant to Act No.\u00a016/2004 Coll. on Slovak Television\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0pursuant to Act No.\u00a0619/2003 Coll. on Slovak Corporations\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Urban Development Corporations\n\n\n\n\n\nSUBSECTION 3\n\n\n\nUTILITIES\n\n\n\nTitle VI of this Agreement shall apply to the entities referred to in this Subsection as regards to procurement of goods, services and construction services indicated below, when the value of the procurement has been estimated, according to Article 173 paragraphs 6 to 8 of this Agreement, as equal to or higher than the corresponding thresholds below:\n\n\n\n\n\nGoods:\n\n\nSpecified in Subsection 4\n\n\nThreshold\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0SDR 400 000\n\n\n\nServices:\n\n\nSpecified in Subsection 5\n\n\nThreshold\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0SDR 400 000\n\n\n\nConstruction Services:\n\n\nSpecified in Subsection 6\n\n\nThreshold\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0SDR 5 000 000\n\n\n\n\nProcuring Entities: \n\n\n\nAll contracting entities whose procurement is covered by Directive 2004/17/EC (hereinafter, the \"European Union Utilities Directive\") which are contracting authorities (e.g. those covered under Subsections 1 and 2) or public undertakings\n1\n and which have as one of their activities any of those referred to below or any combination thereof:\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the provision or operation of fixed networks intended to provide a service to the public in connection with the production, transport or distribution of drinking water or the supply of drinking water to such networks;\n\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the provision or operation of fixed networks intended to provide a service to the public in connection with the production, transport or distribution of electricity or the supply of electricity to such networks;\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the provision of airport or other terminal facilities to carriers by air;\n\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the provision of maritime or inland port or other terminal facilities to carriers by sea or inland waterway; \n\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the provision or operation of networks\n2\n providing a service to the public in the field of transport by urban railway, automated systems, tramway, trolley bus, bus or cable; \n\n\n\n(f)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the provision or operation of fixed networks intended to provide a service to the public in connection with the production, transport or distribution of gas or heat or the supply of gas or heat to such networks; and\n\n\n(g)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the provision or operation of networks\n3\n providing a service to the public in the field of transport by railway.\n\n\n\nIndicative lists of contracting authorities and public undertakings fulfilling the criteria set out above are included. \n\n\n\nNotes to this Subsection\n\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Contracts awarded for the pursuit of an activity listed above when exposed to competitive forces in the market concerned are not covered by Title VI of this Agreement. \n\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Title VI of this Agreement shall not apply to contracts awarded by procuring entities covered under this Subsection:\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0for the purchase of water and for the supply of energy or of fuels for the production of energy;\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0for purposes other than the pursuit of their activities as listed in this Subsection or for the pursuit of such activities in a country that is not party to the European Economic Area (EEA); \n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0for purposes of re-sale or hire to third parties, provided that the procuring entity enjoys no special or exclusive right to sell or hire the subject of such contracts and other entities are free to sell or hire it under the same conditions as the procuring entity.\n\n\n\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The supply of drinking water or electricity to networks which provide a service to the public by a procuring entity other than a contracting authority shall not be considered as an activity within the meaning of paragraphs (a) or (b) of this Subsection where:\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the production of drinking water or electricity by the entity concerned takes place because its consumption is necessary for carrying out an activity other than that referred to in paragraphs (a) to (g) of this Subsection; and\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0supply to the public network depends only on the entity's own consumption and has not exceeded 30\u00a0per cent of the entity's total production of drinking water or energy, having regard to the average for the preceding three years, including the current year.\n\n\n4. \n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The supply of gas or heat to networks which provide a service to the public by a contracting entity other than a contracting authority shall not be considered a relevant activity within the meaning of paragraph (f) of this Subsection where:\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the production of gas or heat by the entity concerned is the unavoidable consequence of carrying out an activity other than those referred to in paragraphs (a) to (g) of this Subsection; and\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0supply to the public network is aimed only at the economic exploitation of such production and amounts to not more than 20 % of the entity's turnover having regard to the average for the preceding three years, including the current year.\n\n\n5.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Provided that the conditions in subparagraph (b) below are met, Title VI of this Agreement shall not apply to contracts awarded: \n\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0by a procuring entity to an affiliated undertaking\n4\n, or\n\n\n\n(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0by a joint venture, formed exclusively by a number of procuring entities for the purpose of carrying out activities within the meaning of paragraph (a) to (e) of this Subsection, to an undertaking which is affiliated with one of these procuring entities.\n\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Subparagraph (a) shall apply to services or supplies contracts provided that at least 80\u00a0% of the average turnover of the affiliated undertaking with respect to services or supplies for the preceding three years derives respectively from the provision of such services or supplies to undertakings with which it is affiliated\n5\n.\n\n\n\n\n6.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Title VI of this Agreement shall not apply to contracts awarded:\n\n\n\n(i)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0by a joint venture, formed exclusively by a number of procuring entities for the purposes of carrying out activities within the meaning of paragraphs (a) to (g) of this Subsection, to one of these procuring entities; or\n\n\n\n\n\n(ii)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0by a procuring entity to such a joint venture of which it forms part, provided that the joint venture has been set up to carry out the activity concerned over a period of at least three years and the instrument setting up the joint venture stipulates that the procuring entities, which form it, will be part thereof for at least the same period.\n\n\n\nINDICATIVE LISTS OF CONTRACTING AUTHORITIES AND PUBLIC UNDERTAKINGS\n\n\nFULFILLING THE CRITERIA LAID DOWN UNDER THIS SUBSECTION\n\n\n\nI.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0PRODUCTION, TRANSPORT OR DISTRIBUTION OF ELECTRICITY\n\n\n\nBelgium\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Local authorities and associations of local authorities, for this part of their activities\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Soci\u00e9t\u00e9 de Production d'Electricit\u00e9/ Elektriciteitsproductie Maatschappij\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Electrabel/ Electrabel\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Elia\n\n\n\n\nBulgaria\n\n\n\nEntities licensed for production, transport, distribution, public delivery or supply by an end supplier of electricity pursuant to Article 39(1) of the \u0417\u0430\u043a\u043e\u043d\u0430 \u0437\u0430 \u0435\u043d\u0435\u0440\u0433\u0435\u0442\u0438\u043a\u0430\u0442\u0430 (\u043e\u0431\u043d., \u0414\u0412, \u0431\u0440.107/09.12.2003):\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0410\u0415\u0426 \u041a\u043e\u0437\u043b\u043e\u0434\u0443\u0439 - \u0415\u0410\u0414\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0415\u0412\u041d \u0411\u044a\u043b\u0433\u0430\u0440\u0438\u044f \u0422\u043e\u043f\u043b\u043e\u0444\u0438\u043a\u0430\u0446\u0438\u044f - \u041f\u043b\u043e\u0432\u0434\u0438\u0432 - \u0415\u0410\u0414\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0422\u043e\u043f\u043b\u043e\u0444\u0438\u043a\u0430\u0446\u0438\u044f \u0420\u0443\u0441\u0435 \u2013 \u0415\u0410\u0414\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0422\u043e\u043f\u043b\u043e\u0444\u0438\u043a\u0430\u0446\u0438\u044f \u0421\u043b\u0438\u0432\u0435\u043d \u2013 \u0415\u0410\u0414\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0422\u043e\u043f\u043b\u043e\u0444\u0438\u043a\u0430\u0446\u0438\u044f \u0421\u043e\u0444\u0438\u044f \u2013 \u0415\u0410\u0414\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0422\u043e\u043f\u043b\u043e\u0444\u0438\u043a\u0430\u0446\u0438\u044f \u0428\u0443\u043c\u0435\u043d \u2013 \u0415\u0410\u0414\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u0425\u0438\u0434\u0440\u043e\u0435\u043d\u0435\u0440\u0433\u043e\u0441\u0442\u0440\u043e\u0439 \u0411\u044a\u043b\u0433\u0430\u0440\u0438\u044f \u0410\u0414\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nCzech\u00a0Republic\n\n\n\nAll contracting entities in the sectors which supply services in the electricity sector defined in section 4 paragraph 1 letter c) of Act. No. 137/2006 Coll. on Public Contracts, as amended.\n\n\n\nExamples of contracting entities:\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u010cEPS, a. s.\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u010cEZ, a. s.\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Dalkia \u010cesk\u00e1 republika, a.s.\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0PREdistribuce, a.s.\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Plze\u0148sk\u00e1 energetika a.s.\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Sokolovsk\u00e1 uheln\u00e1, pr\u00e1vn\u00ed n\u00e1stupce, a.s.\n\n\n\nDenmark\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Entities producing electricity on the basis of a licence pursuant to \u00a7 10 of lov om elforsyning, see Consolidation Act No 1115 of 8 November 2006.\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Entities transporting electricity on the basis of a licence pursuant to \u00a7 19 of lov om elforsyning, see Consolidation Act No 1115 of 8 November 2006.\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Transport of electricity carried out by Energinet Danmark or subsidiary companies fully owned by Energinet Danmark according to lov om Energinet Danmark \u00a7 2, stk. 2 og 3, see Act No 1384 of\u00a020\u00a0December 2004.\n\n\n\n\nGermany\n\n\n\n\n\nLocal authorities, public law bodies or associations of public law bodies or State undertakings, supplying energy to other undertakings, operating an energy supply network or having power of disposal to an energy supply network by virtue of ownership pursuant to Article 3(18) of the Gesetz \u00fcber die Elektrizit\u00e4ts- und Gasversorgung (Energiewirtschaftsgesetz) of 24 April 1998, as last amended on 9 December 2006.\n\n\n\nEstonia\n\n\n\nEntities operating pursuant to Article 10(3) of the Public Procurement Act (RT I 21.02.2007, 15, 76) and Article 14 of the Competition Act (RT I 2001, 56 332): [electricity generation]\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Bord G\u00e1is \u00c9ireann [electricity supply]\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Electricity Suppliers and Generators licensed under the Electricity Regulation Act 1999\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0EirGrid plc\n\n\n\n\n\nGreece\n\n\n\n'\u0394\u03b7\u03bc\u03cc\u03c3\u03b9\u03b1 \u0420\u0443\u0441\u0435\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\"\u0415\u043a\u043e\u043f\u0440\u043e\u0435\u043a\u0442-\u0421\" \u041e\u041e\u0414, \u0420\u0443\u0441\u0435\n\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\"\u0423\u0412\u0415\u041a\u0421\" \u2013 \u0415\u041e\u041e\u0414, sectors which supply services in the water management industry defined in section 4 paragraph 1 letters d), e) of Act. N\u00b0137/2006 Sb. on Public Contracts\n\n\n\nExamples of contracting entities:\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Veolia Voda \u010cesk\u00e1 Republika, a.s.\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Pra\u017esk\u00e9 vodovody a kanalizace, a.s.\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Severo\u010desk\u00e1 vod\u00e1rensk\u00e1 spole\u010dnost a.s.\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Severomoravsk\u00e9 vodovody a kanalizace Ostrava a.s.\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Ostravsk\u00e9 vod\u00e1rny a kanalizace a.s.\n\n\n\n\nDenmark\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Entities supplying water as defined in \u00a7 3(3) of lov om vandforsyning m.v., see Consolidation Act No 71 of 17 January 2007.\n\n\n\nGermany\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Entities producing or distributing water pursuant to the Eigenbetriebsverordnungen or Eigenbetriebsgesetze of the L\u00e4nder (public utility companies)\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Entities producing or distributing water pursuant to the Gesetze \u00fcber die kommunale Gemeinschaftsarbeit oder Zusammenarbeit of the L\u00e4nder\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Entities producing water pursuant to the Gesetz \u00fcber Wasser- und Bodenverb\u00e4nde of\u00a012\u00a0February\u00a01991, as last amended on 15 May 2002\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Publicly-owned companies producing or distributing water pursuant to the Kommunalgesetze, in particular the Gemeindeverordnungen of the L\u00e4nder\n\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Undertakings set up pursuant to the Aktiengesetz of 6 September 1965, as last amended on\u00a05\u00a0January 2007, or the GmbH-Gesetz of 20 April 1892, as last amended on\u00a010\u00a0November\u00a02006, or having the legal status of a Kommanditgesellschaft (limited partnership), producing or distributing water on the basis of a special contract with regional or local authorities\n\n\n\n\nEstonia\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Entities operating pursuant to Article 10(3) of the Public Procurement Act (RT I 21.02.2007, 15, 76) and Article 14 of the Competition Act (RT I 2001, 56 332):\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0AS Haapsalu Veev\u00e4rk\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0AS Kuressaare Veev\u00e4rk\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0AS Narva 890/1979\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0'\u0394\u03b7\u03bc\u03bf\u03c4\u03b9\u03ba\u03ad\u03c2 \u0395\u03c0\u03b9\u03c7\u03b5\u03b9\u03c1\u03ae\u03c3\u03b5\u03b9\u03c2 1980\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0'\u03a3\u03cd\u03bd\u03b4\u03b5\u03c3\u03bc\u03bf\u03b9 \u038e\u03b4\u03c1\u03b5\u03c5\u03c3\u03b7\u03c2', (municipal\u00a0and\u00a0community\u00a0water\u00a0supply\u00a0associations) which\u00a0operate\u00a0pursuant\u00a0to\u00a0Presidential\u00a0Decree\u00a0No 410/1995, in\u00a0accordance\u00a0with\u00a0the \u039a\u03ce\u03b4\u03b9\u03bao\u03c2 \u0394\u03ae\u03bc\u03c9\u03bd \u03ba\u03b1\u03b9 in\u00a0accordance\u00a0with\u00a0the \u039a\u03ce\u03b4\u03b9\u03bao\u03c2 \u0394\u03ae\u03bc\u03c9\u03bd \u03ba\u03b1\u03b9 S.A., y sociedades filiales\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Canal de Isabel II\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Agencia Andaluza del Agua\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Agencia Balear de Agua y de la Calidad Ambiental\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Other public entities which are part of or depend on the \"Comunidades Aut\u00f3nomas\" and on the \"Corporaciones locales\" and which are active in the field of drinking water distribution\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Other private entities enjoying special or exclusive rights granted by the \"Corporaciones locales\" in the field of drinking water distribution\n\n\n\nFrance\n\n\n\nRegional or local authorities and public local bodies producing or distributing drinking water:\n\n\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0R\u00e9gies des eaux, (examples: R\u00e9gie des eaux de Grenoble, r\u00e9gie des eaux de Meg\u00e8ve, r\u00e9gie municipale des eaux et de l'assainissement de Mont-de-Marsan, r\u00e9gie des eaux de Venelles)\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Water transport, delivery and production bodies (examples: Syndicat des eaux d'Ile de France, syndicat d\u00e9partemental d'alimentation en eau potable de la Vend\u00e9e, syndicat des eaux et de l'assainissement du Bas-Rhin, syndicat intercommunal des eaux de la r\u00e9gion grenobloise, syndicat de l'eau du Var-est, syndicat des eaux et de l'assainissement du Bas-Rhin).\n\n\n\nCroatia\n\n\n\nContracting entities referred to in Article 6 of the Zakon o javnoj nabavi (Narodne novine broj 90/11) (Public Procurement Act, Official Gazette No. 90/11) which are public undertakings or contracting authorities and which, in accordance with special regulations, engage in the activity of construction (providing) of fixed networks or managing fixed networks for public service delivery in relation to the production, transmission and distribution of drinking water and supplying fixed networks with drinking water; such as the entities established by the local self-government units acting as the public supplier of water supply services or drainage services in accordance with the Waters Act (Official Gazette 153/09 and 130/11).\n\n\n\nItaly\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Bodies responsible for managing the various stages of the water distribution service under the consolidated text of the laws on the direct assumption of control of public services by local authorities and provinces, approved by Regio Decreto N\u00b02578 of 15 October 1925, D.P.R. N\u00b0902 of\u00a04\u00a0October 1986 and Legislative Decree N\u00b0267 of 18 August 2000 setting out the consolidated text of the laws on the structure of local authorities, with particular reference to Articles 112 and\u00a0116\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Acquedotto Pugliese S.p.A. (D.lgs. 11.5.1999 n. 141)\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Ente acquedotti siciliani set up by Legge Regionale N\u00b02/2 of 4 September 1979 and Lege Regionale N\u00b081 of 9 August 1980, in liquidazione con Legge Regionale N\u00b09 of 31 May 2004 (art. 1)\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Ente sardo acquedotti e fognature set up by Law N\u00b09 of 5 July 1963. Poi ESAF S.p.A. nel\u00a02003 \u2013 confluita in ABBANOA S.p.A: : ente soppresso il 29.7.2005 e posto in liquidazione con L.R. 21.4.2005 n\u00b07 (art. 5, comma 1)- Legge finanziaria 2005\n\n\n\nCyprus\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u03a4\u03b1\u00a0\u03a3\u03c5\u03bc\u03b2\u03bf\u03cd\u03bb\u03b9\u03b1\u00a0\u03a5\u03b4\u03b1\u03c4\u03bf\u03c0\u03c1\u03bf\u03bc\u03ae\u03b8\u03b5\u03b9\u03b1\u03c2, distributing water in municipal and other areas pursuant to the No.\u00a0525/2003 Coll., No.\u00a0364/2004 Coll., No.\u00a0587/2004 Coll. and No.\u00a0230/2005 Coll.\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Entities operating water management plants pursuant to the conditions referred to in Act No.\u00a0364/2004 Coll. in wording of Acts No. 587/2004 Coll. and No. 230/2005 Coll., on the basis of the permission granted pursuant to Act No. 135/1994 Coll. in wording of Acts No.\u00a052/1982 Coll., No. 595/1990 Coll., No. 128/1991 Coll., No. 238/1993 Coll., No.\u00a0416/2001 Coll., No. 533/2001 Coll. and simultaneously provide for transport or distribution of drinking water to the public pursuant to Act No. 442/2002 Coll. in wording of Acts No. 525/2003 Coll., No. 364/2004 Coll., No. 587/2004 Coll. and No.\u00a0230/2005 Coll.\n\n\n\nFor example:\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Bratislavsk\u00e1 vod\u00e1rensk\u00e1 spolo\u010dnos\u0165, a.s.\n\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Z\u00e1padoslovensk\u00e1 vod\u00e1rensk\u00e1 spolo\u010dnos\u0165, a.s.\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0V\u00fdchodoslovensk\u00e1 vod\u00e1rensk\u00e1 spolo\u010dnos\u0165, a.s.\n\n\n\nFinland\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Water supply \u041f\u0435\u0440\u043d\u0438\u043a\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\"\u0410\u0432\u0442\u043e\u0431\u0443\u0441\u043d\u0438 \u043f\u0440\u0435\u0432\u043e\u0437\u0438\" \u0415\u0410\u0414, \u041f\u043b\u0435\u0432\u0435\u043d\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\"\u0422\u0440\u043e\u043b\u0435\u0439\u0431\u0443\u0441\u0435\u043d \u0442\u0440\u0430\u043d\u0441\u043f\u043e\u0440\u0442\" \u0415\u041e\u041e\u0414, \u041f\u043b\u0435\u0432\u0435\u043d\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\"\u0413\u0440\u0430\u0434\u0441\u043a\u0438 \u0442\u0440\u0430\u043d\u0441\u043f\u043e\u0440\u0442 \u041f\u043b\u043e\u0432\u0434\u0438\u0432\" \u0415\u0410\u0414, \u041f\u043b\u043e\u0432\u0434\u0438\u0432\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\"\u0413\u0440\u0430\u0434\u0441\u043a\u0438 \u0420\u0443\u0441\u0435\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\"\u041f\u044a\u0442\u043d\u0438\u0447\u0435\u0441\u043a\u0438 \u043f\u0440\u0435\u0432\u043e\u0437\u0438\" \u0415\u0410\u0414, \u0415\u041e\u041e\u0414\n\n\n\n\nCzech Republic\n\n\n\nAll contracting entities in the sectors which exploit specified geographical area for the purposes of the provision and operation of maritime or inland ports or other terminal facilities to carriers by air, sea or inland waterways (ruled by section 4 paragraph 1 letter i) of Act No. 137/2006 Coll. on Public Contracts, as amended).\n\n\n\nExamples of contracting entities:\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0\u010cesk\u00e9 p\u0159\u00edstavy, a.s.\n\n\n\nDenmark\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Ports as defined in \u00a7 1 of lov om havne, see Act No 326 of 28 May 1999\n\n\n\nGermany\n\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Seaports owned totally or partially by territorial authorities (L\u00e4nder, Kreise Gemeinden).\n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Inland ports subject to the Hafenordnung pursuant to the Wassergesetze of the L\u00e4nder\n\n\n\n\nEstonia\n\n\n\n\n\nEntities operating pursuant to Article 10 (3) of the Public Procurement Act (RT I 21.02.2007, 15, 76) and Article 14 of the Competition Act (RT I 2001, 56 332): \n\n\n\u2013\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0AS Saarte Subsection 1, 2 and 3 of any of the services listed under this Subsection is a procurement to which the provisions of Title VI of this Agreement shall apply with regard to a service provider of Ecuador only to the extent that Ecuador has listed that same service under Subsection 5 of Section D of this Agreement.\n\n\n\n\n\nSUBSECTION 6\n\n\n\nCONSTRUCTION SERVICES\n\n\n\nA/ Construction services:\n\n\n\nDefinition: \n\n\nA construction services contract is a contract which has as its objective the realization by whatever means of civil or building works, in the sense of Division 51 of the Central Product Classification (hereinafter referred to as \"Division 51, CPC\").\n\n\n\n\n\nList of Division 51, CPC:\n\n\nAll services listed in Division 51.\n\n\n\nB/ Works concessions:\n\n\n\nWorks concessions contracts, when awarded by entities listed in subsections 1 and 2, and provided their value equals or exceeds 5 000 000 SDR, are covered by the national treatment principle established in Article 175, paragraphs 1 and 2 and by Articles 173, 174, 179, 190 and 294 of this\u00a0Agreement. \n\n\n\n\nList of Division 51, CPC:\n\n\n\n\n\nGroup\n\n\n\n\nClass\n\n\n\n\nSubclass\n\n\n\n\nTitle\n\n\n\n\nCorresponding ISCI\n\n\n\n\n\n\nsection 5\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nconstruction work and constructions: recreation\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n51371\n\n\n\n\nFor stadia and sports grounds\n\n\n\n\n4520\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n51372\n\n\n\n\nFor other sport and recreation installations (e.g. swimming finishing work\n\n\n\n\n4540\n\n\n\n\n\n\n518\n\n\n\n\n5180\n\n\n\n\n51800\n\n\n\n\nRenting services related to equipment for construction or demolition of buildings or civil engineering works, with operator\n\n\n\n\n4550\n\n\n\n\n\n\nSUBSECTION 7\n\n\n\nGENERAL NOTES AND EXTENSIONS/DEROGATIONS\n\n\n\n1.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0General Notes:\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Title VI of this Agreement shall not apply to: procurement of agricultural products made in furtherance of agricultural support programmes and human feeding programmes (e.g. food aid including urgent relief aid). However, it shall apply to procurements in the framework of the Programme of Food Aid to the most deprived persons in the European Union insofar as the procurement is carried out by, or on behalf of, a contracting authority/entity covered by Title VI of this Agreement.\n\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Title VI of this Agreement shall not apply to procurement for the acquisition, development, production or co-production of programme material by broadcasters and contracts for broadcasting time.\n\n\n\n(c)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The Title VI of this Agreement shall not apply to public service concessions.\n\n\n\n\n\n(d)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Contracts awarded by procuring entities covered under Subsections 1 and 2 in connection with activities in the fields of drinking water, electricity, gas distribution and transport, railways, urban transport, ports and airports are covered under Subsection 3 and subject to the value thresholds applying thereto.\n\n\n\n\n(e)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Finland reserves its position with regard to the application of Title VI of this Agreement to the \u00c5land Islands (Ahvenanmaa).\n\n\n\n2.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Extensions:\n\n\n\nFor suppliers of Peru: in Subsection 5, coverage includes the entire CPC Division 94 (Sewage and refuse disposal, sanitation, and other environmental protection services).\n\n\n\n3.\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0Threshold calculation formula:\n\n\n\n(a)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0The threshold shall be adjusted at two- year intervals with each adjustment taking effect on January 1, beginning on January 1, 2014.\n\n\n\n(b)\n\u00a0\u00a0\u00a0the calculation of the values of thresholds shall be based on the average of the daily values of the SDR to Euro exchange rate over the 24 months terminating on the last day of August preceding the revision with effect from 1 January. The value of the thresholds thus revised shall, where necessary, be rounded down to the nearest thousand Euros. This methodology can be modified by the EU Party and Colombia, the EU Party and Peru or the EU Party and Ecuador, as appropriate, within the Trade Committee meeting as described in Article 12, paragraph\u00a04 of this Agreement.\u00a0\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(1)\nAccording to the European Union Utilities Directive, a public undertaking is any undertaking over which the contracting authorities may exercise directly or indirectly a dominant influence by virtue of their ownership of it, their financial participation therein, or the rules which govern it.\n\nA dominant influence on the part of the contracting authorities shall be presumed when these authorities, directly or indirectly, in relation to an undertaking:\n\n- hold the majority of the undertaking's subscribed capital, or\n\n- control the majority of the votes attaching to shares issued by the undertaking, or\n\n- can appoint more than half of the undertaking's administrative, management or supervisory body.\n\n\n\n(2)\nAs regards transport services, a network shall be considered to exist where the service is provided under operating conditions laid down by a competent authority of an European\u00a0Union Member State, such as conditions on the routes to be served, the capacity to be made available or the frequency of the service.\n\n\n\n(3)\nAs regards transport services, a network shall be considered to exist where the service is provided under operating conditions laid down by a competent authority of a European Union Member State, such as conditions on the routes to be served, the capacity to be made available or the frequency of the service.\n\n\n\n(4)\n\"affiliated undertaking\" means any undertaking the annual accounts of which are consolidated with those of the procuring entity in accordance with the requirements of Council Directive 83/349/EEC on consolidated accounts, or in case of entities not subject to that Directive, any undertaking over which the procuring entity may exercise, directly or indirectly, a dominant influence, or which may exercise a dominant influence over the procuring entity, or which, in common with the procuring entity, is subject to the dominant influence of another undertaking by virtue of ownership, financial participation, or the rules which govern it.\n\n\n\n(5)\nWhen, because of the date on which an affiliated undertaking was created or commenced activities, the turnover is not available for the preceding three years, it will be sufficient for that undertaking to show that the turnover referred to in this subparagraph is credible, in particular by means of business projections.\n\n\n\n\n\nTop  \n\n\n\n\n\n\nEUROPEAN COMMISSION\nBrussels, 4.4.2016\nCOM(2016) 173 final\nANNEX\nto the\nProposal for a Council Decision\non the signing, on behalf of the European Union, and provisional application of the Protocol of Accession to the Trade Agreement  between the European Union and its Member States, of the one part, and Colombia and Peru, of the other part, to take account of the Accession of Ecuador\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nANNEX XIX\n\n\n(New Section D of Appendix 1 to Annex XII to the Agreement)\n\n\nANNEX XII\n\n\nGOVERNMENT PROCUREMENT\n\n\nAPPENDIX 1\n\n\nCOVERAGE ON GOVERNMENT PROCUREMENT\n\n\n'SECTION D \n\n\nECUADOR\n\n\nSUBSECTION\u00a01\n\n\nCENTRAL GOVERNMENT ENTITIES\n\n\nTitle VI of this Agreement shall apply to the central government entities referred to in this Subsection as regards the procurement of goods, services and construction services indicated below, when the value of the procurement has been estimated, in accordance with Article 173, paragraphs 6 to 8, of this Agreement, as equal to or higher than the corresponding thresholds below:\n\n\nGoods:\n\n\nThreshold: 260 000 Special Drawing Rights (hereinafter referred to as \"SDR\") for the period of five years following the entry into force of this Agreement, and 130 000 SDR thereafter.\n\n\nServices:\n\n\nThreshold: 260 000 SDR for the period of five years following the entry into force of this Agreement, and 130 000 SDR thereafter.\n\n\nConstruction services: \n\n\nThreshold: 6\u00a0000\u00a0000 SDR for the period of five years following the entry into force of this Agreement, and 5\u00a0000\u00a0000 SDR thereafter.\n\n\nProcuring Entities:\n\n\nCENTRAL GOVERNMENT\n\n\n\n\n1.Presidencia de la Rep\u00fablica \n\n\n2.Vicepresidencia de la the following cases \n\n\n1.MINISTERIO COORDINADOR DE SEGURIDAD, MINISTERIO DE DEFENSA NACIONAL, MINISTERIO DEL INTERIOR AND SECRETAR\u00cdA DE INTELIGENCIA: procurement of goods of a strategic nature necessary for national defence and public security, and; procurements of goods classified under Section 2 (food products, beverages and tobacco; textiles, apparel and leather products) of the United Nations Central Product Classification (CPC) for the Comando Conjunto de las Fuerzas Armadas, the Ej\u00e9rcito Nacional, the Armada Nacional, the Fuerza A\u00e9rea Ecuatoriana and the Polic\u00eda Nacional. \n\n\n2.MINISTERIO COORDINADOR DE DESARROLLO SOCIAL, DE EDUCACION AND ITS BODIES, INSTITUTIONS OR ADMINISTRATIVE ENTITIES SUBORDINATE TO, ATTACHED TO OR COORDINATED WITH IT: Services for the construction of educational entities (pre-school, elementary school and high school) (including via the Servicio de Contrataci\u00f3n de Obras SECOB): drafting, design, printing, edition and publication of didactic materials, and purchase of school uniforms. \n\n\n3.MINISTERIO DE INCLUSION ECONOMICA Y SOCIAL AND ITS BODIES, INSTITUTIONS OR ADMINISTRATIVE ENTITIES SUBORDINATE TO, ATTACHED TO OR COORDINATED WITH IT: procurements of the products provided for in Section 2 (Food products, beverages and tobacco; textiles, apparel and leather products) of the CPC intended for social assistance programmes.\n\n\n4.MINISTERIO DE AGRICULTURA, GANADER\u00cdA, ACUACULTURA Y PESCA, AND ITS BODIES, INSTITUTIONS OR ADMINISTRATIVE ENTITIES SUBORDINATE TO, ATTACHED TO OR COORDINATED WITH IT: procurements of food products, agricultural inputs and live animals related to agricultural support programmes and food assistance.\n\n\n\n\n5.CONSEJO NACIONAL ELECTORAL. procurements for the preparation and organisation of elections and public consultations.\n\n\nSUBSECTION\u00a02\n\n\nSUB-CENTRAL GOVERNMENT ENTITIES\n\n\nTitle VI of this Agreement shall apply to the sub-central government entities referred to in this Subsection as regards the procurement of goods, services and construction services when the value of the procurement has been estimated, in accordance with Article 173, paragraphs 6 to 8, of this Agreement, as equal to or higher than the corresponding thresholds below:\n\n\nGoods\n\n\nThreshold: 350 000 SDR for the period of five years following the entry into force of this Agreement, and 200 000 SDR thereafter.\n\n\nServices\n\n\nThreshold: 350 000 SDR for the period of five years following the entry into force of this Agreement, and 200 000 SDR thereafter.\n\n\nConstruction services: \n\n\nThreshold: 6\u00a0000\u00a0000 SDR for the period of five years following the entry into force of this Agreement, and 5\u00a0000\u00a0000 SDR thereafter.\n\n\nProcuring Entities:\n\n\na)All of the Gobiernos Aut\u00f3nomos Provinciales\n\n\nb)All of the Gobiernos Aut\u00f3nomos Municipales\n\n\nNotes to this subsection\n\n\n1. Title VI of this Agreement does not cover procurements by the Gobiernos Aut\u00f3nomos Parroquiales.\n\n\nSUBSECTION\u00a03\n\n\nOTHER COVERED ENTITIES\n\n\nTitle VI of this Agreement shall apply to entities listed in this Subsection as regards the procurement of goods, services and construction services indicated below when the value of the respective procurement, in accordance with Article 173, paragraphs 6 to 8, of this Agreement, is equal to or higher than the thresholds below:\n\n\nGoods:\n\n\nThreshold: 400\u00a0000 SDR\n\n\n\n\nServices:\n\n\nThreshold: 400\u00a0000 SDR\n\n\nConstruction services: \n\n\nThreshold: 6\u00a0000\u00a0000 SDR for the period of five years following the entry into force of this Agreement, and 5\u00a0000\u00a0000 SDR thereafter\n\n\nProcuring Entities:\n\n\nUnless otherwise specified, Title VI of this Agreement applies to the national public undertakings listed below:\n\n\nPUBLIC UNDERTAKINGS OF THE EXECUTIVE BRANCH\n\n\n1.Astilleros Navales Ecuatorianos - to this subsection \n\n\n1.A procuring entity of Ecuador, in a procurement of construction services for the construction, maintenance, or rehabilitation of roads and highways, may apply a condition relating to the hiring of local personnel in rural areas in order to promote employment and improve living conditions in such areas.\n\n\n2.Works concessions contracts, when awarded by procuring entities of subsections 1 and 2, are subject to the national treatment principle established in Article 175, paragraphs 1 and 2 of this Agreement and to Articles 173, 174, 179, 190 and 294 of this Agreement.\n\n\nSUBSECTION\u00a07\n\n\nGENERAL NOTES\n\n\n1.TITLE VI OF THIS AGREEMENT DOES NOT APPLY TO:\n\n\na)Procurements of goods and services in the defence and public security sector made by the Fuerzas Armadas, the Polic\u00eda Nacional or the Secretar\u00eda Nacional de Inteligencia, and that are strategic for national defence and public security; \n\n\nb)Public procurement programmes and procedures reserved for small, medium-sized and micro enterprises (SMEs), and the Actores de la Econom\u00eda Popular y Solidaria (AEPYS) (Popular and Solidarity Economy Stakeholders), provided these meet the same size criteria as required of SMEs to be considered as such;\n\n\nc)The procurement of goods for food assistance programmes;\n\n\n\n\nd)Procurements by all public sector institutions located in the Gal\u00e1pagos and all procurements that affect that particular region;\n\n\ne)The procurement of goods, services and construction services purchased or procured by the missions of the foreign service of the Republic of Ecuador for their operation;\n\n\nf)Procurements made by one Ecuadorian entity from another Ecuadorian entity. \n\n\n2.TECHNOLOGICAL UNBUNDLING(\n2\n):\n\n\nFor the period of five years following the entry into force of this Agreement, procuring entities listed under subsections 1, 2 and 3 may subject government procurement to mandatory requirements for the incorporation of domestic content pursuant to the study of technological unbundling carried out on the basis of the methodology defined by the Servicio Nacional de Contrataci\u00f3n P\u00fablica (SERCOP) of Ecuador. These requirements shall take the form of objective and clearly defined conditions for the participation in the tendering procedures for the award of the procurement. \n\n\nProcurement entities shall indicate the existence of domestic content conditions in their notice of intended procurement and specify them in detail in the contract documents.\n\n\nSuch conditions shall only cover the procurement procedures of goods and construction services and shall not exceed 40 per cent of the full contract value.\n\n\n3.THRESHOLD CALCULATION FORMULA\n\n\nThe threshold shall be adjusted at two-year intervals with each adjustment taking effect on January 1, beginning 1 January 2018. \n\n\nThe calculation of the values of thresholds shall be based on the average of the daily values of the SDR to US Dollar exchange rate over the 24 months terminating on the last day of August preceding the revision, with effect from 1 January. The value of the thresholds thus revised shall, where necessary, be rounded down to the nearest thousand dollars. This methodology can be modified by the EU Party and Ecuador within the Trade Committee meeting as described in Article 12 paragraph 4 of this Agreement.\n\n\n4.ECUADORIAN AUTHORITIES FOR THE PURPOSES OF ARTICLE 190 OF THIS AGREEMENT\n\n\nIn the case of Ecuador, the Tribunal Contencioso Administrativo, the Corte Nacional de Justicia and the Servicio Nacional de Contrataci\u00f3n P\u00fablica (SERCOP) are impartial authorities for the purposes of Article 190 paragraph 6 of this Agreement. The Servicio Nacional de Contrataci\u00f3n P\u00fablica is an autonomous body that has the authority to provide for the interim measures referred to Article 190, subparagraph 7(a) of this Agreement in procurement procedures and award of contracts exclusively in any procurement procedure subject to the Ley Org\u00e1nica del Sistema Nacional de Contrataci\u00f3n P\u00fablica (Organic Law on the National Public Procurement System).'\n\n\n\n\n\n\n(1)\nAll ministries, their bodies, institutions or administrative entities subordinate and attached to them are covered, except for the public undertakings listed in subsection 3 of this Annex.\n\n\n\n(2)\nTechnological Unbundling according the definition contained in Article 6, paragraph 10 of the Ley Org\u00e1nica del Sistema Nacional de Contrataci\u00f3n P\u00fablica (Organic Law for the National Public Procurement System). \n\n\n\n\n\nTop  \n\n\n\n\n\n\nEUROPEAN COMMISSION\nBrussels, 4.4.2016\nCOM(2016) 173 final\nANNEX\nto the\nProposal for a Council Decision\non the signing, on behalf of the European Union, and provisional application of the Protocol of Accession to the Trade Agreement  between the European Union and its Member States, of the one part, and Colombia and Peru, of the other part, to take account of the Accession of Ecuador\n\n\n\n\n\n\n\nANNEX XX\n\n\n(Joint Declarations made by Ecuador and the EU Party to be added following to the list of joint declarations by Colombia, Peru and the EU Party)\n\n\n'JOINT DECLARATIONS BY ECUADOR AND THE EU PARTY\n\n\nIntellectual Property Rights\n\n\nThe Parties reaffirm the rights and obligations under the WTO Agreement on Trade-Related Aspects of Intellectual Property Rights hereinafter referred to as 'TRIPS Agreement'. \n\n\nNo later than the date of entry into force of this Agreement, Ecuador will put in place fees and administrative costs for the registration and maintenance of intellectual property rights that are in line with the provisions of Article 62(4) of the TRIPS Agreement and at a level comparable with fees set by Intellectual Property offices of the other WTO Members. Ecuador commits to ensure national treatment of applications for protection of intellectual property rights in line with the TRIPS Agreement, in particular Articles 3 and 27(1) thereof. \n\n\nThe Parties reaffirm their commitment to the 'Declaration on the TRIPS Agreement and Public Health' adopted by the Doha WTO Ministerial Conference on 14 November 2001 and the right of the Parties to resort to the provisions in the TRIPS Agreement which provide flexibility for the purpose of protecting public health. For the process of issuing compulsory licences, Ecuador guarantees full compliance with the provisions and conditions for granting compulsory licences of the TRIPS Agreement, in particular Article 31 thereof, in the framework of its legal system.\n\n\nEcuador guarantees full compliance with the obligations established Article 61 of the TRIPS Agreement.\n\n\nThe Parties agree to review Ecuador\u2019s interest in having non-agricultural geographical indications protected with the same level of protection as wines, aromatized wines, spirits, agriculture products and foodstuffs in the context of the Sub-committee on Intellectual Property established in article 257 of the Agreement. If the European Union adopts specific legislation protecting non-agricultural geographical indications, the review referred to above shall take into account this new legal situation.\"\n\n\nMarket Access\n\n\nEcuador may continue to apply the measures listed below, including their modifications and regulations, provided that the said modifications and regulations do not create conditions that are discriminatory or more restrictive to trade.\n\n\na)The measures related to the application of taxes on alcoholic beverages in accordance with Articles 10 and 12 of Ley de Fomento Ambiental Optimizaci\u00f3n de Ingresos del Estado, published in the Official Gazette No. 583 of 24 November 2011, and Article 2 of Ley Org\u00e1nica de Incentivos para el Sector Productivo, published in the Second Supplement of the Official Gazette No. 56 of 12 August 2013, until two years after the entry into force of this Agreement. From the said date onwards, the measures must be in conformity with Title III (Trade in Goods) Chapter 1 (Market Access for Goods), and in particular Article 21 thereof;\n\n\nb)Measures relating to the import of used clothing, used footwear and used vehicles (COMEXI Resolution No. 182, COMEX Resolution No. 51). The need to maintain these measures shall be reviewed 5 years after the entry into force of this Agreement.'\n\n\n\n\n\nTop  \n  "
